Well... we were tired  ; ) So we took a few years off...
Then, in December 2018 inspiration struck Julia and GAIA was born. We started with a life-size clay sculpture, completed the 15-foot clay and had plans to bring GAIA to Burning Man 2020 at 40 feet x 12 feet, constructed of stainless steel rod based on a “flower of life” pattern (54,000 welded connections) and covered in stainless steel mesh with LED lighting effects. In front of her, a circular deck, at its center, a fire pit.

Marco designed a new build system that would enable hundreds of volunteers to help build her as a community. We had the 40-foot long wooden armature built and fully occupying our studio and were perfecting the metal placement system/volunteer training guidelines when COVID-19 arrived. Suddenly, everything changed. The world stopped. The build, of course...stopped. 



When shelter- in- place laws lifted, we implemented COVID-19 protocols and got back to work, with a few people at a time. We made progress and now, as the world is opening up, so are we. While it may not be the hundreds of people we envisioned, we have been able to welcome new crew over the past few months and we are thrilled with the results!


When it seemed as if Burning Man 2021 might happen we considered our options. What if there is Burning Man... What if there is no Burning Man...To go or not to go? ...It was a dilemma. We read compelling statements of intent from various theme camps and had many conversations with friends.
Ultimately, Marco's sculptures...collaborations with his models...are manifestations of emotional expression...art as a way to put missing energy in the world...art as a catalyst to social change... to inspire action. Ultimately, our decision was guided our belief that right now, the world needs GAIA energy. We need to take care of each other and our planet. We are one family. We need to focus on policies and practices that support and enhance this reality. That was true before COVID-19 and it is even more apparent now. 
For this reason,  we applied for a permit from the Bureau of Land Management to bring her to the playa the week of August 29-September 6, 2021. Unfortunately, we recently learned there will be no permits issued this year.  We are currently determining whether there is still some way to bring her to the playa, or elsewhere, in 2021.  Of course we also plan to bring her to TTID in 2022!  Either way, now is the time to finish her and we need your help!
GAIA'S FORM
Julia’s vision for GAIA was inspired by the joy she and her children experienced those times when, as a young mother, she took them to the beach and watched as they ran, jumped, dug, built castles, buried each other in the sand, made new friends and by her own memories of being that child. The bliss of creating and enjoying a supportive, connected and nurturing home base from which to launch ourselves and explore our strengths. A reminder of the symbiotic nature of our relationships with each other and with Mother Nature.
On the playa, GAIA is that place we are always looking for; a gathering space with good energy - a center to return to where we will likely run into people we know who are drawn there too...
Marco’s Musing on GAIA
There is an energy that has been expressing life for billions of years in an endless variety; an unbroken chain.
For mammals, the female, the mother, creates a continuous physical and emotional connection between the generations, born through the body, and then a caring and giving of energy and time to nurture each life.
Mothers... aware, connected, teaching, pushing, feeding, knowing.
This is the energy of GAIA.
An energy all life depends on; something so powerful, it’s scary.
Especially if you are a man, because you come from it but you are not it. And therein lies the problem. We live in a world dominated by men who fear the power of women. Not all men, but that is the prevailing energy.
Most human systems - cultural, religious, economic - have been specifically designed to dominate and control women. Think about it. The very thing we all depend on is devalued and suppressed at every turn. 
And the truth is, this energy, life, our planet as powerful as it is, is also fragile. It’s time to support the heroism of nurturers; to listen to the voices with a nurturing focus and tell that part of the human story. 
Our hope is that GAIA will inspire action in support of those policies that recognize we need to take care of each other and our planet....a thriving wage, universal healthcare, childcare, a green new deal...

WHAT'S DONE?
When everything shut down in March 2021, we had just completed building the wooden armature and had begun metal placement. We were still refining the system with crew leads Katy Boynton (Big Red), Al Stahler and Scott Ashkenaz (Smash): how to measure, cut, place and temporarily secure the metal to the armature, figuring out how best to train volunteers...and everything suddenly stopped. For a few months, no one came to the studio, except Marco who began building the face. Then, slowly, at the end of May, with the organizational support of Jenni Nelson, we started inviting crew back to the studio, a few people at a time, following strict protocols. By February 2021 we had completed the metal placement and exterior welding and grinding began. By the end of March 2021, we started to pull the wooden armature out and tackle the interior welding.  

Here is a video of Marco taking us on a walk around the studio showing GAIA's current status: youtu.be/Dx4Y6FiHpNM. To follow our build in real-time subscribe to Marco's YouTube Channel: youtube.com/c/marcocochranesculpture.
WHAT'S NEXT?
What's left you ask? We still have a lot of work to do before she is playa ready! It will be a challenge, but it's nothing we haven't done before! 
1. Complete the interior welding.
2. Electropolish each weld point.
3. Create and attach the hair.
4. Design and build the deck.
5. Design and build the firepit.
5. Marco will build the toes and hand using the pantograph (the enlargement tool from the 1600s used to build the sculptures of the Bliss Project).
6. Mesh placement on the exterior.
7. Test and prepare lighting system and design the lighting program.
Funds raised will go towards remaining materials, studio costs (which doubled due to COVID), transportation, engineering, insurance, and support of the installation crew on playa. Given there will be no Burning Man this year we will need funds to cover the costs of heavy equipment and other on playa conveniences previously provided by the org.
How Can You Help?
There are two ways you can help:
First - we need funds to support the build! We have raised 3/4 of the funds called for in our initial budget, and we need to raise at least the other quarter - not to mention our costs have significantly increased due to studio costs for the longer build. Specifically, our minimum budget funding gap is $50,000. (To cover all of the additional costs we have actually incurred to build GAIA due to COVID-related increases, we would need to raise an additional $146,000.) We have launched this Indiegogo page to help us close the gap and have great perks to offer as a show of our appreciation for your support. Please check them out and consider donating! We are fiscally sponsored, so donations are tax deductible to the extent allowed by law.
Second - you can actively participate in supporting the nurturers in your life and advocating for policies/laws that amplify nurturing energy. If you have any thoughts on how to further expand on this concept, or you have an idea that you think will align with GAIA, please contact us. We’d love to hear from you!

Risks & Challenges
For 2021, the risks and challenges are that things will change and safety concerns due to COVID-19 will impact our plans. There is also a chance that we will not be able to bring her to the playa in 2021 due to the Bureau of Land Management’s rules for 2021.  Either way, our plan is to bring GAIA to Burning Man in 2022. Our other challenge is raising the necessary funds.

The Bottom Line
Art can illuminate the human condition and be a catalyst to social change ...Our hope is to expand human consciousness and inspire men and women to take action to advocate for and take care of each other, our human family, thus allowing all of us to live fully and thrive! We are asking you to stand with us!
Thank you to everyone for the incredible support you have provided in the past, and to everyone who is considering supporting GAIA. There is just no way projects like this could happen without you!
Marco, Julia and the GAIA Crew
Please Join Us in Making GAIA a Reality, Donate Now, Spread the Word! #gaiatotheplaya2021
P.S. We have some great perks, stickers, t-shirts, sweatshirt, pendents, 2 or 4-inch mini-sculptures, experiences, a Plasma Popper!  Plus, our gratitude! Check it out!
P.P.S. Taking you back old school... here's one more of Bliss Dance for the road! ; ) 

Photo by Barry Toranto

story:
Hello! I am Iara Côrtes, illustrator, graphic designer and founder of the design studio laluli. I am thrilled that you are here to check out my project, so without further ado...



La Flora Tarot

La Flora Tarot is a botanical tarot deck based on the Rider Waite Smith system. It goes far beyond the aesthetics of plant drawings. La Flora Tarot is a true study on the correlation of plants and all the Tarot archetypes in a deep, meaningful way. More, much more, on this later!



Stylistically, La Flora is based on a highly curated selection of centuries old drawing masterpieces originally created for scientific purposes but pushing the edge on the realm of pure art. Far from being a collage, these botanical masterpieces were beautifully reproduced using a drawing technique called stippling. In its purest form, a stippled image is composed exclusively of dots. One must look at it at a precise distance to genuinely appreciate its richness. As such, stippling became the common thread weaving together all the art in La Flora Tarot.
 

 

Stippling, the art of drawing with dots only
 

La Flora Tarot goes beyond the deck. It is my humble yet firm belief that such a deep study and elegant rendition deserves to be experienced in more ways than one. Armed with this resolve, I set out to create a line of complementary items which would normally be expected from commended Tarot decks, such as a naturally hand dyed reading cloth, pin and a beautifully crafted tuck box. But that alone would just not do it! To truly experience La Flora Tarot and all the revelations about to unfold, the querent needed more. Ergo, the LFX – La Flora eXperience.

LFX - La Flora eXperience: prototype

La Flora Experience is an exclusive set bringing absolutely everything one could possibly dream of for an unprecedented Tarot session. From a tabletop Zen garden complete with black sand and rakes, to a bespoke oil blend, crystals and candle, the LFX has got you covered. To make this happen, I designed from scratch a set of wooden pieces, all modular in function, to contain all items, reveal their shape and assist with the entire reading session. Designing LFX was a great experience, as I had to cater for function as well as form. I was lucky to find some very talented people to collaborate with, in woodworking, fabric, metal and oil.


Designing the La Flora eXperience

Stemming from LFX, a few items such as the card holders and the wooden deck box  made their way into some of the reward tiers and add-on options. The idea being  to make some of the incredible LFX items available for the largest possible crowd to enjoy.

Then there is the whole research involving the La Flora symbol: the Four-Leaf Clover and its meaning... but enough “talking”. As it is commonly said, a picture speaks a thousand words, so here is a deluge of verbiage for your viewing pleasure. Still, I invite you to read along and dive deeper into the inspiration, concept and processes involved in the creation of La Flora Tarot. I am humbled by your attention and hopeful to have you as part of La Flora Tarot’s story.


Major Arcana


Suit Of Wands


Suit of Pentacles


Suit of Cups


Suit of Swords

The deck will be composed of 84 cards measuring 75 mm x 130 mm, printed in high quality, heavy linen stock, matte finished playing card medium. The 6 additional cards will be as follows:

A PDF Guidebook covering the ins and outs of plants and Tarot matching will be made available for download to all backers.

I must confess that despite some very intricate and elaborate deck boxes available in the market these days, I decided to stick with the traditional tuck box. The reason is two-fold: first, I personally love the classic, simplistic look of a tuck box, which bodes well with the minimalist approach taken in the whole project; second, if a no-holds barred box is what you are looking for, I have just that, the Wooden Box, available in specific tiers or as an add-on. The tuck box will be cellophane wrapped and feature a custom seal. Embossing is something I am toying with to help bring out the design a bit more.


La Flora Tarot Tuck Box - work in progress

Looking back to the beginnings of La Flora Tarot, I now realize how pivotal the essay “The Intelligence of the Flowers” by Maurice Maeterlinck was to me. One can never unlearn the brutality and beauty of the plant world and it is exactly the balance found in this dichotomy that creates the harmony we see from the outside. The author uses prose to describe scientific knowledge. “Writing with eloquence, Maeterlinck asserts that flowers possess the power of thought without knowledge, a capacity that constitutes a form of intelligence” - Unknown.

News of Spring, a collection of essays by Maurice Maeterlinck where I found "The Intelligence of The Flowers" & Still Life by Elias Van Den Broeck 1670-1708

As for myself, being a Brazilian and a Canadian, I had the chance to experience nature in two vastly different ways and that, in itself, was an eye opener. It truly helped shape my mind as to what the plant world really is all about and La Flora Tarot reflects this view.

Besides the fascinating struggle hidden behind each plant’s existence, I feel deeply touched by the beauty of botanical drawings and privileged (and slightly overwhelmed) by the sheer amount I managed to curate for La Flora.

The pillar of La Flora Tarot is the establishment of a meaningful and purposeful correlation between plants and each of the 78 cards of the Tarot. To achieve this goal, a long and thorough research delving into the botanical realm was required. The detailed analyses of hundreds of species in their minutia allowed  for the election, in the plant kingdom, of the perfect counterparts to each Tarot archetype. 


This task was enlightening to me and helped build up knowledge to formulate the vision of what I wanted La Flora Tarot to be. Some of the matches came naturally, even conspicuous, whereas others took considerably longer as they became a struggle between candidates and their qualities. In the end, plants and Tarot married in what I believe to be the closest possible concept of perfect harmony.

 

The choice of stippling serves both, a purpose and an intention. Since the curated drawings come from different eras, locations and artists, they lack stylistic cohesion. Stippling served as a unifying tool, establishing a common ground and weaving all pieces together. I also felt a deep sense of poetic justice, as each dot resembled tiny seeds, which, if victorious, would mature into a majestic plant! Then, there is stippling's inherit condition, as it resonates with me: Many a time, when too close to a subject matter, we cannot see clearly and must distance ourselves to make sense of it, but we cannot remain forever detached; we must reengage and act, promoting proximity yet again. This is what Stippling means to me, finding the best balance, the best perspective to appreciate art or life itself.


 

Even if less obvious, all design choices have a specific meaning. The colors, black on ecru, are a celebration of the eclectic and marvelous botanical drawings collected throughout History. The choice of style for the back of the cards comes from the Victorians, who left us an immense treasure trove of botanical drawings and their extravagantly adorned book covers. Last, but most definitely not least, the name La Flora is an homage to the Roman Goddess of Spring and Flowers.

Of all the steps required to create La Flora Tarot, none was more important or impactful than marrying plants and Tarot. I could try to describe how each card found its counterpart but that would be the guidebook in itself. Instead, I will present a simple case study on how Datura Metel came to represent The Devil.

The first step was to understand the plant’s characteristics to form a profile which could be used to match it to a Tarot card. In the case of the Datura Metel, its popular name, Devil’s Trumpet, is a clear indication of a potential best match. Even so, further investigation was required.

The Plant - Part of the Nightshade family, Datura is a plant known for its narcotic and hallucinogenic powers. Scopolamine and hyoscyamine, some extremely hazardous neurotoxins, are derived from Datura. Scopolamine is a tasteless and odorless mind-altering substance, fatal at high doses, but most notoriously known for producing loss of memory and hallucinations. Scopolamine acts by blocking neurotransmitters that carry information to the part of the brain responsible for storing short-term memory. Whatever happens to people under the effect of Scopolamine is simply not registered by the brain. One can easily imagine how terribly malicious the use of such substance could be, especially if the subject is unaware of it. Maybe diabolical would be the proper word to describe it.

The Tarot - The Devil might very well be the most dangerously powerful card in Tarot. It speaks of shadows we do not want to face, but must. The traditional interpretation of The Devil depicts it as a force of illusion and oppression. “The Devil’s power exists in the illusion that nothing else exists” - Rachel Pollack. Living in the dark hidden areas of the self, The Devil is powerful, controlling and persuasive while playing as a high skilled puppet master whom is hard to resist.

The Match - Again, sola dosis facit venenum. The Swiss alchemist Paracelsus is remembered for recognizing that the distinction between medicine and poison is a matter of dose. You might have encountered Scopolamine before since it is most used in transdermal plasters to treat travel sickness. So there are benefits to its use, whereas its abuse is something we are not even willing to contemplate. Illusion, materialism, misery: Are you The Devil or maybe its puppet? One must break his or her acquiescence or even willingness to live an illusion for the sake of being seemingly comfortable with the status quo to, instead, face the hard questions which must be asked and absorb the brutally honest answers required for change. The key to set oneself free from the Devil is, first and foremost, to acknowledge his existence.

I have always had great interest in the back of Tarot cards. People ask which card you look at first. For me, that would be the back of the cards. We stare at them for so long that they become the tone setter to whatever is about to be revealed on the other side. The way I see it, the back of the cards is paramount.

When deciding on what to draw for the back of La Flora’s cards, the question I tried to answer was: in a Botanical Tarot deck, which plant would better represent the feelings of love, hope, faith and wish for good luck permeated in every reading? I am not a superstitious person but the association of four-leaf clovers to good luck is so ingrained in our culture that it is hard to dismiss it. And, as it turns out, each leaf of a four-leaf clover is said to stand for love, hope, faith and luck.

My inquiry did not stop there though. I started to question what the idea of luck meant. I then discovered that Carl Jung viewed luck as synchronicity. He described luck as a meaningful coincidence. It is said that Jung held conversations with Einstein about the possible connection between synchronicity and the Theory of Relativity and Quantum Mechanics.


Diagram illustrating Carl Jung's concept of synchronicity

Jung believed that his thoughts about synchronicity proved the existence of the collective unconscious, defined as a species-typical repository of ancestral history and memory accumulated over evolutionary time. Comprising the collective unconscious is an array of archetypes - categories of objects, people and situations that have existed. In a sense, Jung claimed that our behavior is not a simple matter of reflexes and habits, but rather that each of us lives a myth in which archetypal characters, themes and settings play a role.

Altogether, I felt overwhelmingly compelled to see the four-leaf clover as the quintessential symbol of the La Flora Tarot, thus adorning many of the complementary items such as the wooden pieces, the reading cloth, pin and, especially, the Lucky Coin as, above all, it has the potential to become an instrument of synchronicity.

We are living through strange and difficult times. A pandemic claiming the lives of over 2.5 million people worldwide at the time of this writing, responsible for the spread of fear, anger, suffering and disruption throughout the entire planet. A time when racism, xenophobia and fascism are raising their ugly heads yet again. When Mother Earth shows her discontent and readiness to disregard our species entirely, if we keep pushing her boundaries. We are living through manipulative fake news turning society into puppets and narcissistic social media pretenders. Life has not been easy.


Yet, historically, we have never been so peaceful, so healthy, so wealthy and so safe. Technology continues to evolve at an incredible pace and the Arts are conquering new realms and audiences. "Miracles" of Science, Medicine and Infrastructure allowed us to reach record longevity. We have never been so connected, and with it comes a myriad of possibilities and opportunities for cooperation. Look no further! Here we are, connected, all over the world by our love of Tarot and plants, through a crowdfunding platform!

To me, the first step toward the light is to acknowledge the darkness. To reach enlightenment, we must first realize our ignorance. Only when we understand our faults and flaws, can we strive to improve. It is with this mindset that I decided to include two extra cards to La Flora Tarot: The Black and The Blank.

The wooden box for La Flora Tarot is made of quality wood, moisture and pressure treated. The wood type itself may vary based on availability at the time of fabrication but will always be strong, velvety and, as in the prototype, gorgeous!  

Wooden Box - Part of the "Hard Deck" Tier and also available as an add-on

The box was designed to fit the deck precisely, giving it a snug feel yet easy handling. The mirrored closing cut coupled with magnets makes it structurally sound and rigid to protect your deck for years on end. As the final touch, the box is engraved with La Flora’s four-leaf clover, to make it standout on every occasion.

La Flora has partnered with the plant-based, natural hand-dyer Katelyn, owner of byKellas, in Michigan, for the process of achieving the perfect hues, heft, size and fray for our linen reading cloth. Her ritual of dyeing is natural in essence. Clover, osage, pinecones and avocado pits are some of the raw materials she used for La Flora’s highly curated palette of seven distinct shades.

Katelyn's natural hand-dyeing process for La Flora Tarot's Reading Cloth

Each cloth, measuring approximately 65 x 65 cm (≈ 26 x 26 inches), is then manually stamped with La Flora’s signature clover at the center. This process produces unique variations, much like the Japanese wabi-sabi style, where the aesthetics of the “perfectly imperfect” reign.


One of the 7 shades for the La Flora Tarot Reading Cloth

Linen was chosen, as its history goes back to ancient civilizations. The fabric comes from the flax plant (lat. Linum), it is strong and longer-lasting than cotton or wool. And as with all good things, the cloth should reveal itself and have a better feel to it with time and use.

If I had to choose a single word to describe the four-leaf clover card holder set, that would have to be playful. Even though I have designed the set of 4 card holders with the clear intention of replicating La Flora’s four-leaf clover when placed against each other, the combinations in which it can be used is only limited by your creativity. 

Personally, I have been using them for a traditional 3-card reading of the day, with a fourth “intuition” card. This is how: I place the holders in the four-leaf clover position in a way that I can easily see the faces of three cards as I walk around the room. In the morning, I pull 4 cards with a specific intention in mind and reveal only 3 by placing them on the visible holders, leaving the 4th (the intuition card) unrevealed in the holder facing the wall. During the day, I get to see the 3 cards several times and each time I refresh my interpretation or even consider a new perspective on what those cards are trying to say to me. It is quite impressive how many facets we can find in such a trivial reading if we just give it enough time. Then, later in the day, when I feel I have developed a somewhat firm understanding of the 3 cards message, I finally reveal the “intuition” card and try to force my previous interpretation through the light of the this fourth card. I cannot translate into words the significance the intuition card has brought to my reading countless times, giving me that hard-sought for “a-ha” moment!

The wooden Four-Leaf Clover Card Holder Set can be purchased through the Standup Deck tier, the Complete Pack tier, as an add-on or in its special incarnation for the La Flora eXperience tier

The Lucky Coin, a constant reminder that you can make it lucky, will measure 44 mm x 44 mm (or 1.75 in x 1.75 in). Thickness should round about 3 mm, giving it a nice, hefty feeling without exaggeration and, as a final touch, edge engraving. 

The inner plate will be bordered with raised dots, evoking stippling and seeds. La Flora's four-leaf clover signature is the coin's main feature which will hopefully help guide you through day-to-day considerations when sitting down for a reading is not a possibility.

One of my most cherished items surrounding the La Flora Tarot is the Art Prints set. The prints come in a pack of 7 including:
- Empress
 - Lovers
- Wheel of Fortune
 - Tower
 - Star
 - Moon
 - Sun

4"x 6" Art Prints - Set of 7 - Available as add-ons or on the Lucky Coin and Complete Pack Tiers

I am fond of these prints, first and foremost, because I can use them to share a little bit of my passion with others. Whilst it would not make any sense to take cards of the deck to give to friends and family, I am certainly happy that I can send a print as a special gift to those who I know would appreciate it.

The Art Prints are versatile and can be used as decorative art prints (obviously!), as postcards, as bookmarks and, like I mentioned above, they make elegant and intimate gifts. The art is printed on 4”x 6” smooth stock with matte finish. 

LFX, or the La Flora eXperience, is a sensorial set of objects created to elevate the reading ritual with La Flora Tarot to the highest level. The uncompromised richness of the experience imposes a limited and exclusive production run to only 10 backers during the present campaign.

 


LFX - La Flora eXperience: prototype

The LFX is my way of bringing to you what I believe to be an incredible  and delightful experience to accompany the reading with the La Flora  Tarot. It all starts with the modular box,  a large, sturdy, velvety wooden box which houses all elements for the perfect La Flora Tarot reading experience. If you are anything like me,  you will want to have all the beautiful LFX items on display and ready  for use, especially with a bespoke four-leaf clover medallion at the  front! With this in mind, I made the box cover a reversible design which  will fit snuggly in the underside, helping elevate the box into a small  altar for the La Flora Zen garden display. Oh yes, have I mentioned that there is a Zen garden display with black sand, rakes and four raw tourmaline stones?!

Flipping the cover to turn the LFX box into an altar for the Zen garden display

The LFX comes with two La Flora Tarot decks: one in a beautifully designed wooden tabletop box and the other on a carrying wooden case. Both beautifully adorned with La Flora’s four-leaf clover emblem forged in black metal, differentiating them from the standard La Flora Tarot wooden deck box, whose clover is laser engraved. The tabletop box truly deserves a special display spot as a minimalist art piece which contains even more art, beauty and revelations inside awaiting those who dare to open it. Both the tabletop and the carrying case, follow on the footsteps of the modular box, featuring magnets for that gratifying tactile feeling when closing them.

Another item to receive special treatment was the ever so lovely and useful set of four card holders forming the four-leaf clover shape. The LFX version comes with four tourmaline marbles which rest perfectly on the tip of each holder’s carved surface, adding to the already stylish and versatile piece.

Besides touch and sight, the only other sense left for me to explore to help create a full experience was smell, and I held absolutely nothing back! On my side, I had the great aromachologist, Lorianne Anderson, from Spirit Element, to create a bespoke oil blend for La Flora Tarot with the explicit intention of achieving calmness and self-confidence. I discussed with her thoroughly about what I was aspiring and simply let her do her magic. The result is a deliciously sensuous and explicitly floral all-natural rose and jasmine oil blend which comes in an elegant and practical black apothecary jar. The soothing feeling and seductive scent will take you to a place of resolute peace, bar none. Also, a beeswax candle, colored black with vegetable dyes, works as an air purifier and emits a light close to the sunlight spectrum and will help set the mood for a holistic reading session.

Finally, the La Flora eXperience will include all complementary items available in this campaign, such as the reading cloth, the lucky coin, a set of seven La Flora Tarot art prints and whatever else gets unlocked by the Stretch Goals!

 

The La Flora Oracle will become a reality and that is a fact! The reason behind an Oracle deck is that, sometimes, I feel the Tarot can be a little too open-ended, as the complexity of interpretations and the experience and self-knowledge of reader and querent vary greatly. This gap is nicely filled by Oracle decks and, in this regard, I intentionally tried to make La Flora Oracle as action oriented as possible. Needless to say, the Oracle does not replace the Tarot by any stretch of imagination but makes for a welcome complement.


 

The La Flora Oracle does not come from thin air though. While creating La Flora Tarot, I had this moment when I found myself surrounded by newly acquired knowledge of so many plants; their peculiarities, struggles and successes; that suddenly, it became crystal clear how relatable the plants were to my own life story and that of so many people I know, personally or otherwise. The cherry on the top was that I already had such a vast collection of original drawings to work with, that everything fell in place perfectly towards the creation of La Flora Oracle.

All the artwork is finished and a prototype is in hand. Initially, I intended to launch both the Tarot and the Oracle in a single campaign but the first grew into a considerably greater project, making it wise to leave the latter for a separate, upcoming campaign. The decision to split the projects came naturally, as not only will I have the chance to get my feet wet with crowdfunding initiatives, but most importantly, the La Flora Oracle, is such an encompassing project, that it truly deserves its own campaign.


Tarot and Oracle card backs - Yin Yang

All orders will be shipped from the US by Fulfillrite, with the exception of the limited La Flora eXperience, which will be shipped by myself, from Canada.

The two most important things I wish to be very clear and upfront about:

* shipping will be charged separately in our pledge manager, during the final survey

* orders outside of the US might be subject to import fees/taxes at the Backer's expense

 

 

 

Risks and challenges

In these troubling times of COVID-19, a significant risk is, undoubtedly, the potential for delays in manufacturing and distribution. As of the time of this writing, I am being generous with shipping date estimates, allotting extra time based on current worldwide circumstances which, dynamic as they are, could improve or worsen without notice. I will thus react accordingly, applying any necessary adjustments and always making sure to communicate them promptly and honestly with all backers.

Having said that, we, as a collective global society, cannot blame everything on the pandemic for we do not live (and never have) in a perfect world. Whenever an idea is to be materialized into serial production for worldwide shipping, especially if using remote resources, mistakes which could cause delays and dissatisfaction might happen. Again, any vagaries in production and distribution will be dealt with openly and methodically.

To minimize risks and challenges, I am partnering exclusively with ethical and experienced companies and individuals. Most notably, the deck will be manufactured by Expert Playing Card Company, EPCC, a printer focused on quality and innovation, widely recognized for extraordinary decks made available on Kickstarter. On the distribution side, I will be working with Fulfillrite, an established 3PL whose reputation for proactiveness and vast experience fulfilling domestic (from the US) and international rewards for Kickstarter and Indiegogo campaigns sets a precedence for success.

Finally, I would be remiss if I did not mention that even though this is was my first Kickstarter and subsequent Indiegogo campaign, I do rely on my husband's guidance and expertise earned from operating his small business for the past 11 years, fulfilling over 14,000 custom-made orders shipped to 48 Countries around the world. This means we are no strangers to small scale manufacturing, logistics and customer service and, hopefully, this will help backers feel confident in our capacity to smooth out any unavoidable kinks along the way.
story_txt:
Hello! I am Iara Côrtes, illustrator, graphic designer and founder of the design studio laluli. I am thrilled that you are here to check out my project, so without further ado...La Flora TarotLa Flora Tarot is a botanical tarot deck based on the Rider Waite Smith system. It goes far beyond the aesthetics of plant drawings. La Flora Tarot is a true study on the correlation of plants and all the Tarot archetypes in a deep, meaningful way. More, much more, on this later!Stylistically, La Flora is based on a highly curated selection of centuries old drawing masterpieces originally created for scientific purposes but pushing the edge on the realm of pure art. Far from being a collage, these botanical masterpieces were beautifully reproduced using a drawing technique called stippling. In its purest form, a stippled image is composed exclusively of dots. One must look at it at a precise distance to genuinely appreciate its richness. As such, stippling became the common thread weaving together all the art in La Flora Tarot.  
Stippling, the art of drawing with dots only La Flora Tarot goes beyond the deck. It is my humble yet firm belief that such a deep study and elegant rendition deserves to be experienced in more ways than one. Armed with this resolve, I set out to create a line of complementary items which would normally be expected from commended Tarot decks, such as a naturally hand dyed reading cloth, pin and a beautifully crafted tuck box. But that alone would just not do it! To truly experience La Flora Tarot and all the revelations about to unfold, the querent needed more. Ergo, the LFX – La Flora eXperience.LFX - La Flora eXperience: prototypeLa Flora Experience is an exclusive set bringing absolutely everything one could possibly dream of for an unprecedented Tarot session. From a tabletop Zen garden complete with black sand and rakes, to a bespoke oil blend, crystals and candle, the LFX has got you covered. To make this happen, I designed from scratch a set of wooden pieces, all modular in function, to contain all items, reveal their shape and assist with the entire reading session. Designing LFX was a great experience, as I had to cater for function as well as form. I was lucky to find some very talented people to collaborate with, in woodworking, fabric, metal and oil.Designing the La Flora eXperienceStemming from LFX, a few items such as the card holders and the wooden deck box  made their way into some of the reward tiers and add-on options. The idea being  to make some of the incredible LFX items available for the largest possible crowd to enjoy.Then there is the whole research involving the La Flora symbol: the Four-Leaf Clover and its meaning... but enough “talking”. As it is commonly said, a picture speaks a thousand words, so here is a deluge of verbiage for your viewing pleasure. Still, I invite you to read along and dive deeper into the inspiration, concept and processes involved in the creation of La Flora Tarot. I am humbled by your attention and hopeful to have you as part of La Flora Tarot’s story.Major ArcanaSuit Of WandsSuit of PentaclesSuit of CupsSuit of SwordsThe deck will be composed of 84 cards measuring 75 mm x 130 mm, printed in high quality, heavy linen stock, matte finished playing card medium. The 6 additional cards will be as follows:A PDF Guidebook covering the ins and outs of plants and Tarot matching will be made available for download to all backers.I must confess that despite some very intricate and elaborate deck boxes available in the market these days, I decided to stick with the traditional tuck box. The reason is two-fold: first, I personally love the classic, simplistic look of a tuck box, which bodes well with the minimalist approach taken in the whole project; second, if a no-holds barred box is what you are looking for, I have just that, the Wooden Box, available in specific tiers or as an add-on. The tuck box will be cellophane wrapped and feature a custom seal. Embossing is something I am toying with to help bring out the design a bit more.La Flora Tarot Tuck Box - work in progressLooking back to the beginnings of La Flora Tarot, I now realize how pivotal the essay “The Intelligence of the Flowers” by Maurice Maeterlinck was to me. One can never unlearn the brutality and beauty of the plant world and it is exactly the balance found in this dichotomy that creates the harmony we see from the outside. The author uses prose to describe scientific knowledge. “Writing with eloquence, Maeterlinck asserts that flowers possess the power of thought without knowledge, a capacity that constitutes a form of intelligence” - Unknown.News of Spring, a collection of essays by Maurice Maeterlinck where I found "The Intelligence of The Flowers" & Still Life by Elias Van Den Broeck 1670-1708As for myself, being a Brazilian and a Canadian, I had the chance to experience nature in two vastly different ways and that, in itself, was an eye opener. It truly helped shape my mind as to what the plant world really is all about and La Flora Tarot reflects this view.Besides the fascinating struggle hidden behind each plant’s existence, I feel deeply touched by the beauty of botanical drawings and privileged (and slightly overwhelmed) by the sheer amount I managed to curate for La Flora.The pillar of La Flora Tarot is the establishment of a meaningful and purposeful correlation between plants and each of the 78 cards of the Tarot. To achieve this goal, a long and thorough research delving into the botanical realm was required. The detailed analyses of hundreds of species in their minutia allowed  for the election, in the plant kingdom, of the perfect counterparts to each Tarot archetype. This task was enlightening to me and helped build up knowledge to formulate the vision of what I wanted La Flora Tarot to be. Some of the matches came naturally, even conspicuous, whereas others took considerably longer as they became a struggle between candidates and their qualities. In the end, plants and Tarot married in what I believe to be the closest possible concept of perfect harmony. The choice of stippling serves both, a purpose and an intention. Since the curated drawings come from different eras, locations and artists, they lack stylistic cohesion. Stippling served as a unifying tool, establishing a common ground and weaving all pieces together. I also felt a deep sense of poetic justice, as each dot resembled tiny seeds, which, if victorious, would mature into a majestic plant! Then, there is stippling's inherit condition, as it resonates with me: Many a time, when too close to a subject matter, we cannot see clearly and must distance ourselves to make sense of it, but we cannot remain forever detached; we must reengage and act, promoting proximity yet again. This is what Stippling means to me, finding the best balance, the best perspective to appreciate art or life itself.
 Even if less obvious, all design choices have a specific meaning. The colors, black on ecru, are a celebration of the eclectic and marvelous botanical drawings collected throughout History. The choice of style for the back of the cards comes from the Victorians, who left us an immense treasure trove of botanical drawings and their extravagantly adorned book covers. Last, but most definitely not least, the name La Flora is an homage to the Roman Goddess of Spring and Flowers.Of all the steps required to create La Flora Tarot, none was more important or impactful than marrying plants and Tarot. I could try to describe how each card found its counterpart but that would be the guidebook in itself. Instead, I will present a simple case study on how Datura Metel came to represent The Devil.The first step was to understand the plant’s characteristics to form a profile which could be used to match it to a Tarot card. In the case of the Datura Metel, its popular name, Devil’s Trumpet, is a clear indication of a potential best match. Even so, further investigation was required.The Plant - Part of the Nightshade family, Datura is a plant known for its narcotic and hallucinogenic powers. Scopolamine and hyoscyamine, some extremely hazardous neurotoxins, are derived from Datura. Scopolamine is a tasteless and odorless mind-altering substance, fatal at high doses, but most notoriously known for producing loss of memory and hallucinations. Scopolamine acts by blocking neurotransmitters that carry information to the part of the brain responsible for storing short-term memory. Whatever happens to people under the effect of Scopolamine is simply not registered by the brain. One can easily imagine how terribly malicious the use of such substance could be, especially if the subject is unaware of it. Maybe diabolical would be the proper word to describe it.The Tarot - The Devil might very well be the most dangerously powerful card in Tarot. It speaks of shadows we do not want to face, but must. The traditional interpretation of The Devil depicts it as a force of illusion and oppression. “The Devil’s power exists in the illusion that nothing else exists” - Rachel Pollack. Living in the dark hidden areas of the self, The Devil is powerful, controlling and persuasive while playing as a high skilled puppet master whom is hard to resist.The Match - Again, sola dosis facit venenum. The Swiss alchemist Paracelsus is remembered for recognizing that the distinction between medicine and poison is a matter of dose. You might have encountered Scopolamine before since it is most used in transdermal plasters to treat travel sickness. So there are benefits to its use, whereas its abuse is something we are not even willing to contemplate. Illusion, materialism, misery: Are you The Devil or maybe its puppet? One must break his or her acquiescence or even willingness to live an illusion for the sake of being seemingly comfortable with the status quo to, instead, face the hard questions which must be asked and absorb the brutally honest answers required for change. The key to set oneself free from the Devil is, first and foremost, to acknowledge his existence.I have always had great interest in the back of Tarot cards. People ask which card you look at first. For me, that would be the back of the cards. We stare at them for so long that they become the tone setter to whatever is about to be revealed on the other side. The way I see it, the back of the cards is paramount.When deciding on what to draw for the back of La Flora’s cards, the question I tried to answer was: in a Botanical Tarot deck, which plant would better represent the feelings of love, hope, faith and wish for good luck permeated in every reading? I am not a superstitious person but the association of four-leaf clovers to good luck is so ingrained in our culture that it is hard to dismiss it. And, as it turns out, each leaf of a four-leaf clover is said to stand for love, hope, faith and luck.My inquiry did not stop there though. I started to question what the idea of luck meant. I then discovered that Carl Jung viewed luck as synchronicity. He described luck as a meaningful coincidence. It is said that Jung held conversations with Einstein about the possible connection between synchronicity and the Theory of Relativity and Quantum Mechanics.Diagram illustrating Carl Jung's concept of synchronicityJung believed that his thoughts about synchronicity proved the existence of the collective unconscious, defined as a species-typical repository of ancestral history and memory accumulated over evolutionary time. Comprising the collective unconscious is an array of archetypes - categories of objects, people and situations that have existed. In a sense, Jung claimed that our behavior is not a simple matter of reflexes and habits, but rather that each of us lives a myth in which archetypal characters, themes and settings play a role.Altogether, I felt overwhelmingly compelled to see the four-leaf clover as the quintessential symbol of the La Flora Tarot, thus adorning many of the complementary items such as the wooden pieces, the reading cloth, pin and, especially, the Lucky Coin as, above all, it has the potential to become an instrument of synchronicity.We are living through strange and difficult times. A pandemic claiming the lives of over 2.5 million people worldwide at the time of this writing, responsible for the spread of fear, anger, suffering and disruption throughout the entire planet. A time when racism, xenophobia and fascism are raising their ugly heads yet again. When Mother Earth shows her discontent and readiness to disregard our species entirely, if we keep pushing her boundaries. We are living through manipulative fake news turning society into puppets and narcissistic social media pretenders. Life has not been easy.Yet, historically, we have never been so peaceful, so healthy, so wealthy and so safe. Technology continues to evolve at an incredible pace and the Arts are conquering new realms and audiences. "Miracles" of Science, Medicine and Infrastructure allowed us to reach record longevity. We have never been so connected, and with it comes a myriad of possibilities and opportunities for cooperation. Look no further! Here we are, connected, all over the world by our love of Tarot and plants, through a crowdfunding platform!To me, the first step toward the light is to acknowledge the darkness. To reach enlightenment, we must first realize our ignorance. Only when we understand our faults and flaws, can we strive to improve. It is with this mindset that I decided to include two extra cards to La Flora Tarot: The Black and The Blank.The wooden box for La Flora Tarot is made of quality wood, moisture and pressure treated. The wood type itself may vary based on availability at the time of fabrication but will always be strong, velvety and, as in the prototype, gorgeous!  Wooden Box - Part of the "Hard Deck" Tier and also available as an add-onThe box was designed to fit the deck precisely, giving it a snug feel yet easy handling. The mirrored closing cut coupled with magnets makes it structurally sound and rigid to protect your deck for years on end. As the final touch, the box is engraved with La Flora’s four-leaf clover, to make it standout on every occasion.La Flora has partnered with the plant-based, natural hand-dyer Katelyn, owner of byKellas, in Michigan, for the process of achieving the perfect hues, heft, size and fray for our linen reading cloth. Her ritual of dyeing is natural in essence. Clover, osage, pinecones and avocado pits are some of the raw materials she used for La Flora’s highly curated palette of seven distinct shades.Katelyn's natural hand-dyeing process for La Flora Tarot's Reading ClothEach cloth, measuring approximately 65 x 65 cm (≈ 26 x 26 inches), is then manually stamped with La Flora’s signature clover at the center. This process produces unique variations, much like the Japanese wabi-sabi style, where the aesthetics of the “perfectly imperfect” reign.One of the 7 shades for the La Flora Tarot Reading ClothLinen was chosen, as its history goes back to ancient civilizations. The fabric comes from the flax plant (lat. Linum), it is strong and longer-lasting than cotton or wool. And as with all good things, the cloth should reveal itself and have a better feel to it with time and use.If I had to choose a single word to describe the four-leaf clover card holder set, that would have to be playful. Even though I have designed the set of 4 card holders with the clear intention of replicating La Flora’s four-leaf clover when placed against each other, the combinations in which it can be used is only limited by your creativity. Personally, I have been using them for a traditional 3-card reading of the day, with a fourth “intuition” card. This is how: I place the holders in the four-leaf clover position in a way that I can easily see the faces of three cards as I walk around the room. In the morning, I pull 4 cards with a specific intention in mind and reveal only 3 by placing them on the visible holders, leaving the 4th (the intuition card) unrevealed in the holder facing the wall. During the day, I get to see the 3 cards several times and each time I refresh my interpretation or even consider a new perspective on what those cards are trying to say to me. It is quite impressive how many facets we can find in such a trivial reading if we just give it enough time. Then, later in the day, when I feel I have developed a somewhat firm understanding of the 3 cards message, I finally reveal the “intuition” card and try to force my previous interpretation through the light of the this fourth card. I cannot translate into words the significance the intuition card has brought to my reading countless times, giving me that hard-sought for “a-ha” moment!The wooden Four-Leaf Clover Card Holder Set can be purchased through the Standup Deck tier, the Complete Pack tier, as an add-on or in its special incarnation for the La Flora eXperience tierThe Lucky Coin, a constant reminder that you can make it lucky, will measure 44 mm x 44 mm (or 1.75 in x 1.75 in). Thickness should round about 3 mm, giving it a nice, hefty feeling without exaggeration and, as a final touch, edge engraving. The inner plate will be bordered with raised dots, evoking stippling and seeds. La Flora's four-leaf clover signature is the coin's main feature which will hopefully help guide you through day-to-day considerations when sitting down for a reading is not a possibility.One of my most cherished items surrounding the La Flora Tarot is the Art Prints set. The prints come in a pack of 7 including:- Empress - Lovers- Wheel of Fortune - Tower - Star - Moon - Sun4"x 6" Art Prints - Set of 7 - Available as add-ons or on the Lucky Coin and Complete Pack TiersI am fond of these prints, first and foremost, because I can use them to share a little bit of my passion with others. Whilst it would not make any sense to take cards of the deck to give to friends and family, I am certainly happy that I can send a print as a special gift to those who I know would appreciate it.The Art Prints are versatile and can be used as decorative art prints (obviously!), as postcards, as bookmarks and, like I mentioned above, they make elegant and intimate gifts. The art is printed on 4”x 6” smooth stock with matte finish. LFX, or the La Flora eXperience, is a sensorial set of objects created to elevate the reading ritual with La Flora Tarot to the highest level. The uncompromised richness of the experience imposes a limited and exclusive production run to only 10 backers during the present campaign. LFX - La Flora eXperience: prototypeThe LFX is my way of bringing to you what I believe to be an incredible  and delightful experience to accompany the reading with the La Flora  Tarot. It all starts with the modular box,  a large, sturdy, velvety wooden box which houses all elements for the perfect La Flora Tarot reading experience. If you are anything like me,  you will want to have all the beautiful LFX items on display and ready  for use, especially with a bespoke four-leaf clover medallion at the  front! With this in mind, I made the box cover a reversible design which  will fit snuggly in the underside, helping elevate the box into a small  altar for the La Flora Zen garden display. Oh yes, have I mentioned that there is a Zen garden display with black sand, rakes and four raw tourmaline stones?!Flipping the cover to turn the LFX box into an altar for the Zen garden displayThe LFX comes with two La Flora Tarot decks: one in a beautifully designed wooden tabletop box and the other on a carrying wooden case. Both beautifully adorned with La Flora’s four-leaf clover emblem forged in black metal, differentiating them from the standard La Flora Tarot wooden deck box, whose clover is laser engraved. The tabletop box truly deserves a special display spot as a minimalist art piece which contains even more art, beauty and revelations inside awaiting those who dare to open it. Both the tabletop and the carrying case, follow on the footsteps of the modular box, featuring magnets for that gratifying tactile feeling when closing them.Another item to receive special treatment was the ever so lovely and useful set of four card holders forming the four-leaf clover shape. The LFX version comes with four tourmaline marbles which rest perfectly on the tip of each holder’s carved surface, adding to the already stylish and versatile piece.Besides touch and sight, the only other sense left for me to explore to help create a full experience was smell, and I held absolutely nothing back! On my side, I had the great aromachologist, Lorianne Anderson, from Spirit Element, to create a bespoke oil blend for La Flora Tarot with the explicit intention of achieving calmness and self-confidence. I discussed with her thoroughly about what I was aspiring and simply let her do her magic. The result is a deliciously sensuous and explicitly floral all-natural rose and jasmine oil blend which comes in an elegant and practical black apothecary jar. The soothing feeling and seductive scent will take you to a place of resolute peace, bar none. Also, a beeswax candle, colored black with vegetable dyes, works as an air purifier and emits a light close to the sunlight spectrum and will help set the mood for a holistic reading session.Finally, the La Flora eXperience will include all complementary items available in this campaign, such as the reading cloth, the lucky coin, a set of seven La Flora Tarot art prints and whatever else gets unlocked by the Stretch Goals! The La Flora Oracle will become a reality and that is a fact! The reason behind an Oracle deck is that, sometimes, I feel the Tarot can be a little too open-ended, as the complexity of interpretations and the experience and self-knowledge of reader and querent vary greatly. This gap is nicely filled by Oracle decks and, in this regard, I intentionally tried to make La Flora Oracle as action oriented as possible. Needless to say, the Oracle does not replace the Tarot by any stretch of imagination but makes for a welcome complement.
 The La Flora Oracle does not come from thin air though. While creating La Flora Tarot, I had this moment when I found myself surrounded by newly acquired knowledge of so many plants; their peculiarities, struggles and successes; that suddenly, it became crystal clear how relatable the plants were to my own life story and that of so many people I know, personally or otherwise. The cherry on the top was that I already had such a vast collection of original drawings to work with, that everything fell in place perfectly towards the creation of La Flora Oracle.All the artwork is finished and a prototype is in hand. Initially, I intended to launch both the Tarot and the Oracle in a single campaign but the first grew into a considerably greater project, making it wise to leave the latter for a separate, upcoming campaign. The decision to split the projects came naturally, as not only will I have the chance to get my feet wet with crowdfunding initiatives, but most importantly, the La Flora Oracle, is such an encompassing project, that it truly deserves its own campaign.Tarot and Oracle card backs - Yin YangAll orders will be shipped from the US by Fulfillrite, with the exception of the limited La Flora eXperience, which will be shipped by myself, from Canada.The two most important things I wish to be very clear and upfront about:* shipping will be charged separately in our pledge manager, during the final survey* orders outside of the US might be subject to import fees/taxes at the Backer's expense   Risks and challengesIn these troubling times of COVID-19, a significant risk is, undoubtedly, the potential for delays in manufacturing and distribution. As of the time of this writing, I am being generous with shipping date estimates, allotting extra time based on current worldwide circumstances which, dynamic as they are, could improve or worsen without notice. I will thus react accordingly, applying any necessary adjustments and always making sure to communicate them promptly and honestly with all backers.Having said that, we, as a collective global society, cannot blame everything on the pandemic for we do not live (and never have) in a perfect world. Whenever an idea is to be materialized into serial production for worldwide shipping, especially if using remote resources, mistakes which could cause delays and dissatisfaction might happen. Again, any vagaries in production and distribution will be dealt with openly and methodically.To minimize risks and challenges, I am partnering exclusively with ethical and experienced companies and individuals. Most notably, the deck will be manufactured by Expert Playing Card Company, EPCC, a printer focused on quality and innovation, widely recognized for extraordinary decks made available on Kickstarter. On the distribution side, I will be working with Fulfillrite, an established 3PL whose reputation for proactiveness and vast experience fulfilling domestic (from the US) and international rewards for Kickstarter and Indiegogo campaigns sets a precedence for success.Finally, I would be remiss if I did not mention that even though this is was my first Kickstarter and subsequent Indiegogo campaign, I do rely on my husband's guidance and expertise earned from operating his small business for the past 11 years, fulfilling over 14,000 custom-made orders shipped to 48 Countries around the world. This means we are no strangers to small scale manufacturing, logistics and customer service and, hopefully, this will help backers feel confident in our capacity to smooth out any unavoidable kinks along the way.

story:
What is the Lorelsberg Creative Planner?

The Lorelsberg Creative planner is a 12-month, undated planner, ready for you to colour and decorate to really make it your own. Like take your art supplies and go nuts!

Over 144 unique pages of creative playground

It has 12 unique months, each with a monthly overview and 5 unique weekly spreads, and a blank page in between for you to go crazy on.

It is completely undated. So you can start any month of the year. And you can start your week on Monday or Sunday.

Each month’s theme tells a different story, which all tie together into one epic tale of discovery and adventure… 

It’s printed on 150gsm uncoated paper, stitched and lies flat, so it can keep up with your weapon of choice!

  • Coloured Pencils 
  • Brush Pens
  • Fine Liners
  • Highlighters
  • Acrylic Pens

Even Watercolours (to an extent if you don't soak it in too much water)

However, don't use alcohol-based markers on it. That stuff will bleed through anything!

Why did I make it? Who is it for?

I got into creative Bullet Journaling a few years ago. 

You know, where you take a notebook and set up your own calendar each month with a different theme, nice drawings and stuff. 

I couldn’t keep it up for very long, because it takes a lot of time, and really who has that after work, and family, and laundry, and dishes… 

I realised that there are a lot of people who would really enjoy getting creative, but that don’t have the time or feel like they can’t draw well enough.

So I decided to take the time to design a full year planner for you so that you don’t have to worry about the set-up and you just get to enjoy the fun part. Colours, washi tapes, and stickers!

How do you use it?

However you want. Seriously. 

  • For Daily Chores
  • With the Bullet Journal Method
  • Daily Doodles
  • Journaling
  • Art Journalling
  • Photo Journalling
  • Drawing a picture of a cat each day

It's yours to make your own. It doesn't have to look pretty or be super instagrammable in the end. What's important is that you have fun with it and enjoy your creative side.

What do I need the money for?

So yes, it’s pretty awesome and I’m super excited about it. I want to get this to all you stationery lovers out there who want to join in the fun. 

But to do this, I’ll first need to get a whole lot of them printed. Which costs quite a bit of money, but the good news is, the more you print the cheaper it gets.

And that’s where you come in.

Help me fund the production of the Lorelsberg Creative Planner, and get one for yourself while you’re at, or two, or three.

Thank you so much!

story:
Welcome to my 2021 Indiegogo Sketchbook campaign. 

My name is Gary Shipman, and I have been making art for more than 30 years working with properties from comics, movies and other. I'm probably best known for my comic book series Titan Mouse of Might and Pakkins' Land. I have been nominated for Eisner, Harvey, and Russ Manning Awards. My work has been published through Disney Publishing, Caliber Press, Image Comics, Cryptozoic, Upper Deck, and Zondervan. I have been exploring different styles of art throughout my life, with no formal art training. 

I am excited to share this campaign for my 2021 sketchbook entitled Conundrum, This volume collects some of my pieces of art in black & white and full color in an 8.5" x 11" large format, 100-page, softbound edition (If we meet our 1st stretch goal it will be made into a hardbound edition).

  

My expression in art means nothing without all of you to share it with. Your support means more than you know, it helps me to keep doing the art I love. So thank you for all you do. 

Providing a quality product is the goal. I hope you are as excited about this campaign as I am. I need enough for the printing, distribution, and fees to create this sketchbook. Anything beyond that helps to make other projects possible. 

The perks are simple, and the prices as low as possible:

• $10 DIGITAL: gets you a Digital Download my Conundrum Sketchbook.

• $25 SKETCHBOOK: gets you a signed copy of the Conundrum Sketchbook. All Stretch Goals Included.

• $100: gets you an original hand drawn piece of art inside a signed copy of the Conundrum Sketchbook. All Stretch Goals Included.

Please check the perks out for more specific details!

• $1K STRETCH GOAL -  UNLOCKED - Upgrade Sketchbook to Hardbound Edition.

• $1.3K STRETCH GOAL -  LOCKED - All physical book backers will get a Signed & Numbered Titan Plushie Design Artwork Limited Edition Print. 

• $2K STRETCH GOAL -  LOCKED - Free Head sketch to physical book backers hand drawn in their copy of the Conundrum Sketchbook.

Some Ways You Can Help
If you like this campaign and just want to help you can, by getting the word out and sharing on your social media!

Thank you for checking out the project.
story_txt:
Welcome to my 2021 Indiegogo Sketchbook campaign. 
My name is Gary Shipman, and I have been making art for more than 30 years working with properties from comics, movies and other. I'm probably best known for my comic book series Titan Mouse of Might and Pakkins' Land. I have been nominated for Eisner, Harvey, and Russ Manning Awards. My work has been published through Disney Publishing, Caliber Press, Image Comics, Cryptozoic, Upper Deck, and Zondervan. I have been exploring different styles of art throughout my life, with no formal art training. I am excited to share this campaign for my 2021 sketchbook entitled Conundrum, This volume collects some of my pieces of art in black & white and full color in an 8.5" x 11" large format, 100-page, softbound edition (If we meet our 1st stretch goal it will be made into a hardbound edition).  My expression in art means nothing without all of you to share it with. Your support means more than you know, it helps me to keep doing the art I love. So thank you for all you do. Providing a quality product is the goal. I hope you are as excited about this campaign as I am. I need enough for the printing, distribution, and fees to create this sketchbook. Anything beyond that helps to make other projects possible. The perks are simple, and the prices as low as possible:• $10 DIGITAL: gets you a Digital Download my Conundrum Sketchbook.• $25 SKETCHBOOK: gets you a signed copy of the Conundrum Sketchbook. All Stretch Goals Included.• $100: gets you an original hand drawn piece of art inside a signed copy of the Conundrum Sketchbook. All Stretch Goals Included.Please check the perks out for more specific details!• $1K STRETCH GOAL -  UNLOCKED - Upgrade Sketchbook to Hardbound Edition.• $1.3K STRETCH GOAL -  LOCKED - All physical book backers will get a Signed & Numbered Titan Plushie Design Artwork Limited Edition Print. • $2K STRETCH GOAL -  LOCKED - Free Head sketch to physical book backers hand drawn in their copy of the Conundrum Sketchbook.Some Ways You Can HelpIf you like this campaign and just want to help you can, by getting the word out and sharing on your social media!Thank you for checking out the project.

story:
Ave Satanas!

We are Belzebubs, the monochromatic occult visionaries hailing from the mystic North. You might know us from our melodic second-wave black metal with a hint of death and rhubarb, our award-winning animated music videos or the comic documentary published via our social media accounts.

The corona outbreak has hit us hard. We have been working on getting our show on the road for over eight months, but have now been forced to cancel our upcoming concerts in Hellfest, Wacken, Summer Breeze, etc., leaving us 50 000 euros in debt. We do not wish to spoil the surprise of our live gigs entirely, but we can say that we've invested in the stage setup, costumes, 3D animation, and needed to cover motion capture studios, recording and numerous other expenses.

We are doing our best to drag ourselves back from this debt, and to be honest, we'd appreciate your help from the bottom of our blast-beating black hearts. We do not wish to make a simple GoFundMe campaign, but actually give something back in return, so we came up with the idea to offer our loyal cult an experience that could serve as a small replacement for our missing live shows — an immersive 360° music video of us performing a couple of songs, placing you in the audience, front row, dead center!
 


So what do you say...would you want to turn your back on the light of day and walk with us in the shadows?
 

Join the kvlt!

What we need & what you get

Our goal is to both make up for our losses and produce this stunning VR video in return, meaning that we're aiming for 22 000 euros to get this running. Over the past few months, we've been able to cover part of the pre-production costs ourselves, with the help of our record label Century Media and through Backstage Rock Shop's t-shirt campaign, but we're still lacking 30 000 euros. We don't expect to recover from this blow on this campaign alone, but we hope it'll help us create new content for you guys, our loyal cult. 

And this is exactly the thing: if we end up getting more, you'll be getting more, because we're pushing all income into the belzebusiness and we have a lot of stretch goals and ideas just waiting to be unlocked.
 


 

  • The 360° Hexperience | 22 000€ [reached!]: For 22 grand we'll be able to cover a third of the remaining live pre-production costs and fund this animated two-song 360° video, an experience you'll hopefully love as much as we do. The 360° show itself shall be viewable on a computer, tablet, smart phones and VR goggles, the latter naturally providing the most immersive experience.
     
  • Stereoscopy that | 25 000€ [reached!]: With this amount we'll be able to pamper your eyeballs with a hi-resolution stereoscopic version of the VR gig!
     
  • Encore! | 30 000€ [reached!]: For thirty thousand we'll be able to extend the animated gig to three songs!
     
  • Stick 'em up | 35 000€ [reached!]: With 35k we'll be able to cover half of the remaining pre-production costs and whip up a set of animated Belzebubs gif stickers for you guys!
     
  • Play it again, Sam | 45 000€: This amount will help us create a drum playthrough/tutorial video with Samaël!
     
  • New toons for new tunes | 66 600€: One can dream, right? This amount would make us debt-free, and grant us a bigger budget for the next music video: a new track from our upcoming album.


And the list goes on. If we don't meet the first goal, your money will be refunded, of course.


And the perks?

The following are explained more thoroughly in the Perks section, but here's a quick summary:

  • For 10€ you'll get access to the 360° video, your name in the end credits as part of the "Crowd" and our eternal gratitude. Estimated delivery for the video is November–December 2020.
     
  • For 25€ you get the previous perks + the updates on how things are progressing (with pics and videos). You also get to collaborate in the making of the video (by voting & commenting).
     
  • For 50€ you get all the previous stuff + access to a live chat on the day the 360° Hexperience drops online + monthly voicemails from Hubbath, where he brings you the latest tidings from the BB camp and the 360° preparations + a 32 page PDF booklet about the production with sketches, designs, commentary and bloopers + your name in the credits as part of the "Backstage Crew". Estimated delivery for the PDF is December 2020–January 2021.
     
  • For 100€ you get to be part of the show's soundscape. Send us your chants, your screams and whatever you wish to shout out to the band, and we'll insert your voice recordings into the video and credit you under the "Voice Cast". Also includes all previous perks.
     
  • For 300€ you get a "ticket" to the gig, meaning you'll appear as a hand-drawn character on the VR show’s LED screen. You'll also receive the digital file of your character (for non-commercial use), drawn by JP Ahonen, the author of Belzebubs, and most of the previous perks with a "Supporting Cast" title in the credits. This is limited to 20 people.
     
  • For the ultimate 500€ contribution, you'll become an animated 3D character in the audience, front and center, designed by the 360° Hexperience's MVP, 3D animator Oscar Díaz Castillo. You'll get a pack of images of your 3D alter ego to do as you please, be credited as part of the "Lead Cast" plus most of the previous goods. This is limited to 5 people.
 


Keep talking...

Well, that's really it in a nutshell. We're trying to cover the pre-production costs from the live gigs while simultaneously producing something new for you and making up for the concerts this pandemic has cancelled. We aim to get the 360° Hexperience out in time for Halloween, so you could get your corpse paint ready, knock back a few belzebrews with your mates and enjoy the show. Fingers crossed, inverted and ablaze for that.

If you can't support us through Indiegogo, don't worry. We appreciate all your help and support anyhow, so simply holding the Belzebubs flag high and spreading the news already means a lot. And if you wish, you can also check out our official store at Backstage Rock Shop, we have all sorts of merch available.

Anyhow, thank you so much, take care, stay safe, wash your hooves and remember to satanize the house.


This campaign is run by Belzebubs creator JP Ahonen through the band's management Shortcut Consulting Ltd. For questions concerning the project, please check out the FAQ section or contact Belzebubs. For press & interview enquiries, please contact manager Antje Lange.

story:
The White Fly Tarot comprises 78 cards created for divinatory purpose.

The measures of the cards are:  2.75 x 4.72" (inches) and 7 cm x 12 cm (centimeters)

 

This deck narrative derives from both Fantasy and Grotesque themes, it summarizes 10 years of my career as an illustrator full time job.

It is housed in a printed box with a cover.

A special guidebook accompanies the deck and provides meaning for all cards in their upright and reversed positions. Languages: English, Italian and French.

 

MAJOR ARCANA

 

Set of Pages, Knights, Queens & Kings

 

Set of Cups

 

Set of Wands

 

Set of Pentacles

 

 

Set of Swords

 

 

Close-up on the cards
