story:
My first job was driving a New York City taxi.

I drove a Checker Cab; The front seat had so much room it could have been a sub-let.  I always had my Nikon up there with me, and I used it every day.

I never stopped.

I knew from the age of nine that I wanted to take pictures. Seeing the catalog from the 1972 Diane Arbus retrospective at the Met blew my little mind.

I didn't know that it was even possible to make images like that. Then I discovered Josef Koudelka, Lisette Model, Bresson, Stephen Shore, Francesca Woodman, Meyerowitz, and Lee Friedlander. My camera club aesthetic got the boot, and I never looked back. It was to be many years before I found my eye, but now I knew the direction I was going.

In 1978 I was accepted to Lisette Model's master class at the New School. I also attended the School of Visual Arts, and I continued driving a cab while doing so.

For forty years, I've been quietly documenting the people, streets, and subways of New York City. I didn't talk about it much or show my work to very many people. As a young man, I knew there would be a time when I was an older (exceptionally handsome) man to give my images the attention needed for them to have a life out in the world.



"Women Hold Up Half the Sky" is my second book about New York City. It is a loving tribute to the women who have passed in and out of my life during the last 40 years of New York City, Street Photography. The 100 images cover the period 1975 - 2020. They are complemented by ten essays written by me about coming of age in New York City.

Book Specifications:
100 Pages
10 Original Stories  
Hardcover- Imagewrap
11x 13 Landscape  
Premium 100# Lustre Photographic Paper
Signed & Numbered 
Limited Edition

Images and an excerpt from a story in the book follow:

Delancy Street New York City 2019

Girl Who Ran From Her Nanny  Madison Avenue New York City 1976

Corner of Lexington Avenue at 54th Street New York City 1976

Two Women Descending a Staircase The Occulus New York City 2018


Coney Island Fishing Pier Coney Island Brooklyn NY 1983
 


 


Linda

When You Pray, Be Specific

– By Gerard Exupery

December 31, 2020

It’s another beautiful day in paradise. Dark and rainy. It’s one of those days that suggest the beauty of film. F-stop wide open, the darkness and grain, the feeling of an impressionist painting. It makes me think of being with someone I love hidden away from the world. There’s a bottle of Merlot we’ve been nursing, and we are creating images together. Clothing optional.

I don’t know how many days I have had like this in my life; I know the number is not enough. Those kinds of days are mostly remembered at my current age, the possibility of more dwindling rapidly.

I’ve been really pissed off at the universe lately. My lower back looking like Chernobyl and being unable to roam the city I love, is one reason. I still think like I’m 18, yet my body keeps telling me that I am 65.

For the most part, I am a realist. This is the situation; let’s deal with it and move on to the next. So, I have agreed with The Black Dog and the Universe to accept my age, my systems breaking down, and the inevitability of the power being turned off.

I escaped the yoke of organized religion. Though I had been exposed to both the Jewish and Catholic faith when very young. I remember only that these things were not like the others in my life of sleep, eat, toys, and cartoons, and everyone was acting way too seriously.

I don’t believe in God, and I am a cowardly atheist. I only pray when I am terrified or desperately want something. When my mother got older, she went back to the church after 50 years of being outside. I had no opinion other than it seemed about right for her. I never criticize anyone’s religion, as it has nothing to do with me. In fact, I have great respect for those individuals who have deep unquestioning faith.

I only have faith in human behavior.

I have always enjoyed religion’s mythology, though, and I know a fair amount about the more popular ones. I don’t have to believe in a God or any organized religion to apply its philosophy. My favorite being, “What would Jesus do?” He wouldn’t vote for God damn Trump, and I can tell you that.

Before she died, my mother insisted I learn the Lord’s Prayer just if I was wrong about this whole atheism thing.

I live alone, and I like it. I like being able to finish a paragraph in a book without having to hide in the bathroom. I watch the TV and movies I want to watch. I also stay up as late as I wish to write or working on my pictures, or tending to my ant colony.

There are times, however, that I am lonely for the companionship of the opposite sex. I may have always been crap in relationships, but I sure as hell enjoyed the work.

Recently I asked God to let me fall in love one more time before my expiration date. A little while ago, and seemingly in answer to my plea, I did. The details aren’t essential, but it did seem as if our Lord, be He Hairy Thunderer or Cosmic Muffin*,  is a bit of a joker. I really should have been much more specific with my request.

Next time it goes like this: “Hello. It’s me. Not scared, but I do want something. Okay? Here goes. Just one more time before I do the dirt nap, I would like to fall in love. Also, I would like the person I fall in love with to love me back. Please, Lord, do not make her bat shit crazy like the last one. Please don’t make her anti-vax, anti-mask, gluten-free, conspiracy-believing, fortune teller going, and rabid Trump supporter. You know, like the last one. Thanks.”

They say God is in the details.

So after that short and rather unsettling journey into poor decision-making, I spent a lot of time thinking. Had I, in fact, reached my “best if used by” date? In my funk, I buried myself in the massive job of preparing a new layout for “Women Hold Up Half the Sky,” my new book.

PLUG: If you haven’t done so, please go to my Indiegogo page and leave your email address. UNPLUG.

Obviously, in the book, there will be images of women I have been in relationships with. Looking at each image elicits a different response from my head and my gut. One or two make me cringe, and one actually haunts me. It is an image of Linda.

See, she was in love with me, and I was even engaged to her at one point. At least until she figured out that I was never going to marry her and that I never loved her the way she did me. We parted company and stayed friends for a couple of years but eventually lost touch...

The full story is 1500 words, and you can read it here. My other stories and essays can be found here.

 

Linda

In his introduction to‘SUBWAY New York City 1975-1985’  Mark McQueen said of Exupery:

"Gerard Exupery is one of those people who always has something to say. He has an uncanny talent for prying poetry out of the most banal of topics, inspiring you to look at them anew. This talent is even more evident in the visual realm. He has always managed to distill the chaos of life in New York down to concise, sometimes profound, but always original reflections on the human condition.”

Why Crowdfunding?

My first book, "SUBWAY New York City 1975-1985," was a great success. It was softcover, measured 10x8, and had 70 pages with 60 images and 5 short essays. It has sold out twice.

"Women Hold Up Half the Sky"  will measure 11x13, have approximately 100 pages, and be hardcover with an image wrap. It is printed on premium paper by a photographic printer, and the quality is excellent. Worth every penny.  Our cost to print the quantity necessary to get a substantial discount is 3 times what "SUBWAY New York City 1975-1985" was.


The Bottom Line

The funds generated by this campaign will be used to print an initial run of 200 copies. If the campaign continues past its goal, there will be a second run of 100 copies printed. Should it continue past that point, the funds will be applied to our third book production.
 

What Happens if We Don't Reach Our Goal?

This is uncharted territory for us.  Regardless of the outcome, we will conduct ourselves in an open and transparent manner.
 

Questions?

Please send me an email at gerard@gerardexupery.com.


About me, Writing, Etc.

Print:  
Interview: A Lifetime of Photography 

 Video:
Interview: The Week in PhotographyTWIP 
Interview: The Beginning Photography Podcast
Interview: Black & White Photography

My Writing:  
Essays: Here
My Website

 

Thank you for your time and consideration.

At least until she figured out that I was never going to marry her and that I never loved her the way she did me. We parted company and stayed friends for a couple of years but eventually lost touch...The full story is 1500 words, and you can read it here. My other stories and essays can be found here. LindaIn his introduction to‘SUBWAY New York City 1975-1985’  Mark McQueen said of Exupery:"Gerard Exupery is one of those people who always has something to say. He has an uncanny talent for prying poetry out of the most banal of topics, inspiring you to look at them anew. This talent is even more evident in the visual realm. He has always managed to distill the chaos of life in New York down to concise, sometimes profound, but always original reflections on the human condition.”Why Crowdfunding?My first book, "SUBWAY New York City 1975-1985," was a great success. It was softcover, measured 10x8, and had 70 pages with 60 images and 5 short essays. It has sold out twice."Women Hold Up Half the Sky"  will measure 11x13, have approximately 100 pages, and be hardcover with an image wrap. It is printed on premium paper by a photographic printer, and the quality is excellent. Worth every penny.  Our cost to print the quantity necessary to get a substantial discount is 3 times what "SUBWAY New York City 1975-1985" was.
The Bottom Line
The funds generated by this campaign will be used to print an initial run of 200 copies. If the campaign continues past its goal, there will be a second run of 100 copies printed. Should it continue past that point, the funds will be applied to our third book production. What Happens if We Don't Reach Our Goal?This is uncharted territory for us.  Regardless of the outcome, we will conduct ourselves in an open and transparent manner. Questions?Please send me an email at gerard@gerardexupery.com.
About me, Writing, Etc.
Print:  Interview: A Lifetime of Photography  Video:Interview: The Week in PhotographyTWIP Interview: The Beginning Photography PodcastInterview: Black & White PhotographyMy Writing:  Essays: HereMy Website Thank you for your time and consideration.

story:
Challenging outdated, non-inclusive decks of the past, the BLACK QUEER TAROT takes the traditional 78-card Tarot arcana and remakes them with a diverse cast of muses. Pairing the mission of creating work that centers Black queer people with Harlem-based artist Kendrick Daye's signature analog collage technique results in a fresh, inclusive take on the Tarot that imagines worlds where liberation and freedom are alive and well-connected bedfellows. Worlds where Black queer people are not just living--we're thriving. 

 


 

The 78 cards are larger than standard Tarot cards to show off the vibrant artwork (3.5" x 5" or 89x127mm) and printed on premium heavyweight 350 GSM card stock to make these cards a long lasting collector's item. The BLACK QUEER TAROT is available for pre-order via INDIEGOGO as a full 78-card deck and a hardcover companion guidebook written by Justin Henry that features in-depth descriptions of the artwork, both upright and reversed meanings and three custom spreads making this deck ideal for both beginner and experienced readers. 

 

 

How Can You Help?

I've spent the last few months photographing muses, meticulously creating artwork for the cards, consulting with readers on the symbolism in the deck, all while documenting the process via film. I'm launching an INDIEGOGO campaign to raise the funds necessary to turn this dream into a tangible reality. By powering this project you can grab the BLACK QUEER TAROT deck and companion guidebook and other limited edition merchandise before the release. 

 

 

 

Your support will directly fund:

  1. The design, writing and production of the BLACK QUEER TAROT companion guidebook
  2. The production and editing of a short film documenting this entire process 
  3. Fulfillment of all the perks
  4. Additional decks, merchandise and companion books for future online sales

 

Do remember, SUPPORT doesn't always have to be financial. Here are some FREE ways to help us achieve our goal:

  1. Help spread the word about the BLACK QUEER TAROT by sharing to Facebook, Instagram, Twitter or whichever social media platform you prefer. Every post, retweet, share, like and mention gets us closer to our goal!
  2. Email, text, or call your tarot and astrology enthusiast friends and let them know about the BLACK QUEER TAROT
  3. Follow the BLACK QUEER TAROT creator @kendrickdaye on instagram and twitter for more updates.

 

 

ABOUT THE ARTIST:

Kendrick Daye is a multi-media artist and designer, living in Harlem, NY. His diverse approaches to making art include art direction, bespoke design, music, and most notably collage - both digital and analog. Kendrick aims to create work that imagines a future where black queer life is prosperous and thriving.

story:
The Artist

Hello!  My name is Adi Dahlke, and I am a multimedia artist based out of New York City. I am currently finishing my BFA in Visual and Critical Studies at the School of Visual Arts. Prior to moving here, I studied at the Florence Academy of Art (US branch) and Lyme Academy College of Fine Arts in addition to studying under a number of incredible working artists outside of an academic setting. My artistic practice consists of the following: fine art painting, illustration, drawing, digital collage, printmaking, and poetry. My work is mostly figurative and features a lot of self portraits, subjects which I use to explore themes of queer identity, popular culture, and obsession.

If you'd like to see my work, you can check out my Instagram profile or my website. Feel free to also request a portfolio from me via email: adi.dahlke@gmail.com.

The Project

The project you're about to fund is hands-down the most ambitious, urgent, and vivid work of my artistic career to date. One of the most exciting components of this project is the level of engagement that it invites. The project is best experienced with fresh eyes-- that is, with as little prior information as possible-- so that the audience can participate in a process of surprise and discovery.

This puts me in a strange position. The project requires significant financial backing, but due to reasons already described, I cannot give the kind of thorough pitch one would typically expect of a crowd-funded campaign without robbing the project of some of its effectiveness. Thus, I must rely on your trust and generosity in order to see this project to completion. I ask only because I see the potential of this project; I truly believe it will be a significant cultural contribution.

The Budget

Of the $15,000 I am raising for this project, about $8,000 is needed to complete the primary product. $1,000 will be used to cover supply costs, and the remaining $6,000 will be used to produce supplementary materials. 

If this campaign is funded beyond this goal, all additional funds will be used to create more supplementary materials. In other words: a bigger, better project.

If the goal is not reached, whatever funds are raised will still be put towards the project while I seek additional funding. In the worst-case scenario, I will create a prototype of the project in hopes of seeing the full project to fruition at a later date.

 

I understand that supporting a project about which you have no information can be difficult. If you're considering contributing more than $1000 to the project, send an email to adi.dahlke@gmail.com for more information.

 

Help this project reach its goal by sharing this page with family, friends, and followers!

When this campaign reaches 50% of its funding goal, all backers will be entered into a raffle for one of my oil paintings.

Thank you for your time and consideration!

story:
Introducing Liquid Glass Resin

 

A game changer for anyone into resin art, crafts cast resin and DIY. If you want to make your work glossy and protect it from the elements while keeping it looking gorgeous, this is the resin you need. Your DIY is amazing - let’s keep it that way, forever.

 

Make Your DIY Amazing With LGR ⭐

 

 

 

Why Choose LGR?

  • It’s easy - with its 1:1 mix ratio, even beginners can get creating quickly
  • LGR gives you unlimited design potential
  • When dry, LGR gives you the glossiest, most crystal clear finish - with no yellowing
  • LGR is the fastest resin system ever (curing time 6 hours vs 12/24 hours)
  • It is the safest resin system ever.
  •  Because your DIY projects deserve the best! 

 

New to Indiegogo? We got you!

 

To be one of the first to get LGR you must become a "backer". So pick a reward to support the campaign, it's kind of like a pre-order but you're actually supporting us to get our company off the ground! By being a "backer" you'll receive the sweet discounts and be able to purchase LGR before it's available anywhere else!

While you are able to change your pledge later down the road, our discounts are only available for certain dates. Below you will see our 3 options available with pricing details.

We're able to offer  

1 LGR pack =  1 pkg 32  oz (16 oz A base + 16 oz B hardener)

2 LGR pack = 1/2 Gallon 2 x 32 oz ( 2x 16 oz A base + 2x 16 oz B hardener)  

4 LGR pack = 1 Gallon 4 x 32 oz ( 4x 16 oz A base + 4 x 16 oz B hardener) per backer pack (base + hardener)

Sales tax may apply.

 

Easy to mix and fast setting - no more wasted time ⏱️

LGR is simple to mix, with a 1:1 mix ratio. It’s easy to apply, fast, self-levelling and air-bubble free. You won’t need a heat gun. Plus, it cures in just 6 hours. Compare that to other resins that take up to 24 hours. Why waste time with anything else?

 

Keep Your Art Looking Amazing - No Yellowing Ever

Other resins make your art look glossy for a while, but then it turns a funny shade of yellow. LGR will never go yellow, even in direct sunlight. If you want your work to stand out from the crowd, give it a coat of LGR and you’re done. Trust me, LGR is the only resin on the market that guarantees that  thick, glossy topcoat. It gives your artwork, photos, wood and craft projects that gorgeous modern look that lasts forever!

               

           

Ultimate Design Potential

LGR is extremely versatile. Color it with dyes, pigment powders or pigment liquid dispersion. LGR is great for coating any surface, creating breathtaking jewellery or casting handy molds. Your imagination is the only limitation! When LGR hardens, it creates a solid surface that lasts for years. Unlike varnishes and other coatings, you don’t need to continually reapply the material when it starts to dull. LGR guarantees a long-lasting shine.

 

Quality Is Our Golden Rule✨

LGR stands for quality. We place the highest demands on our products, since we work with them ourselves every day. Our rigorous quality control ensures we only sell the best products. Plus, we manufacture LGR in small batches to ensure quality consistency. With all of this, we can be confident that you’ll experience outstanding results when you use LGR.

 

A Safer Option For You And Your Environment  

LGR is non-toxic (use as directed) so it's not bad for your health like other resins. The chemicals that combine to create the hard surface contain no volatile organic compounds (VOCs). You can safely use it at home or in your studio without worry. LGR is the only resin that is certified 100% VOC free! No fumes. No solvents. Non-flammable. Non-hazardous. All products concerning dangerous goods comply with the ASTM-D 4236 regulation. 

 

How Does It Work?

 

LGR is a two-part resin system - Base + Hardener. When mixed the two parts become cross-linked and begin to cure. The end result is an inert plastic that has a wide range of applications.

Mix together equal parts from each bottle. Stir for 3 minutes. Simply pour the liquid mixture over your project and spread.

Working Time: 40-45 min ( Room Temperature)

 

What Can I Do With It?

 

  • Woodworking 
  • Jewelry making
  • Art Coasters
  • Thumblers
  • Ashtrays
  • Countertops
  • Ornaments
  • Decorative accents
  • Paint Pouring art
  • Geodes
  • Resin Paperweights

 

Who Is It For?

 

Because LGR is so simple to mix and apply, anyone can use it. Whether you’re a beginner working on your first DIY or crafting project, or an expert who has been doing it for years, you’ll love the durable, glossy finish that LGR provides.

 

Choices

 

What Is Included?

 

  • Nitrile gloves
  • Surgical mask
  • 1 x 50ml graduated plastic cups 
  • Instructions and safety guidelines

 

Safety Information ⚠️   

 

Timeline

 

The Story Behind LGR

Hi. I’m Marco. I love art and I’m a DIY fanatic. I’m also the creator of Liquid Glass Resin.

Around three years ago, my wife asked me to create something special for our new home. The project was a coffee table, which I finished off with glossy resin. While it wasn’t a masterpiece, my wife was delighted with it. I was pretty proud!

However, I didn’t enjoy the experience of working with a chemical resin in my home. So, I got together a team of experts from Reschimica (the chemical company I founded) and challenged them to create a new resin - one that would be fast-setting, safe and usable anywhere.

Now, we finally have the result of two years of research and hard work. Liquid Glass Resin. It’s the ideal resin for art lovers and DIY fanatics - just like you.

 

Social Media

 

Risks And Challenges

 

I am Marco - the DIY nut and art lover behind Liquid Glass Resin (LGR).

LGR is the project of my life. I have never invented anything before I came up with this revolutionary resin. With a curing time of six hours, this safe, glossy resin represents a real innovation in the epoxy resin market.

It’s not been easy creating this new resin. I could not have done it without my team of talented young chemists who stopped at nothing to solve complex problems.

The last 12 months saw us take a lot of risks and experience unbelievable failures, but we never gave up. We learned from our mistakes and kept moving forward.

We developed LGR in partnership with Reschimica.com - the Italian chemical company. They let us use their labs, chemistry teams and industrial equipment to bring LGR to life. Thanks to this partnership, we are able to deliver LGR to customers on schedule.

Bringing new products to market is never easy. It’s possible for unexpected delays to arise due to things such as manufacturing errors, holidays and shipping problems. If that happens we’ll be sure to keep you posted. Our support team of 10 fellow crafting fanatics are always there to help if you need them!

We’re super excited for you to experience LGR.

Ciao!

Marco

story:
Whats a Bundle?

A Bundle Box is a non existent thing that I hope can fully exist before the end of this year(TBD).

They are essentially gift boxes. However the items inside are all handmade, or created by Studio Dodge. Your bundle would have items such as small art prints, vinyl stickers, pins, 3d printed earrings, soy candles, and potentially a lot more. I enjoy producing goods in small batches, with simple ingredients, these are the calm things of my work. While my illustration and artwork is where my mind plays forever until we are done.

The first bundle is more developed so far and I already have some items ready to make things.

You can find the descriptions of the bundles down below in the HAPPY MAIL section

OH HEY THERE

I'm Dani and I'm an artist. I've been making art under my business Studio Dodge since 2014. Since September I've been experiencing some hardship in my personal life regarding my my husband and our non consensual forced legal separation. That's a fun sentence.  What it really means is I’m cut off from coordinating my finances with my husband for a while, and it could be easy or hard for an even longer unknown amount of time.

I'm looking for some mental, emotional, and financial supports and minor comforts to help me while I have an unsteady paycheck with my art business, and continue to meet challenges the courts present.

This felt personal enough that I wanted to launch this separately from my business. It feels right in my gut, so I'll let my tax pal Abi help me out with that later. I also spend a lot of time calculating what's possible on my studio budget while also coordinating other life things, there's a lot to do running a smolbiz. This is truly for my peace of mind, and so my friends know I'll be okay. Thanks for bein here.

Your Happy Mail

When you support please let me know what bundles you would like to receive

A. Preorder one box, you choose what theme

B. Preorder one of each box

C. Preorder one box (you choose) and support the extra personal art projects +100

D. Preorder all boxes and support the extra personal art projects+150

 Moon Bundle: Reversible/Double-Sided Art Print including an original block print, handmade soy candle, handmade soap, vinyl sticker, 3d Printed earrings featuring a crescent moon and a dangling freshwater pearl(you can choose a matching or asymmetrical pair). Its time for Moon Vibes, think calming, lavender, soft cool colors, and some darks.

Morning Bundle: Brainstorming so far includes a set of morning beverage mini art prints, 3d printed latte earrings, soy candle, coffee scrub, vinyl sticker, and who knows what else we can cram in there. Think morning vibes, warm colors, coffee beans, citrus, inspiring start to the day.

Botanicals Bundle: Brainstorming so far includes plant shaped 3-d printed earrings, botanical bath items, house plant inspired art print, soy candle, wooden pin, vinyl sticker, and who knows what else I can cram in there. Think modern mother earth vibes, or cool plont stuff.

The Impact

If I'm able to fund this project and gain some stability for a longer road on the heels of an already difficult pandemic....

  • I can create the work that I feel called to make
  • I gain some freedom to decline some projects I would have accepted just for fast cash.
  • While my relationship rides the waves of the court system, this project might be able to boost my business to another level of stability that it can sustain on its own. I'm trying to project for longevity here. I can't be making a campaign every time I need help, ya know? Writing all this is a lot of work.
  • You support an artist personally, while also getting cool stuff instead of having to talk about her depressing love life.
  • Lets be real, financial stability helps me sleep better at night, and I've been sleeping on a not-bed since last fall. I may be able to improve my life a lil bit while I tough out this season of life.

 

Other Ways To Help

Extra Art Funding: I want to work on a symbolism heavy  feminist themed /mythololgy /femme/fauna/flora.... Um. Series of paintings? Its in my brain, and I have concept maps and thumbnail sketches, playlists slowly building... for this 3 piece series I want to paint. If things go well with this campaign I'll use funds to get me the time away from my client projects to work on this series that might burn a hole in me if I don't paint it. You know that feeling? Me too. 

 

oof wow you read all that.

You can find the descriptions of the bundles down below in the HAPPY MAIL section
OH HEY THERE
I'm Dani and I'm an artist. I've been making art under my business Studio Dodge since 2014. Since September I've been experiencing some hardship in my personal life regarding my my husband and our non consensual forced legal separation. That's a fun sentence.  What it really means is I’m cut off from coordinating my finances with my husband for a while, and it could be easy or hard for an even longer unknown amount of time.
I'm looking for some mental, emotional, and financial supports and minor comforts to help me while I have an unsteady paycheck with my art business, and continue to meet challenges the courts present.
This felt personal enough that I wanted to launch this separately from my business. It feels right in my gut, so I'll let my tax pal Abi help me out with that later. I also spend a lot of time calculating what's possible on my studio budget while also coordinating other life things, there's a lot to do running a smolbiz. This is truly for my peace of mind, and so my friends know I'll be okay. Thanks for bein here.

Your Happy Mail
When you support please let me know what bundles you would like to receive
A. Preorder one box, you choose what theme
B. Preorder one of each box
C. Preorder one box (you choose) and support the extra personal art projects +100
D. Preorder all boxes and support the extra personal art projects+150
 Moon Bundle: Reversible/Double-Sided Art Print including an original block print, handmade soy candle, handmade soap, vinyl sticker, 3d Printed earrings featuring a crescent moon and a dangling freshwater pearl(you can choose a matching or asymmetrical pair). Its time for Moon Vibes, think calming, lavender, soft cool colors, and some darks.
Morning Bundle: Brainstorming so far includes a set of morning beverage mini art prints, 3d printed latte earrings, soy candle, coffee scrub, vinyl sticker, and who knows what else we can cram in there. Think morning vibes, warm colors, coffee beans, citrus, inspiring start to the day.
Botanicals Bundle: Brainstorming so far includes plant shaped 3-d printed earrings, botanical bath items, house plant inspired art print, soy candle, wooden pin, vinyl sticker, and who knows what else I can cram in there. Think modern mother earth vibes, or cool plont stuff.

The Impact
If I'm able to fund this project and gain some stability for a longer road on the heels of an already difficult pandemic....

I can create the work that I feel called to make
I gain some freedom to decline some projects I would have accepted just for fast cash.
While my relationship rides the waves of the court system, this project might be able to boost my business to another level of stability that it can sustain on its own. I'm trying to project for longevity here. I can't be making a campaign every time I need help, ya know? Writing all this is a lot of work.
You support an artist personally, while also getting cool stuff instead of having to talk about her depressing love life.
Lets be real, financial stability helps me sleep better at night, and I've been sleeping on a not-bed since last fall. I may be able to improve my life a lil bit while I tough out this season of life.

 
Other Ways To Help
Extra Art Funding: I want to work on a symbolism heavy  feminist themed /mythololgy /femme/fauna/flora.... Um. Series of paintings? Its in my brain, and I have concept maps and thumbnail sketches, playlists slowly building... for this 3 piece series I want to paint. If things go well with this campaign I'll use funds to get me the time away from my client projects to work on this series that might burn a hole in me if I don't paint it. You know that feeling? Me too. 
 
oof wow you read all that.

story:
Hello! We are COASTALVANIA, creators of awesome pop culture items & enamel pins! Hot on the heels of our initial run, we are excited to produce another wave of our sold-out DRAGON PINS collection! 

DRAGON PINS are a minimal-yet-mythical interpretation of one of the greatest anime series of all time. See our selection below & use this campaign to purchase your own! All our pins are made of the finest high quality materials, come with LOCKING backing posts, their own backing cards, free collector's card and FREE stickers!

★

+ + + + + 
SELECTION

 

★ ★ ★ ★ ADD-ON ITEMS ★ ★ ★ ★

These are BONUS enhanced versions of our pins made into new formats. Available to backers who support any PERK level. They are available after you select a PERK during CHECKOUT. 

1. PRINCE-V KEYCHAIN / NECKLACE 

A double-sided version of our PRINCE-V pin. Normal PRINCE-V on one side, SUPER PRINCE-V on the flip side! Available as a KEYCHAIN or NECKLACE. (You choose) 

2. CAPSULE KEYCHAIN / NECKLACE 

*** These BONUS ITEMS are available as ADD-ON ITEMS you can select them during CHECKOUT after selecting a PERK. (More information below in the "ADD-ON ITEMS" section)

★

+ + + + +
TIERS

★

+ + + + +
ADD-ON ITEM

These are BONUS enhanced versions of our pins made into new formats. Available to backers who support any PERK level. They are available after you select a PERK during CHECKOUT. 

 

1. PRINCE-V KEYCHAIN / NECKLACE

A double-sided version of our PRINCE-V pin. Normal PRINCE-V on one side, SUPER PRINCE-V on the flip side! Available as a KEYCHAIN or NECKLACE. (You choose) 

2. CAPSULE KEYCHAIN / NECKLACE 

*** These BONUS ITEMS are available as ADD-ON ITEMS. You can select them during CHECKOUT after selecting a PERK. After selecting any PERK (and pins you want), you can select these items just before paying. You will also be given the option of selecting the KEYCHAIN or NECKLACE version. 

ADD-ON items are only available with purchase of PERK / PIN(S)! Thank you :) 

★+ + + + +

RISKS & CHALLENGES

We at Coastalvania have produced and shipped thousands of pins worldwide! Everything for DRAGON PINS production is ready to go! We are hoping to produce the pins in April / May, and ship them out in June! There is very little risk. All we need is funding!

★

+ + + + +

ABOUT US

COASTALVANIA is a pin design company & storefront serving the community since 2017. Since then we have shipped over 1,000 orders to satisfied customers worldwide. Our merchandise is of top quality and always includes special goodies & distinctive packaging! We take great pride in our merch, and are dedicated to delivering maximum bang for your buck. You can order with confidence of satisfaction with Coastalvania! 

Thank you for viewing our campaign. Now summon that dragon! 

#DRAGONPINS

story:
Short Summary

I am a potter, animal lover and all around fun loving person. I have been doing pottery for the past 2 years, and I was hooked from the first moment I stepped into a wheel class. I started my own pottery studio beginning of 2018, and I have been obsessed with making this my full time career since then.

My campaign is aimed at building myself a well equipped, light space with enough shelving to be able to do this full time. I absolutely adore what I do, and it would mean the world to me to be able to this full time.

Contributors will not only be able to pick a limited edition, handmade item for their home, but also help me doing what I love on a full time basis.

What We Need & What You Get

The funds I raise from this campaign will go towards building my dream pottery studio in my backyard, that is currently unused space. The new studio will be better laid out to increase my production, and really help me create more that I can sell.

My exclusive, limited edition I created specifically for this campaign is completely hand made from start to finish. The Table Mountain silhouette is either hand carved into the clay or hand painted in gold lustre over the glaze. Every single step is done by me, personally, to ensure you get a truly unique, one of a kind piece.

If the target is not reached, the funds raised will go towards starting to build the new studio and as more funds become available, finishing it.

The Impact

Other than being able to do pottery full time, I envision the new space to be better laid out for workshops. I love teaching, and I really enjoy showing other potters how to create their pieces with less effort with certain techniques I've learned over the past two years. It is another dream of mine to present workshops to people from all over the world on a monthly basis.

I am truly grateful for finding this incredible art form, and that it is a possibility for me to do this on a full time basis. 

I am a bit of a night owl, so having the new studio at home would really help me create whenever I can.

Risks & Challenges

I am dedicated to seeing this campaign through to the end, and do whatever I can to raise enough to make this dream a reality.

The current studio is on my patio, and being rather open to the elements can get very cold in winter and boiling hot in summer. The new space will be a closed space, and will have ceiling fans for the hot summer days, and heaters for the cold winter days.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute to my campaign, I would greatly appreciate you sharing my campaign with your friends and family on social media. Indiegogo has some incredible sharing tools for exactly this reason.

story:
Pine Copper Lime Transcription

In the past three years, PCL has created an archive of over 100 interviews with artists in the field of graphic arts from 20 countries. We are a small team of three print friends who are passionate about bringing the stories of these incredible artists to the world. 

We are committed to supporting diversity and accessibility in contemporary printmaking, and to this end, we are reaching out to our community and beyond to raise the funds to transcribe the PCL archive in order to:

  • Create transcripts that can be accessed free of charge by print friends with hearing loss
  • Have an archive that is searchable and cite-able by researchers
  • Document the interviews in long-form for the artists' records and reference 

What the funds will go to:

  1.  An automated transcription service (www.trint.com) to begin processing the archive.
  2. Compensating our wonderful intern (Elizabeth) who will go through the transcripts and clean up what the robot has missed.

If all goes well we hope to have the transcripts on the website by the end of October 2021.

Thank you so much for your time and attention. Please consider sharing this campaign even if you cannot donate at this time.

Lots of love,

The PCL Team

story:
I'm using IndieGoGo as a way for everyone that missed the Kickstarter campaign to be able to pre-order the Exquisite Familiars Set. Here, you'll still be able to get the deck at the same, lower-than-retail price.  

WE DID IT EVERYONE!  I'M HUMBLED AND SO VERY GRATEFUL! THANK YOU! 

From the same strange mind that created the mysterious Lucky Potion Oracle and the bizarre Oddity Tarot, comes an all new, immersive oracle deck experience inspired by Exquisite Corpses (a children's drawing game), Witch Familiars, and Legacy-Style Gaming.  You'll encounter magical creatures that will impart Wisdom, Guidance, and Daily Affirmations. 

This is a prototype and the artwork may change slightly. The following image shows the 3 Stretch Goals that we have reached. Everyone will get every stretch goal item!

Here are some of the 33 different Familiars you'll encounter. The artwork seems to extend beyond the borders so that they will touch the creature next to them. The 3.5" x 3.5" cards will have a linen texture and a matte finish.

The Handbook is double coil-bound on each side, so that the pages can flip out from the center, allowing you to match the cards you pulled for your daily guidance. The book is 7" x 7" when closed and 14" x 7" when open.

 Lore and Wisdom written by Judy Black 

Judy is a writer who makes her home in Atlanta, Ga. Her urban fantasy series, Cabinet of Aberrations, stars a traveling sideshow hunting monsters in 1903 America. She also creates supplements for Dungeons and Dragons games.

Affirmations written by Holly Adams Easley

Holly is a life-long spiritual searcher with a fondness for surrounding herself with beautiful things. She podcasts about tarot reading, tarot decks, and mystical life on the Wildly Tarot Podcast.

Here's How It Works:

If you decide to Pre-Order an Exquisite Familiars Deck Set, at checkout you will have the option to Add-On any of the following items to your pre-order!

THANK YOU SO MUCH!

FOLLOW ME ON Instagram for more Exquisite Familiar Reveals! @oddmixmarket

story:
The passion of my life has been to create beauty. Since 1997 I have created over 220 murals in the US and abroad, as well as writing and recording 6 albums of original music and performing hundreds of concerts all over the US and elsewhere. Since 2014 I have run the YOU ARE LOVED Mural Project, using public art and community participation to bring healing to communities of all types.  Every step has been intimately guided by a life of prayer. In this book I share the stories, spiritual struggles, and creative adventures of this life dedicated to healing through love and beauty.

Anyone striving to bring their inspiration into the world encounters resistance and fear. In this book I reveal the path I traced, facing those enemies. This has often felt like a life-or-death struggle, with my purpose and meaning hanging in the balance. I thank God for the spiritual tools I’ve found and learned to practice over these many years.

For the last 3 years, between murals and other projects, I have been writing this book, "You Are Loved, Spiritual and Creative Adventures". It includes 61 stories, 94 (b/w) pictures, and is the distillation of my best ideas on creativity and spirituality. It has been an amazing, demanding, and elucidating process!

This book was written for you, the one working to bring your own dream into the world. You probably face skepticism and indifference to your pure idea, maybe even in of your own thoughts. This book will show you, in stories of my very human life, that you are not alone in your fear and confusion. Nor are you alone in your soaring inspiration, and desire to make something wonderful.  

Living a creative life can be very difficult. I certainly had some knock-down, drag-out battles to fight. I was helped on by spiritual texts, and a few books of other creatives. I know this book will reach some people right where they are, in the midst of their own battles. It will bring recognition, comfort, inspiration, and a fighting spirit. 

In this campaign I am raising $5000 to create this book. This money will go towards an initial printing of 200 copies, as well as design, marketing, and postage to ship the books to you. It will also pay for studio time and a sound engineer to create the audio book version. I'm eager to get this book into your hands so please make a donation by May 15, 2021! 

My great desire with this book is to share the spiritual and creative riches I have gained over the years. It is a portrait of a life striving to give itself to beauty. 

Thank you so much for your support!

 

Alex

 

Here are a few responses from early readers: 

 

"YOU ARE LOVED is a pilgrimage, a love story, a classic, an epic. Within the first few pages, I recognized Alex as someone who lives on the Edge — someone whose whole life proves the adage, jump and the net will appear — someone whose “heart and flesh crieth out for the living God.”

Alex writes with such soul-searing honesty and transparency, I feel as though I’m reading about my own life. I am alternately terrified and relieved, concerned and rejoicing. 

The common thread through Alex’s colorful, unique, torturous and triumphant journey, is that “perfect love that casts out fear.”  Alex moves nearer and nearer to this original Love, casting off lesser loyalties and writing a memoir that actually makes me happy to be alive." 

Karen Montenaro, dancer, art educator

 

"This book touched my heart in a way few books ever have.  Alex gives poetic, powerful voice to the journey we are all on to know ourselves and our deepest talents and to use them in a way that blesses others.  The book brims with light because Alex is so honest about the darkness he has faced.  I have always admired Alex’s work as an artist and singer.  But I am blown away by his talents as a writer!"

C. Manchester, King Ferry, NY

 

"YOU ARE LOVED is so full of joy, adventure, good advice, and belly laughs. It really is an instruction manual for how to combat fear and doubt. Each chapter could be read at random to tell its own story and dole out a piece of hard-earned wisdom. And the writing is so sharp. I hope it inspires thousands of people, and I know that I will dip into it again and again for inspiration."

Matt Flanagan, Writer, Disney

 

“YOU ARE LOVED is a song of a true artist that cannot help but inspire others.” 

Cindy Peyser Safronoff, award-winning author of Dedication: Building the Seattle Branches of Mary Baker Eddy’s Church, A Centennial Story

story:
'MOVEMENT OF PEOPLE'

 

A one night collaborative contemporary dance performance at Arts Depot Theatre, North London

 

'Movement Of People' will be produced by Melody Tamiz - current Directory of M.O.P. Dance Company, and former Rambert2 dancer.   Melody Tamiz graduate from London Studio Centre with a first Class BA Honours Degree. She also has a Masters Degree in Professional Dance Performance from Rambert, researching Flow Theory &  Eastern Practices.  

In her professional career she has had the opportunity to work with and perform works by: Ohad Naharin, Sidi Larbi Cherkaoui, Damien Jalet, Benoit Swan Pouffer, Jermaine Spivey, Sharon Eyal, Rafael Bonachella, Didy Veldman, Andrea Miller, Wayne Parsons, James Cousins, Ben Love & Kerry Nicholls…

 

The Evening Will Be...

'Movement Of People' will feature four pieces, all choreographed by separate choreographers; collaborating together to make a memorable full length evening performance.  The theme of the evening is the psychological state of Flow.  This theme should be tangible for the performers, as well as the audience - from the moment they enter the foyer.

 

Choreographers Include :

M.O.P. Dance Company

David West {EQ Dance Co}

Esme Benjamin {KWAM Collective}

Jasmine Crawford 

 

WE NEED YOUR HELP

We aim to reward all the people involved in this project for all of their hard work to bring this evening together. 

However, this fund is made especially to pay the choreographers; who's hard work deserves to be rewarded.  The choreographers' work extends from far before anything even reaches the stage, or even the dancers.  Conceptualising, developing, and teaching - adds up to countless hours of labor, that all of the choreographers are currently doing with no expectation of any fee.  These hard working individuals are probably working even as you read this now; preparing for the exceptional moment that you get to see their work on stage on the 21st of October.  

 

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR ANY HELP YOU CAN OFFER!
story_txt: 'MOVEMENT OF PEOPLE' A one night collaborative contemporary dance performance at Arts Depot Theatre, North London 'Movement Of People' will be produced by Melody Tamiz - current Directory of M.O.P. Dance Company, and former Rambert2 dancer.   Melody Tamiz graduate from London Studio Centre with a first Class BA Honours Degree. She also has a Masters Degree in Professional Dance Performance from Rambert, researching Flow Theory &  Eastern Practices.  In her professional career she has had the opportunity to work with and perform works by: Ohad Naharin, Sidi Larbi Cherkaoui, Damien Jalet, Benoit Swan Pouffer, Jermaine Spivey, Sharon Eyal, Rafael Bonachella, Didy Veldman, Andrea Miller, Wayne Parsons, James Cousins, Ben Love & Kerry Nicholls… The Evening Will Be...'Movement Of People' will feature four pieces, all choreographed by separate choreographers; collaborating together to make a memorable full length evening performance.  The theme of the evening is the psychological state of Flow.  This theme should be tangible for the performers, as well as the audience - from the moment they enter the foyer. Choreographers Include :M.O.P. Dance CompanyDavid West {EQ Dance Co}Esme Benjamin {KWAM Collective}Jasmine Crawford  WE NEED YOUR HELPWe aim to reward all the people involved in this project for all of their hard work to bring this evening together. However, this fund is made especially to pay the choreographers; who's hard work deserves to be rewarded.  The choreographers' work extends from far before anything even reaches the stage, or even the dancers.  Conceptualising, developing, and teaching - adds up to countless hours of labor, that all of the choreographers are currently doing with no expectation of any fee.  These hard working individuals are probably working even as you read this now; preparing for the exceptional moment that you get to see their work on stage on the 21st of October.   THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR ANY HELP YOU CAN OFFER!

story:
Hello Friends!! I’m Zee, an artist focused on work that explores our inner, emotional worlds. I believe tarot's marriage of art and symbolism make it a powerful tool for examining ourselves and our circumstances. I'm excited to bring you our newest, most fun and playful project....

This is a unique deck as it has a transparent background, is designed for layering the cards on top of each other, overlapping, and more! Because they overlap, and This deck is a fantastic tool for developing your intuition. it breaths new life into the 78 cards with its layering of the artwork by introducing a new medium to tarot. The ability to layer the cards to create a whole picture brings a whole new dimension to the reading, it has created a true shift in the ways a card spread can be interpreted. This deck is for anyone who loves cats, loves working with the Tarot as a personal tool of self discovery and self care, for anyone who wants to stimulates and awakens your intuition, this will be a profound addition to your Tarot collection.

As you use the cards, you will find them speaking to you in surprising ways. The overlapping images almost made one feel like new cards were being created. It's fun to piece the meanings behind two or three cards together, and see throughout things from a deeper perspective. 

The transparent tarot encourages you to be creative, A must-have for both readers and collectors, Suitable for beginners as well as advanced readers. Imagination is the key!!

 

 

 

If you've pledge for a deck or more, please add these items in the "add on" section. They will be free shipping :)

 

Major Arcana Altar Cloth/ Scarf

This Major Arcana scarf is soft, skin-friendly, durable. Explore the many uses of this beautiful cloth: for tarot readings, to cover your altar, to enhance your space as decor, to hang as a tapestry, or for use as a meditation cloth. It also complements any outfit, it can be worn around your neck, as a top, at the waist or as a headscarf.

35.4"x35.4"/90 x 90cm

100% Satin Silk

 

Adventure Cat Tarot Hard Enamel Pin - HK$99/pc

Die cast hard enamel

Measures approximately 1.5"/3.8cm at their longest point

Double posted with butterfly clutches for security

Gold plated or shiny gold metal with colourful hard enamel highlights

Presented on a specially designed backing card

 

Adventure Cat Tarot Art Print - HK$188/HK$288

The Art prints are available in 2 different sizes

6.55" x 11.7"/ 16.6 x 29.7cm - HK$188

9.3" x 16.5"/ 23.6 x 42cm - HK$288

 

Printed on High Quality Art Paper

Colours may vary due to monitor settings

Frame is not included

White Borders (approx 1"/2.54cm) are calculated in the print sizes

 

 A mock up image of the box

Card back design, for the limited edition, it will be different color.

 

 

Tarot is the best gift to one self and love ones because it makes your life so much easier, a good practice of your inner intuition, self-examination, growth, healing and a light in the dark to guide you using the power within yourself. I’ve found it to be really useful and supportive through some really challenging shifts in my life. It’s simply a beautiful coping mechanism to lean on.

 

✦ Shipping to the US, Canada and Europe will be approximately takes 7-14 working     days.

✦ Other Countries shipping is approximately takes 7-14 working days.

✦ Additional tax / fees or customs charges are responsible by the backers.

✦ Tracking will not be included to keep prices low, but if you'd like extra security and like your items to be sent with tracking, please let me know.

✦ Please ensure you provide the correct shipping address as this cannot be changed once I begin shipping.

✦ I try to use Eco-friendly materials as possible for packaging. I will try my best to be plastic-free and use recycled materials.

✦ If you would love to Upgrade to Express Shipping, please feel free to drop me a message.

 

Feel free to drop us a message here or send an email at adventurecattarot@gmail.com if you have any concern. Thank you for making my dream comes true and I hope to show my gratitude by sending the products safe and sound to you. Follow us @adventurecattarot on instagram for more images of the cards and latest updates.

story:
ABOUT ME

My name is Loan Favan, I am an artist and a jewelry designer from New Caledonia, a french island located in the Pacific Ocean. I am the founder of Naula_studio, a jewelry company now based in Bali, Indonesia. The leitmotiv of my work is my Pacific origins. I feel the urge to give back to my island and spread our culture through my minimal and futuristic designs. And therefore create more than simple jewelry pieces, but rather 'modern artefacts' holding ancestral and mystical power.

 

THE PROJECT

"Most of our traditions as islanders are rooted in the past and passed on by speech. Which made me wonder how our heritage will evolve or even survive in the future."

Ngei will be a collection of 5 monumental accessories inspired by the Kanak artifacts. The collection pays tribute to traditions and bring it into the future.

  1. CĀC (‘spear’ in Nengone) is a symbolic weapon ‘piercing’, inspired by the traditional spears. CĀC awakens the warrior spirits within its wearer’s body and soul.
  2. KOI (‘to draw water from’ in Nengone) is a modernized version of the Kanak gourd bottle. KOI is a massive necklace that allows its user to collect rainwater, which became rare on Earth.
  3. SHEGU (‘to warm up next to the fire’ in Nengone) is inspired by ‘magic stones’ of New Caledonia, objects believed to hold power. Some magic stones were used in agriculture and were planted in the crops for a successful harvest. This new version contains all legends and customs' knowledge, so traditions will never be forgotten and passed on.
  4. YAACÈ (‘spirit’ in Nengone) is a modernized version of the Kanak chambranles. Chambranles are wooden sculptures protecting houses, they are believed to host ancestors spirits.
  5. NINEN (‘respect’ in Nengone) is a modernized version of the Kanak money. The money was exchanged during ceremonies between tribes as a sign of respect.

 

The idea is to exhibit the ancient objects next to their futuristic versions and by doing so, opening a conversation between their past and future.

 

THE RESEARCH

Being from New Caledonia, which is a french colony I never got to learn the customs of my own land and culture. With this project, I have taken steps back and learnt about my own origins and land. I hope this project can help our community to come back closer to their roots.

In the making process of the collection I have researched the history of our objects and legends to create pieces that will become more than jewelry, but part of tradition. I integrated details from the huts, the sacred wooden sculptures, the engraved bamboos...symbols that founded our past and that I believe can still be part of our future.

 

 

The idea is to exhibit the ancient objects next to their futuristic version and by doing so, re-questioning their future.

 

THE CONTRIBUTION 

To contribute to the emergence and remembrance of our heritage, I need your support. Each donation will help realize the metal pieces, the photoshoot, the 3D animated stories and exhibition. I would also like to give 10% of this project to Noumea Fashion Week, to encourage other creatives of the island to create in ambitious and bold ways for our community.

 

THE RISKS & CHALLENGES

This is an ambitious project that involves the production of complex metal pieces and advanced visual making but this is not my first big production. I have realised a short film dedicated to my island; LAKEBO in 2019 back in New Caledonia, managing several collaborations and productions. Moreover I have been developing jewelry pieces since 2019 and distributing them on Naula_studio worldwide. In 2020 I created a futuristic jewelry collection which is now part of the Design Museum of Denbosch collection, Alliage-Cu29Zn30.

However, delays due to unforeseen obstacles can occur especially during the current health crisis. But I made sure the schedule will allow delays. Also by only working with the best producers and manufacturers, I am confident the project can be complete successfully.

At all times, I will be as transparent as possible and keep you up to date with the progress!

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my campaign on any social media you use!
  • Share through the social media links above.
  • Tip your hat to a friend and mention this cool movie that's raising money on Indiegogo!
