story:
HI! Welcome to my THIRD SUCCESSFUL crowdfunding campaign for Max Boost!  In the previous campaigns, I have reliably shipped over 4000 books and merchandise to ALL our supporters in the past!  So rest assured, you will get your book AND a 90 Day satisfaction guarantee.  We got you, and we know you will LOVE Max Boost! - Dennis

 

 

Filled with 275 pages, and Issues 1-98 which is ALL of comics plus never-before-seen BRAND NEW PAGES AND STORIES in a gorgeous, collectible hardcover, exclusively ONLY AVAILABLE for pre-order here!

Max Boost is a story bout Max and Otto, and their adventures in Motorville as they dream of one day becoming racing legends - but first, their stock civic needs more horsepower!

And, before the dream of going PRO and have their names grace the Motorville Hall of Fame, they may want to be able to defeat their arch nemesis Todd in a quartermile drag race first.

In this Omnibus, the story continues with Max and Otto in their stock pea-green civic, as they drag race at IDRC in a hopeless attempt to beat Todd’s V8. When all hope seems lost, Magically, a boost button appears on their dashboard- and of course they decide to push it… and the transformation begins.

And from there, the story picks up quick - leading into more races, even more mayhem in Motorville.

You’ll have fun meeting a new cast of characters, with new tuner cars, and some more high speed hijinks along the way.

 

Do you remember the Super Dupra?

 

The AWD Twins Zig and Zag?

BUT, the world of MAX BOOST is in danger.  Cars are starting to randomly disappear- and mysterious villains from a distant world are out to destroy MOTORVILLE.

The mystical Papa Wheely is the only one who knows the secret to saving Motorville, and why Max Boost has been chosen to become a unlikely hero.

This Omnibus, (Volume 1,2,3) is full of surprises - and heck - we even have special guest appearances!

And, for the FIRST TIME IN 15 YEARS, Dennis will be drawing and writing BRAND NEW PAGES OF MAX BOOST for this campaign!  You will be the first in the world to read the new Max Boost!

 

BONUS PAGES - There will also be additional pages of awesome artwork, with influencers like -

Dai Yoshihara

Matt Field

Gary King

Mickey Andrade

Frank Downstar … and more

We’ll have sketches, brand new concept art,

Fanart, and more behind the scenes

Here is a sample of some of the previous Exclusive SWAG! New swag will be available only to Backers of this project (you will be invited to a secret store after the campaign is completed)

Also, JUST for this project, you can add Exclusive RARE MERCH only available when you buy the book... and NOT available anywhere else.  Such as Hats, banners, pins and and more.

 Here is an example of one of the items that will be available to Indiegogo Supporters after the campaign ends successfully.  You will be able to add these to your order during the final checkout process after the campaign is completed. 

Max Boost - He is the underdog, and our unlikely hero.  Max is absolutely passionate about cars and racing, and will do anything it takes to find, build, and race the car of his dreams.  His number one enemy is Todd, and he is committed to bringing street-justice to Motorville by having Todd pay for all of the horrible things he does to those who have less horsepower than him.

And, as the story develops, we find out what roles these characters play, as the very existence of Motorville may actually depend on this young group of street-rascals...

Otto - is Max's best friend and voice of reason.  Otto is basically the opposite of Max, as he is calm, collected, and is always thinking wisely.  However, he also knows it's almost impossible to stop Max when he has a "great idea", and knows it's better just get out of his way (and sometimes more entertaining!).  As a master tactician, Otto, has the skill of gently guiding Max along so he doesn't hurt himself... too much.

Todd -  Big V8, BIG Pistons, and even BIGGER EGO.  Todd is the town jock that you love to hate, and he makes it a "sport" to harass Max and Otto, and anyone else under 500 horsepower.  Maybe one day, Max and Otto will be able to teach him a lesson in humility, but they will need to find some horsepower and torque first!

Papa Wheely and his henchmen, Yin, Yan and Wok - He has the Horsepower and Torque!  Papa Wheely is the Proprietor of Papa Wheely's Performance Pagoda.  He's the one to see if you want you tuner car, tuned - but for a PRICE!

AND, if you don't make your payments on time, you may end up meeting the his "Wu Tang Wack!"

Ese and 'Efe - The leaders of the Low Rider crew from Low Co., Ese and Efe' patrol the streets of Lotting Park - with 3 wheel motion, on chrome & white walls.  Don't get caught by them at the wrong time, in the wrong place, or you might find yourself getting "hit by switches".

Rip, Slug, Torch- Three mysterious bad dudes from a mysterious place have come to Motorville with suspicious motives.  Are they just looters? Or are the part of a bigger plan leading to the distruction of Motorville?  Let's find out...

And, that's not all, there are many, many more characters in Max Boost for you to meet!

And included in the NEW Max Boost Volume 3.1, new characters such as Racerette, Trixie, Dizzy Dubz and other surprise characters will be making an appearance!

The Max Boost studio is located in Mission Valley, San Diego, California.

Hi!  My name is Dennis, and Max Boost is my comic that was featured in Import Tuner Magazine!

As a kid my dream has always been to work in the comic industry.

Luckily as a teenager, I was able to accomplish that by working for different comic companies. 

My Turbo Integra GS-R that was featured in Turbo Magazine back in 1997!

During that time in the 90’s, I got my first new car - an Acura Integra GSR which ignited my passion for racing and cars - and my car was even featured in Turbo Magazine

So just like the anime Initial D, I wanted to combine my passion for Cars and Comics to create my own called Max Boost.

If you don’t know Max Boost, you may know the magazine it was published in- a magazine I helped create and design in 1998-called Import Tuner

which had about 1 Million readers per month.

Unfortunately, after almost a decade of drawing, animating, and entertaining fans…. I abruptly stopped In 2006.

The truth was we almost struck a massive deal with Warner Bros, and due to unfortunate circumstances, it got cancelled, I hit rock bottom and lost almost everything.

Fans were wondering what happened, and where I went.

And during these tough years, a highlight would be When I would randomly meet fans -and they would ask me to bring Max Boost back…So I knew I would come back,

I just didn’t know when.

The Max Boost Midori Civic, known as "Mikey ^2" is being built to eventually replicate the Max Boost Civic in the comic!

So a couple of years ago I brought Max Boost classic issues back with Volume 1 and Volume 2.  It was a huge success!

Between the two books, we finally reprinted ALL the classic issues of Max Boost that were published in IT from 1998-2006.

I definitely am not doing this alone - it takes a lot of support from industry partners, friends, family, and a solid team.

 NOW the Max Boost Omnibus is the COMPLETE COLLECTION PLUS BRAND NEW PAGES OF MAX BOOST!!!

During our last two campaigns, things blew up!

Because of your support , we put life back into Max Boost Again!

Building cars, racing, Sketching, Doing collabs, on podcasts, And even signing at the Honda booth at SEMA

Max Boost Team cars - Micheal Bush "Natsuki" S2000 (Global Time Attack Car), HKS Supercharged & Mike Servin's EK hatch (Show Stoppah) powered by B15C5 Type R.

 So now after 15 long years I MADE IT here on Indiegogo to say:

I'm FINALLY going to continue the Max Boost story line in a new book.  With your help, for the first time in forever…. I am DRAWING MAX BOOST AGAIN

Max Boost Team mate, Chad Richardson's Mustang GT that I get to compete in the NASA Time Trials with! Car is affectionately known as "Scarlet"!

So, this book is currently only a prototype, and if you want to help the Max Boost Omnibus become a reality, then we need your support so we can hit our goal and gather enough orders to meet our manufacturers minimum order!  (Easy Peasy!)

So, Max Boost Omnibus Collectors Edition is for a limited time only, reserve your OWN book now by clicking on the “back this project” button to be a Backer today!

1) FIRST, FIND THE AVAILABLE OPTIONS ON THE RIGHT HAND SIDE OF THIS PAGE (you may need to scroll up)

2) CLICK THE PERK WITH THE ITEMS YOU WANT - Pick what works best for you!  One Book, Two Book, etc.

3) CLICK "GET THIS PERK"

4) FOLLOW INSTRUCTIONS (Enter the shipping address*, payment method, log in to your Indiegogo account, etc)

4) OFFICIAL ORDER FORM: Later this year we will invite you to complete your official order form where you will finalize your selections, your shipping address, and other details

5) WE WILL SHIP THE ITEMS TO YOU - You will be the FIRST IN THE WORLD to get your hands on the comic, with an estimated ship date will be sometime in December 2021!

Like previous volumes, as an option your name can be in the list of backers as a founder of The Max Boost Omnibus!

*90 Day Satisfaction Guarantee; You get a 90 day satisfaction guarantee!

 Stretch goals are milestones that, if achieved, can reap benefits for Backers!  The more pledges, the merrier!

$15,000 6 NEW Pages of  Max Boost Comics! ACHIEVED!

$25,000 10 NEW Pages of  Max Boost Comics! ACHIEVED!

$35,000 1 MORE additional Backer will be have a cameo in the book ACHIEVED!

$50,000 1 x Bonus Item for all Book Backers ACHIEVED!

$60,000 15 NEW Pages of  Max Boost Comics! ACHIEVED!

$75,000 1 x Max Boost Air Freshener for every book order!

$80,000 20 NEW Pages of Max Boost Comics!

$100K - 30 NEW Pages of Max Boost Comics & ANOTHER Bonus gift for all Book Backers!

And please don’t forget to share this project with your friends! Your support means a lot.

I personally invite you to join the Max Boost team and be the first in the world to own your collectible copy .  Let’s make an incredible comic together, and bring max boost back better than ever!)

 

SPECIAL "THANK YOU'S":

My studio and comic peeps:

Thank you to my family, Rachelle and of course my two sons Drake "Max" and Ronin "Otto" Caco for being such a support and inspiration.  This is dedicated to my boyzzzz!!!

My studio and comic peeps:

Nghia, Derek, Clydene Nee, Batton Lash, Joe Philips, Lex Wolfcraft, Chris Neuhahn

Co-Workers and Friends; Memo Quibrera, Marat Zabelinskiy, Nick Coleman, April Estrada,  Rich Langi, Carter Jung, Rick, Andres the Car Kid, Wes Walz, Micheal Bush, Mike Servin, Anne, Alex, Ernie, Richard and Mark 

Artists and assistant artists:

Rich, Jasen, Nghia, Eddie, Ray, Melissa, Derek, Conrad, Trace

My OG race team:

Sam Rothschild, Dan Wilson, Lee Lim, Ian Penaflorida and Family, Gabe, Tim T.

Ground Zero Racing and Online Performance, Eddie from Dynamic Autosport and Ha (RIP) from Pann Autosport for being my very first retail customers in the mid 90's

Influencers & social partners:

@mistergsx (www.youtube.com/mistermemo)

@hasportperformance

@vtecacademy

@daiyoshihara

@mattfield777

@andresthecarkid

@rothfab - Sam Rothschild

@hasport_performance

@vtec.academy

@the_house_of_honda,

@State_of_evolution

@ifestcivic - Basit Mirza

@sorenswift

Civic FK8 Type R Owners Facebook Group

@craiglieberman_42

@autocannon.art

@thebigmike - www.ThinkBiggerProject.com

@hondaprojason Jason Richmond

@trackspecDD - Micheal Bush

@smellypanda - Note!

@vtecclubusa - Duane owns a Midori EK!

@kinganytime - Gary King

@miss_courtney_day

Sponsors & Industry:

Nick Fousekis, Rich Langi, and the crew at Falken Tire, Basit Mirza and Import Fest , Wes Walz at Elite Finish, Justin and Jeff at CarTune Auto Repair, Edward Lee at Titan 7, Philip Chase, Kenji, Mike and the crew at Greddy, Volk, Tein, Art of Attack, Hasport, Vtec Academy  Jesbran from Eibach, Rick from Legacy Auto Spa, Emil and Ed and the gang at Extreme Autofest, Jim Liaw and the team at Formula D, Robert at Comickaze in San Diego,  Rich Calbay and Harry Kong (who was actually one of the first to bring Max Boost back about 4 years ago) from Nitto Tire, Thomas Okihisa and Toyo Tires, Note from Treefrog USA, Stu from Tokyo Pop, My agents Russel Binder, Jay Roth, Paulina Armstrong, Ryan and the Honda Challenge crew from NASA ProRacing, VTEC Club - Duane, Amir, and the whole cast of crazies showing what HONDA'S CAN DO!  And of course, Import Tuner Magazine.

A VERY SPECIAL thank you to Bruce and the team at HONDA for believing in the Power of Dreams (like mine!)

The Last Race Team:

Alex Ranarivelo (Director) and Our Crew, and all the extras that stayed for 7+ hours to shoot our racing scenes!

And of course YOU and all of our hardcore Max Boost fans!

~ And I am sure I forgot some people, so I'll be adding more as I remember!

THANK YOU ALL!  LET'S MAKE THIS HAPPEN!

-Dennis and the Max Boost Crew

 

Max Boost!® and Autocannon™ are TM & © 2019 of Caco Enterprises, Inc.

Import Tuner® is TM & © 2019 SUPER STREET ONLINE | MOTOR TREND GROUP, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.

Honda®, Acura®, Integra®, Vtec®, Type-R®, and Civic® are TM & © 2019 American Honda Motor Co. All rights reserved Used with permission.

Toyota® is a TM and ©2019 Toyota Motor Sales, U.S.A., Inc. All rights reserved. Falken Tires® is TM and © 2019 Sumitomo Rubber North America, Inc. All Rights Reserved.  Titan 7 is ™ and © 2017 Titan 7 Wheels. All rights reserved. Eibach® is Copyright © 2019 Eibach. All Rights Reserved. 

* On packages where USA Shipping and Handling are not included (not including Alaska and Hawaii), shipping will be charged after the campaign ends during final checkout process called "BackerKit".  Shipping prices will be based on volume discounts to save you as much money as possible.  These books are not light weight!  They are 4 lbs each so expect shipping and handling charges to range between estimate of  $6-9 per order Domestic depending on your location.  International Shipping charges can range from $10-$25 per package or more for areas like Australia (but you probably already know that).  Prices do not include VAT / Tariffs / Duties / Taxes etc. so please plan accordingly

*All products pictured and described are prototypes and are subject to change anytime
story_txt:
HI! Welcome to my THIRD SUCCESSFUL crowdfunding campaign for Max Boost!  In the previous campaigns, I have reliably shipped over 4000 books and merchandise to ALL our supporters in the past!  So rest assured, you will get your book AND a 90 Day satisfaction guarantee.  We got you, and we know you will LOVE Max Boost! - Dennis  Filled with 275 pages, and Issues 1-98 which is ALL of comics plus never-before-seen BRAND NEW PAGES AND STORIES in a gorgeous, collectible hardcover, exclusively ONLY AVAILABLE for pre-order here!Max Boost is a story bout Max and Otto, and their adventures in Motorville as they dream of one day becoming racing legends - but first, their stock civic needs more horsepower!And, before the dream of going PRO and have their names grace the Motorville Hall of Fame, they may want to be able to defeat their arch nemesis Todd in a quartermile drag race first.In this Omnibus, the story continues with Max and Otto in their stock pea-green civic, as they drag race at IDRC in a hopeless attempt to beat Todd’s V8. When all hope seems lost, Magically, a boost button appears on their dashboard- and of course they decide to push it… and the transformation begins.And from there, the story picks up quick - leading into more races, even more mayhem in Motorville.You’ll have fun meeting a new cast of characters, with new tuner cars, and some more high speed hijinks along the way. Do you remember the Super Dupra? The AWD Twins Zig and Zag?BUT, the world of MAX BOOST is in danger.  Cars are starting to randomly disappear- and mysterious villains from a distant world are out to destroy MOTORVILLE.The mystical Papa Wheely is the only one who knows the secret to saving Motorville, and why Max Boost has been chosen to become a unlikely hero.This Omnibus, (Volume 1,2,3) is full of surprises - and heck - we even have special guest appearances!


And, for the FIRST TIME IN 15 YEARS, Dennis will be drawing and writing BRAND NEW PAGES OF MAX BOOST for this campaign!  You will be the first in the world to read the new Max Boost! BONUS PAGES - There will also be additional pages of awesome artwork, with influencers like -Dai YoshiharaMatt FieldGary KingMickey AndradeFrank Downstar … and moreWe’ll have sketches, brand new concept art,Fanart, and more behind the scenesHere is a sample of some of the previous Exclusive SWAG! New swag will be available only to Backers of this project (you will be invited to a secret store after the campaign is completed)Also, JUST for this project, you can add Exclusive RARE MERCH only available when you buy the book... and NOT available anywhere else.  Such as Hats, banners, pins and and more. Here is an example of one of the items that will be available to Indiegogo Supporters after the campaign ends successfully.  You will be able to add these to your order during the final checkout process after the campaign is completed. Max Boost - He is the underdog, and our unlikely hero.  Max is absolutely passionate about cars and racing, and will do anything it takes to find, build, and race the car of his dreams.  His number one enemy is Todd, and he is committed to bringing street-justice to Motorville by having Todd pay for all of the horrible things he does to those who have less horsepower than him.And, as the story develops, we find out what roles these characters play, as the very existence of Motorville may actually depend on this young group of street-rascals...Otto - is Max's best friend and voice of reason.  Otto is basically the opposite of Max, as he is calm, collected, and is always thinking wisely.  However, he also knows it's almost impossible to stop Max when he has a "great idea", and knows it's better just get out of his way (and sometimes more entertaining!).  As a master tactician, Otto, has the skill of gently guiding Max along so he doesn't hurt himself... too much.Todd -  Big V8, BIG Pistons, and even BIGGER EGO.  Todd is the town jock that you love to hate, and he makes it a "sport" to harass Max and Otto, and anyone else under 500 horsepower.  Maybe one day, Max and Otto will be able to teach him a lesson in humility, but they will need to find some horsepower and torque first!Papa Wheely and his henchmen, Yin, Yan and Wok - He has the Horsepower and Torque!  Papa Wheely is the Proprietor of Papa Wheely's Performance Pagoda.  He's the one to see if you want you tuner car, tuned - but for a PRICE!AND, if you don't make your payments on time, you may end up meeting the his "Wu Tang Wack!"Ese and 'Efe - The leaders of the Low Rider crew from Low Co., Ese and Efe' patrol the streets of Lotting Park - with 3 wheel motion, on chrome & white walls.  Don't get caught by them at the wrong time, in the wrong place, or you might find yourself getting "hit by switches".Rip, Slug, Torch- Three mysterious bad dudes from a mysterious place have come to Motorville with suspicious motives.  Are they just looters? Or are the part of a bigger plan leading to the distruction of Motorville?  Let's find out...And, that's not all, there are many, many more characters in Max Boost for you to meet!And included in the NEW Max Boost Volume 3.1, new characters such as Racerette, Trixie, Dizzy Dubz and other surprise characters will be making an appearance!The Max Boost studio is located in Mission Valley, San Diego, California.Hi!  My name is Dennis, and Max Boost is my comic that was featured in Import Tuner Magazine!As a kid my dream has always been to work in the comic industry.Luckily as a teenager, I was able to accomplish that by working for different comic companies. My Turbo Integra GS-R that was featured in Turbo Magazine back in 1997!During that time in the 90’s, I got my first new car - an Acura Integra GSR which ignited my passion for racing and cars - and my car was even featured in Turbo MagazineSo just like the anime Initial D, I wanted to combine my passion for Cars and Comics to create my own called Max Boost.If you don’t know Max Boost, you may know the magazine it was published in- a magazine I helped create and design in 1998-called Import Tunerwhich had about 1 Million readers per month.Unfortunately, after almost a decade of drawing, animating, and entertaining fans…. I abruptly stopped In 2006.The truth was we almost struck a massive deal with Warner Bros, and due to unfortunate circumstances, it got cancelled, I hit rock bottom and lost almost everything.Fans were wondering what happened, and where I went.And during these tough years, a highlight would be When I would randomly meet fans -and they would ask me to bring Max Boost back…So I knew I would come back,I just didn’t know when.The Max Boost Midori Civic, known as "Mikey ^2" is being built to eventually replicate the Max Boost Civic in the comic!So a couple of years ago I brought Max Boost classic issues back with Volume 1 and Volume 2.  It was a huge success!Between the two books, we finally reprinted ALL the classic issues of Max Boost that were published in IT from 1998-2006.I definitely am not doing this alone - it takes a lot of support from industry partners, friends, family, and a solid team. NOW the Max Boost Omnibus is the COMPLETE COLLECTION PLUS BRAND NEW PAGES OF MAX BOOST!!!During our last two campaigns, things blew up!Because of your support , we put life back into Max Boost Again!Building cars, racing, Sketching, Doing collabs, on podcasts, And even signing at the Honda booth at SEMAMax Boost Team cars - Micheal Bush "Natsuki" S2000 (Global Time Attack Car), HKS Supercharged & Mike Servin's EK hatch (Show Stoppah) powered by B15C5 Type R. So now after 15 long years I MADE IT here on Indiegogo to say:I'm FINALLY going to continue the Max Boost story line in a new book.  With your help, for the first time in forever…. I am DRAWING MAX BOOST AGAINMax Boost Team mate, Chad Richardson's Mustang GT that I get to compete in the NASA Time Trials with! Car is affectionately known as "Scarlet"!So, this book is currently only a prototype, and if you want to help the Max Boost Omnibus become a reality, then we need your support so we can hit our goal and gather enough orders to meet our manufacturers minimum order!  (Easy Peasy!)So, Max Boost Omnibus Collectors Edition is for a limited time only, reserve your OWN book now by clicking on the “back this project” button to be a Backer today!1) FIRST, FIND THE AVAILABLE OPTIONS ON THE RIGHT HAND SIDE OF THIS PAGE (you may need to scroll up)2) CLICK THE PERK WITH THE ITEMS YOU WANT - Pick what works best for you!  One Book, Two Book, etc.3) CLICK "GET THIS PERK"4) FOLLOW INSTRUCTIONS (Enter the shipping address*, payment method, log in to your Indiegogo account, etc)4) OFFICIAL ORDER FORM: Later this year we will invite you to complete your official order form where you will finalize your selections, your shipping address, and other details5) WE WILL SHIP THE ITEMS TO YOU - You will be the FIRST IN THE WORLD to get your hands on the comic, with an estimated ship date will be sometime in December 2021!Like previous volumes, as an option your name can be in the list of backers as a founder of The Max Boost Omnibus!*90 Day Satisfaction Guarantee; You get a 90 day satisfaction guarantee! Stretch goals are milestones that, if achieved, can reap benefits for Backers!  The more pledges, the merrier!$15,000 6 NEW Pages of  Max Boost Comics! ACHIEVED!$25,000 10 NEW Pages of  Max Boost Comics! ACHIEVED!$35,000 1 MORE additional Backer will be have a cameo in the book ACHIEVED!$50,000 1 x Bonus Item for all Book Backers ACHIEVED!$60,000 15 NEW Pages of  Max Boost Comics! ACHIEVED!$75,000 1 x Max Boost Air Freshener for every book order!$80,000 20 NEW Pages of Max Boost Comics!$100K - 30 NEW Pages of Max Boost Comics & ANOTHER Bonus gift for all Book Backers!And please don’t forget to share this project with your friends! Your support means a lot.I personally invite you to join the Max Boost team and be the first in the world to own your collectible copy .  Let’s make an incredible comic together, and bring max boost back better than ever!) SPECIAL "THANK YOU'S":My studio and comic peeps:Thank you to my family, Rachelle and of course my two sons Drake "Max" and Ronin "Otto" Caco for being such a support and inspiration.  This is dedicated to my boyzzzz!!!My studio and comic peeps:Nghia, Derek, Clydene Nee, Batton Lash, Joe Philips, Lex Wolfcraft, Chris NeuhahnCo-Workers and Friends; Memo Quibrera, Marat Zabelinskiy, Nick Coleman, April Estrada,  Rich Langi, Carter Jung, Rick, Andres the Car Kid, Wes Walz, Micheal Bush, Mike Servin, Anne, Alex, Ernie, Richard and Mark Artists and assistant artists:Rich, Jasen, Nghia, Eddie, Ray, Melissa, Derek, Conrad, TraceMy OG race team:Sam Rothschild, Dan Wilson, Lee Lim, Ian Penaflorida and Family, Gabe, Tim T.Ground Zero Racing and Online Performance, Eddie from Dynamic Autosport and Ha (RIP) from Pann Autosport for being my very first retail customers in the mid 90'sInfluencers & social partners:@mistergsx (www.youtube.com/mistermemo)@hasportperformance@vtecacademy@daiyoshihara@mattfield777@andresthecarkid@rothfab - Sam Rothschild@hasport_performance@vtec.academy@the_house_of_honda,@State_of_evolution@ifestcivic - Basit Mirza@sorenswiftCivic FK8 Type R Owners Facebook Group@craiglieberman_42@autocannon.art@thebigmike - www.ThinkBiggerProject.com@hondaprojason Jason Richmond@trackspecDD - Micheal Bush@smellypanda - Note!@vtecclubusa - Duane owns a Midori EK!@kinganytime - Gary King@miss_courtney_daySponsors & Industry:Nick Fousekis, Rich Langi, and the crew at Falken Tire, Basit Mirza and Import Fest , Wes Walz at Elite Finish, Justin and Jeff at CarTune Auto Repair, Edward Lee at Titan 7, Philip Chase, Kenji, Mike and the crew at Greddy, Volk, Tein, Art of Attack, Hasport, Vtec Academy  Jesbran from Eibach, Rick from Legacy Auto Spa, Emil and Ed and the gang at Extreme Autofest, Jim Liaw and the team at Formula D, Robert at Comickaze in San Diego,  Rich Calbay and Harry Kong (who was actually one of the first to bring Max Boost back about 4 years ago) from Nitto Tire, Thomas Okihisa and Toyo Tires, Note from Treefrog USA, Stu from Tokyo Pop, My agents Russel Binder, Jay Roth, Paulina Armstrong, Ryan and the Honda Challenge crew from NASA ProRacing, VTEC Club - Duane, Amir, and the whole cast of crazies showing what HONDA'S CAN DO!  And of course, Import Tuner Magazine.A VERY SPECIAL thank you to Bruce and the team at HONDA for believing in the Power of Dreams (like mine!)The Last Race Team:Alex Ranarivelo (Director) and Our Crew, and all the extras that stayed for 7+ hours to shoot our racing scenes!And of course YOU and all of our hardcore Max Boost fans!~ And I am sure I forgot some people, so I'll be adding more as I remember!THANK YOU ALL!  LET'S MAKE THIS HAPPEN!-Dennis and the Max Boost Crew Max Boost!® and Autocannon™ are TM & © 2019 of Caco Enterprises, Inc.Import Tuner® is TM & © 2019 SUPER STREET ONLINE | MOTOR TREND GROUP, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.Honda®, Acura®, Integra®, Vtec®, Type-R®, and Civic® are TM & © 2019 American Honda Motor Co. All rights reserved Used with permission.Toyota® is a TM and ©2019 Toyota Motor Sales, U.S.A., Inc. All rights reserved. Falken Tires® is TM and © 2019 Sumitomo Rubber North America, Inc. All Rights Reserved.  Titan 7 is ™ and © 2017 Titan 7 Wheels. All rights reserved. Eibach® is Copyright © 2019 Eibach. All Rights Reserved. * On packages where USA Shipping and Handling are not included (not including Alaska and Hawaii), shipping will be charged after the campaign ends during final checkout process called "BackerKit".  Shipping prices will be based on volume discounts to save you as much money as possible.  These books are not light weight!  They are 4 lbs each so expect shipping and handling charges to range between estimate of  $6-9 per order Domestic depending on your location.  International Shipping charges can range from $10-$25 per package or more for areas like Australia (but you probably already know that).  Prices do not include VAT / Tariffs / Duties / Taxes etc. so please plan accordingly*All products pictured and described are prototypes and are subject to change anytime

story:
Who is Barry Atwood?

Barry Atwood is taking part in Abrams Claghorn Gallery's 3rd annual professional development course. The course is designed to mentor and prepare selected artists for a gallery show. The course includes a three month program finishing with a summer exhibition debuting new works by each selected artist. this year, 3 selected artists are working with industry professionals to develop their artist statements, curatorial skills, and create new work ahead of the exhibition open date.

Barry Atwood's Story

Born in 1948, Barry Atwood was infected with Polio at age three and for the next three years was confined to an iron lung, unable to open or close his eyes. The sense of absolute helplessness had a lasting impact on his life, his art, and his drive for independence.  In 1955, his grandfather was elected to the board of education, which enabled him to become the first disabled child to be mainstreamed into grade school, middle and high school. Later, he became the first full-time disabled student to attend the University of New Mexico and to live in the student dormitories. 

Upon graduation, Atwood’s Grandfather gave him a camera and he enrolled in a photography class.  The result has been his lifelong obsession with the power of photography to capture an instant in time and express the wide spectrum of meaning found in the image. He later moved to Los Angeles and worked as a photographer in the entertainment industry, until he was accepted as the first disabled student at the UCLA School of Architecture.  The studios were located on the second floor, so his classmates carried him up and down the 27 steps to the second floor at least twice a day for two years; before an elevator was installed.

After finishing at UCLA, Atwood worked as a consultant on a wide range of architectural projects, including making private buildings or facilities accessible to individuals with disabilities and providing accommodations that facilitated the employment of the disabled.  Meanwhile, he used photography as the primary outlet for his creative impulse and began a lasting infatuation with the natural world and photographing landscapes. Combining his economic and artistic lives led him to join the US Access Board’s committee that created accessibility related specifications regulating the design and construction of trails serving the natural world.  In recent years he has discovered the city as a subject, with a focus on making  abstract images using elements found in the urban environment.

Recently, the pandemic forced the closure of his office and his deteriorating health has forced him to retire.  The cost of living in the Bay Area is high and Social Security is very limited, which has created several economic burdens.  However, his art is the refuge from the storm and sharing his visions with an audience is a bright light feeding his soul.

Barry Atwood was recently accepted into Abrams Claghorn Gallery's annual Emerging Artist Showcase. For his upcoming exhibition, he needs to frame the  photographs that will be shown. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $3000 to pay for the frames for the photographs in this art show.

Your donation will help make his 1st solo show look as imagined. Each person making a donation over $60 will receive a 11x17 print of Barry's work.

This show will help both Barry Atwood and the gallery. It has been a tough year for everyone, and this is true for those of is art business. Unfortunately Abrams Claghorn Gallery  is not in a position to provide the framing for this show. The success of this campaign will not only help Barry, but will make for a more successful show, and help the gallery survive the economic toll of the pandemic.

About Abrams Claghorn Gallery

Abrams Claghorn Gallery believes that everyone has a unique story to tell through creative expression.

Abrams Claghorn Gallery  pairs a curated gallery space with a museum-style store. Abrams Claghorn Gallery has exhibited fine art and functional artworks created by diverse Bay Area artists since April 2015.

Abrams Claghorn Gallery is dedicated to being inclusive and does not discriminate by race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, nationality, or in any other way.

 We present over 70 local makers in our diverse collection of home goods and art for sale. We also feature local and emerging artists, rotating monthly in our gallery. We showcase works that allow artists to focus on concept and masterful craftsmanship.

Barry Atwood is part of our 3rd annual professional development course. The course is designed to mentor and prepare selected artists for a gallery show. The course includes a three month program finishing with a summer exhibition debuting new works by each selected artist. this year, 3 selected artists are working with industry professionals to develop their artist statements, curatorial skills, and create new work ahead of the exhibition open date.

story:
Hello! My name is Lindsay I am a ceramic artist and educator who lives and works in San Francisco. I have been making, teaching and coordinating operations at Clay By The Bay, one of San Francisco’s largest community ceramic facilities, for 4 years. In an effort to help facilitate the growth of ceramic artists and the arts community at large in San Francisco, I have started the journey into studio ownership. The vision is to provide 24 hour access, private workspaces, shared equipment, and more autonomy to artists in and around San Francisco. The last few months with the help of the ownership and community at Clay By The Bay I have been searching out spaces, learning how to navigate commercial lease negotiations, building out a business plan and calculating my profit and loss to be a self-sustaining studio. (I know! I’m all business-y.) And guess what!?! Through this learning process, I have found a few spaces that would be fantastic for this project!  Now I need your help in making this dream a reality. 

To make this happen I need to raise $40k.  This money will be used to cover the deposit on a commercial lease, the purchase of studio equipment and the initial build-out of the space. I’ve included some break downs below:

     

Now, here is the fun part! You provide the funds, I provide the Hams! Yes. You read that right. Hams. You might be asking yourself, why hams? Well, it’s simple. I think it would be hysterical to tell people I built this studio on a foundation of 100 hams. So, for this fundraiser I will be making 100 limited edition hams. Each slip cast and hand detailed sculpture will be signed and numbered. After all the hams arrive safely in their new homes I will break the ham molds! There will never be another ham quite like these hams! Here’s the breakdown of some of my ham-tastic perks!

  1. $150 Mini Golden Ham Sculpture - Limited edition of 20
  2. $375 One Colorful Ham Sculpture in artist choice colors. - Limited edition of 70
  3. $1200 Golden Ham Sculpture - Limited edition of 10

If you still want to get in on the ham-tacular action but don’t want to go hog wild, I’ve got sticker perks and enamel pin perks too!! Not in Ham Heaven? Not a problem! Any donation is welcomed with gratitude. Your donation will be creating a space for artists to build independent studio practices that will sustain the cost of living and making in San Francisco.  If you are unable to contribute monetarily share this with a fellow ceramic and ham enthusiasts or post it on your social media. 

After I exceed my goal, I will use the funds to pay for the supplies and services used to make the ham sculptures. Anything beyond that will be deposited into a business account and the funds will be used in securing a space and build-out costs of the studio. In the unlikely event I am unable to raise my full goal through 100 hams I will deposit the funds into a business account while I work to build more startup capital. With my experience running studio operations at Clay By The Bay, and the mentorship and support I have received through the Clay By the Bay Community, I am 182.87% confident in my ability to build and sustain this project. Fun fact the heaviest ham ever recorded was 182.87 lbs. Coincidence? I think not.

If you still want to get in on the ham-tacular action but don’t want to go hog wild, I’ve got sticker perks and enamel pin perks too!! Not in Ham Heaven? Not a problem! Any donation is welcomed with gratitude. Your donation will be creating a space for artists to build independent studio practices that will sustain the cost of living and making in San Francisco.  If you are unable to contribute monetarily share this with a fellow ceramic and ham enthusiasts or post it on your social media. After I exceed my goal, I will use the funds to pay for the supplies and services used to make the ham sculptures. Anything beyond that will be deposited into a business account and the funds will be used in securing a space and build-out costs of the studio. In the unlikely event I am unable to raise my full goal through 100 hams I will deposit the funds into a business account while I work to build more startup capital. With my experience running studio operations at Clay By The Bay, and the mentorship and support I have received through the Clay By the Bay Community, I am 182.87% confident in my ability to build and sustain this project. Fun fact the heaviest ham ever recorded was 182.87 lbs. Coincidence? I think not.

story:
Hi there! Thanks for taking interest in my page.

My name is Corina S. Alvarezdelugo, or simply Corina. I am a professional mixed media painter and sculptor. I am also an art instructor who, fifteen years ago, fearing a communist takeover, emigrated to the U.S. from her country of origin, Venezuela.

[I have to apologize for the very amateur video here on my page, as it was recorded by me alone, with zero experience in video-making, using my cell and with very little time to do it. Therefore, I'm sharing this interview that just came up on the air, about my most recent body of work, on the Connecticut Public Television (CPTV) – Spotlight on the Arts’ segment- This way you can get a better idea of who I am and what my work is about... Here’s the link: http://youtu.be/2Y8N31spX6g]

After obtaining my degree in Arts, twelve years of intensive work, and literally hundreds of exhibitions, I have been offered a merit-based grant and work-exchange fellowship to attend a life changing “artist in-residency” program at the prestigious Vermont Studio Center in Johnson, VT.

To that end, I am eligible for partial aid, but… I dearly need additional support.

A little about myself. As any artist, I have gone through progressive stages. Today, some see me as a visual storyteller, as my work always has something to say to the viewer. As a concerned citizen, often times my works have taken position on some troubling issues of our time: global warming, our environment, violations of human rights, and on the tragedy being lived in the country where I grew up.

                 

The Truth is Shining Through, 2014
Encaustic, textiles, ink on panel; 12" x 12" x 1.5"

My last series, presented in a Solo exhibition, took a big toll on me as it touched so close upon my personal life. But I must move on, so participating in the studio center's vibrant community, and having access to its state-of-the-arts facilities (for a four-week marathon) will definitely help me shake out the demons, and come up with a new series, in preparation to my next Solo exhibition to be held in September.


Peace Interrupted II, 2014
Encaustic mixed media on panel, 36" x 36"

 I will give you a glimpse of the costs. The Vermont Studio Center's residency fee is $4,000, an amount that has been reduced to $2,500 with the help of a $900 Merit-based grant, and a $600 work-exchange fellowship.  

My goal, however, is to raise the original sum, to pay for:

-Balance of tuition
-Art materials
-Travel expenses, including some meals due to dietary restrictions
-Indiegogo's commission to host this campaign
-PayPal fees
-Shipping of the perks (except for the sculptures, unless I get more than what I'm asking for, then I will include the shipping for those too)

If you can and want to help me, please go to the DONATE button. But forget the big number. Whatever the amount, it will be both encouraging and useful. As a show of gratefulness, I will send you in return a token of my work. Please see PERKS. 

                

Samples of Encaustic Monotypes, some of which I will
be given out as a token of my appreciation.

Thanks for taking the time. I will truly appreciate your support. As step by step I make my way in the trying world of art, I will always remember those who, at this stage, helped me move ahead.

Please share this page on your social media platforms, it might be of great additional help!

Corina
______________

Please, click HERE to read the article written by Ed Wierzbicki about my last Solo, Remendando Mi Patria on WNPR
Please, click on the the highlighted title to view the book/catalogue: Remendando Mi Patria
Those donating $1000 or more, may choose one of the following sculptures:


Bunny, stoneware, 10" x 9.5" x 11"


Lady Environmentalist, stoneware, 10" x 9" x 13"


Quack, stoneware, 8" x 7" x 11"


The Golden Pig, stoneware, 9" x 10.5" x 12"


Rhino, stoneware and encaustic, 12" x 9" x 13"

To read a recent blog interview, please click HERE.

story:
Rockins are unique, alien artwork hand-painted on stone... with personality and a story.

The idea for Rockins came from our youngest artist and writer, Ashley Bishop. Ashley loves to write stories and paint, so she suggested that we create a business doing the things we all love. It would bring us closer and give everyone an equal sense of contribution and pride. Not to mention we're having a blast working together! Rose prefers to paint most of the time, while Sierra is a master of character creation.  So if you like great art and intriguing stories, we think you'll love our Rockins!

Thanks,
Rose, Sierra, and Ashley :)

P.S. We chose the Flexible Funding option, so even if we don't hit our goal everyone will still get their rewards!


What You Get

Every Rockin is one of a kind. Choose a boy or girl, plus pick a color for us to incorporate OR let us choose everything and we'll send you a wonderful surprise. Know someone who has everything? Do they have an alien version of themselves? Didn't think so. No worries, they can have one now! Choose the "Galactic Gift" reward, where you tell us about the recipient and we will use part of their name and personality to create a Rockin... and then send it to them! Yes, you can gift yourself and turn yourself into a Rockin, too (-; we knew you'd ask ;-) Either way, you'll receive a digital copy of the Rockin's picture and story card, so you can see what we sent.

Included with every Rockin is a unique name and personality card with a short story about their career, accomplishments, and struggles on the planet Rocca.


Rockins are numbered and signed by the artists who paint them and come with a beautiful Certificate of Authenticity.


What We Need

We need funding for art and shipping supplies and to build a website where people can adopt Rockins online. It would be great if we could add games and build a community for Rockin owners, too. The amount of funding we receive will determine which features can be developed.

Thanks for supporting us and please, tell your friends about Rockins!

Our Goals

If we reach $5,000 >>> We upgrade all adoption kits to include a Rockin Crash Pad to display your Rockins on. These will be custom cornhole bags in a variety of colors and designs. The cost for the adoption kits will not increase as a result of this upgrade due to savings on volume packaging that we will receive.

If we reach $10,000 >>> We get to build the Rockins website for online adoptions, games, stories, community, and more!

If we reach MORE THAN $10,000 >>> Sierra will faint! I'm not kidding.

Risks & Challenges

Production of the Rockins is incredibly fun and a ton of hard work, but there isn't much risk involved. We live in Colorado, so we have plenty of rocks and we create the art and the stories ourselves. We're already working on lots of new characters, so everyone can start getting their Rockins quickly after the campaign ends. Support our project and in return we'll send you awesome artwork with a great story.

The Rewards

PAYMENTS SENT VIA PAYPAL WILL GET THEIR REWARDS SENT WITHIN A WEEK OR TWO OF PAYMENT. OTHER PAYMENTS WILL GET REWARDS 30 - 45 DAYS AFTER THE CAMPAIGN ENDS.

The rewards are pretty self explanatory, but please send us any questions you have. We will continue to add interesting new rewards throughout the campaign, including more Rockins from the original 10 collection and other awesome stuff (so keep an eye out for our daily updates)!

                The Origin of Rockins

A Rockin Dream

Ashley was napping in the living room when a fateful dream transported her galaxies away…

She was on a small planet called Rocca. The Rockins who lived there were diverse and colorful with tiny sparkles under their skin. But why were they running away? Determined to introduce herself and get to know the Rockins, Ashley chased after them.

The Rockins had gathered in the center of town for an urgent meeting. A famous scientist named Ryan McRock discovered why Rocca was getting colder by the day. Their sun was dying! “It will implode and turn into a black hole taking the entire solar system with it”, he told them.

Things Got Crazy

The Rockins were in a panic!


They demanded Ryan to save them RIGHT NOW! Well, it just so happened that Ryan also recently discovered life on planet Earth and figured their only chance for survival would be to come here. So he loaded all the Rockins, their livestock, and their pets onto a massive spaceship and blasted off.

Rockins Have Landed

Ryan McRock did not count on Earth’s atmosphere being so radically different.


The Rockins were instantly transformed to stone, trapping them in suspended animation forever. Their unpiloted ship plunged quickly towards the Earth, crashing right into Ashley’s back yard! She and her sisters, Sierra and Rose, found the Rockins and knew they would need help caring for so many of them. They decided to form the Intergalactic Adoption Agency and find homes for their Rockins all over the world!

Other Ways To Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.

Please, help us get the word out and make some noise about Rockins!

They demanded Ryan to save them RIGHT NOW! Well, it just so happened that Ryan also recently discovered life on planet Earth and figured their only chance for survival would be to come here. So he loaded all the Rockins, their livestock, and their pets onto a massive spaceship and blasted off.
Rockins Have Landed

They decided to form the Intergalactic Adoption Agency and find homes for their Rockins all over the world!



Other Ways To Help

Please, help us get the word out and make some noise about Rockins!

story:
Revealing Nature & illuminating the past

  • For over 3 decades I've illuminated the natural world on CIbachrome, a  color photographic darkroom material that is no longer manufactured.
  • My art form was creating unique, one-of-a-kind prints without film or camera through direct exposure on color print material in the darkroom.
  • Now I would like to build a new black and white darkroom and continue my investigation of new creative discoveries in fine art photography.
  • You will be a co-creative contributor in keeping the darkroom arts ALIVE!

Thank you for considering that fine art photographs you see hanging in museums today did not originate with digital technology. The hands on craft is magical!

The New Darkroom Plan

Join me in my commitment to analog photography by helping secure a space and establish a wet darkroom for black and white photographic processes.

  • $15,000. is needed to lease, plumb and equip a place for a new black and white darkroom space. I chose to locate this new space in a region of California where Ansel Adams, Edward Weston and many photographers were inspired by nature. It has a strong photographic history but no open darkroom facilities.
  • As co-creators you will receive special rewards of natural beauty to inform and delight you. Some levels reflect the Cibachrome art forms from my past. Other levels will receive upcoming prints from the new darkroom portfolios.
  • Since I am committed to this new art form and it may take more than one fundraising session, you can be assured that your contribution will be part of the continued analog photographic printing quest. This goal is achievable and will be touching the lives of other photographers through my ongoing classes.

    • Currently, I have a studio where I exhibit and teach in Carmel, California

  • I have secured a studio space where you can see my past inventory of work if you would like to visit in Carmel since relocating here from southern California 2 years ago.
  • I also started a women's photography group which I lead in the Carmel area called, FotoSaga. It current attendees ages span 60 years and they come from as far as 100 miles away to attend. Inspiring other photographers is important!

Creative Light

There is always work to do. My commitment to being an art professional is well documented and I plan to continue the pursuit of fine art photography.

  • After 30 years, I have seen and overcome many pitfalls that may distract one from being a fine artist. They will occur, it is a given. But creativity is spontaneous and persistent. Your funds will be used to sustain that growth.
  • I will attain a black and white darkroom dream, just as the Cibachrome darkroom of the past existed and gave me the tools I used to create!

Other Ways You Can Co-Create

Support the photographic arts by purchasing original photographs and fine art!

  • If you can't contribute, please remember this. Purchase fine art from individuals, no matter what medium. Keep the arts ALIVE!
  • Sharing is easy and possible with Indiegogo share tools! Please use them to pass on this endeavor with others!

Thank You!

story:
The Fringe

Aloha! Yes, we are excited to once again bring Fringe to Honolulu. This will be our 4th year in putting on an event that celebrates the many performing art forms in our community.  As an all-volunteer Fringe, we are dedicated to showcasing all of the amazing artists who are ready to give you an amazing time at Fringe 2015.

This year we have expanded from Chinatown to Kaka’ako which we are super excited about. However, with this expansion there are more responsibilities, as we will be situated in 6 different venues.   Yes, 6 venues across two neighbouring areas.  We do have the volunteer team to create this platform, but we can only do so much on a limited budget.  With your generosity you will be able to help us help our artists succeed and give you a fun time of watching live entertainment in theatre, dance, improv, music, aerial, circus performances and more in 4 days.  Now that’s a very delicious buffet of art.

Fringe Impact

In three years, O'ahu Fringe Festival has connected many artists to our community who bravely sought out new works that challenge their perspective of live entertainment.   Artists are given this creative platform to test new grounds and develop their skills in producing work they are proud of.  One of the feel good stories we have had thus far is Kachuzzi Presentare! who performed at O'ahu Fringe 2012 went on to perform at the Santa Cruz Fringe Festival. Clearly, this is an indication of how a Fringe can impact someone's creative career by connecting artists from all over to other festivals.  Fringe is a great launching pad. 

Fringe Challenges

As an all-volunteer Fringe our goal is to elevate the artists at Fringe and contritbute to the artistic landscape of Hawai'i.  However, with a limited budget we can only do so much.  There are some things that we dearly need help with and your kind donation will enable us to do more for our artists in: 

· our media drive in radio, TV, social media.

· printing costs of promotional materials such as postcards, fliers and programs.

· advertising in various media publications.

· box office supplies.

· rental of gear such as chairs, extra lights and sound gear.

· printing of tote bags, shirts, stickers, pens, badges and other fun bits for Fringe.

We realize time is short, but we believe we can raise the funds we need with your support to help us fulfill our goal of hosting a delicious 4 days of new and engaging performances. It is a win win opportunity.

Other Fringey Ways You Can Help

We appreciate the time you've taken to consider our campaign. If this is not the right time for you, there are other ways that you can help us reach our goal.

*  Please spread the word  - we really do appreciate you giving us a big shout out through word of mouth or through social media. Please share and share.

*  Share using the Indiegogo share tools.

*  Please check out our website to see the fantastic acts we have and share their information with your contacts.

*  In-Kind donation are greatly appreciated.

*  Consider joining us as a volunteer and bring a smile to everyone involved.

*  Keep sharing the Fringe Love.

Remember, your support of Fringe is also about connecting our communities together through the medium of the arts.

story:
The Artistic Dream

I'm Kylyn and am a senior high-schooler at Tempe's school of Arts, NSAA. I am an aspiring artist in creative writing, drawing, and painting. I attend an art school where I have taken life drawing two of my school years, mixed media/ painting classes for one year, and all four years in creative writing class! One of my dreams would be to try to publish a book where I had illustrations of my own with my writing.

 Though to begin with I have been wanting to get a digital art tablet for my artwork from the encouragement of peers and family. I've realized that there are so many opportunities digital art opens up to artist's. Opportunities like creating characters for animation films, illustrations for books, or something as simple as selling personal artwork online are what I would love to have in my life.

My campaign is about earning money to put towards getting a Wacom tablet and the essentials needed to go with it along with donating to NSAA where aspiring young artists like me go to school. The tablet is used for making digital art but convenient to use like pencil to paper. I would be able to put programs on it to help enhance my artwork. 

One reason I decided to try to earn funding on the website was because I know money is tight in my household. I live with a hardworking single mother who has supported me in everything and has been a role model to me of what a hard worker is. For this, I would also like to say that if I don't reach my funds goal, or raise enough to at least get the Wacom tablet, I will put all the money towards my high-school to help my mom pay for the minor tuition and to donate towards art supplies for other students! 

The tablet, different tips for the tablet's pen, and wireless accessory kit to link the tablet to a computer is a standard kit worth up to 450$. Links are below. 
  • http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16823100127&cm_re=wacom-_-23-100-127-_-Product
  • http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16823100100&cm_re=wacom-_-23-100-100-_-Product
  • http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16823100099&cm_re=wacom_companion-_-23-100-099-_-Product
If I make more than 450$I will donate all that is left to NSAA. The link to NSAA is below.

Why Help?

Contributions to help me put donations towards my school will help me show my fellow peers that we as artists can make a difference and can reach our dreams. It might knock the very socks off of my principal if I can tell her I have raised money to donate to the school. I feel that a tablet could really help change my life for the better by giving me the opportunity to show my art skills especially when wanting to find a career that coincides with digital art and makes me happy. 
I am dedicated to working hard. I have made the design for the back wall of my high school which will be painted this coming summer, and I have also co-designed one of this years school T-shirts. One thing I have been working on currently is earning college credits through a scholarship program I got the luck of qualifying for where by the end of my senior summer I will have earned half of my associates degree. 
I want to make a difference, and in order to do that I know I can not do it alone. With the help of others who also want to make an impact in peoples lives, I believe I can really achieve my goals as well as them. It means so much to me and will for those at my school. So if this does well, thank you in advance!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help me with laying the foundation to my artistic dream and donate to help my fellow students with their own at NSAA please let anyone you think would also like to help me make a difference by spreading the word. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word about my campaign!

story:
The Fort

I'm Minx, I am the creative leader of my Burning Man group for Lakes of Fire 2015.  The community is so special because we live by the guiding principles, which have completely changed my outlook on life. I see that there is so much life, excitement and endless ability to create and embrace! I have developed quite a passion and respect for the creativity that the people bring to the table, and it has inspired me! I have been involved in the Burning Man community for 10 years, and as my celebratory 10 year anniversary project, I envisioned The Fort.  The Fort will further be supported by and created through the efforts of my wonderful burner family, The Good Vibe Tribe, a/k/a "The Squirrels."

The Fort will be a communal gathering point. A place where people can meet new friends. A place to schedule meet ups with your crew. A place that can be explored and experienced.  A place to be a big kid again! The vision is to create an alluring, climbable, tri-tower double-decker play structure!

Just image...

You walk down the dusty road, and come upon a massive structure, looking somewhat like a castle with colorful flags adorning The Fort, flying in the wind like they are announcing the celebration of your arrival.  You can't wait to check it out. You start by racing your friend up the 15 foot vertical cargo net. Trying out each playful way to get to the top level of the towers. Zipping down the slide.  Feeling the wind in your hair as you swing freely on the dual swings. Being rambunctious by swaying and swirling around on the tire swing with your friend, flipping and twisting on the aerial hoop,  playing with the contraptions on the Fort, like the pulley flag race between towers. Dance to our neighboring sound camp's thumpin' beats as you dance freely under the sun or stars from one of the three top platforms. Or you may want to rest your feet and kick back on the bottom shaded platform,  You may peek through the top floor's spy glass to see what's going on at the camps all the way on the other side of the lake, but not that you'd really want to leave all the fun you're having!     (Check out our GALLERY at the top of the page for our draft designs and various images!)

The Good Vibe tribe is also bringing out our 2012 theme camp pieces, so you are welcome to also challenge your friend to a foam sword fight on the balance beam, or rebound a fly ball when playing with the bucket ball post, or perhaps the colorful balls of the giant kerplunk will entice you to challenge a stranger!

 

I personally love installations that I can physically explore and interact with and embody a fun ‘Hey, let’s go do that!’ vibe.  The gravitation towards the Fort will be strong!  Plato once said, "Life must be lived as play", and I couldn't agree more! We forget that play keeps us young!   The Fort will provide a destination that allows you to be fully present in the moment and will surely add to countless people's sense of exploration and enjoyment!

We will build this in such a way that we can tear down and re-build the structure every year without any damage, so the project will live on and will evolve to be even more exciting and interactive! 

What We Need to make it happen!

  • $1,500 is our fundraising goal
  • This goal only accounts for 1/3 of the project's costs.
  • Your contributions go towards lumber, hardware, the swings and other play items, and transportation costs.
  • To make up the remainder of our costs, we have several other interactive fundraising parties planned over the next several months

Your Impact

Any denomination that you can provide will be quite helpful!

  • $25 could help us buy a swing
  • $50 could help us purchase the fabric needed for The Fort's flags
  • $75 would pay for the flooring for one tower
  • $100 could help us build a slide
  • $250 helps us safely light the structure for night play
  • $700 would pay for our transportation costs
  • $850 would pay for all the custom made brackets needed to support The Fort
  • $1000 could help build an entire tower, 3 are needed 

Endless gratitude from my heart to yours for taking the time to read about our project for Lakes of Fire 2015. Thank you for any contributions you're able to provide! Thank you! Namaste!

story:
The Spiel.

The First Annual Art Awakening Festival is a student-run collaborative project dedicated to bringing together all artistic expression within the Binghamton area, and more specifically within Binghamton University's student body. The project is being run by the Alpha Delta Phi Society, Candid, and Guitar Club.
Those of us involved in organizing the festival have big dreams, and any big dream requires funding. Thats where you come in! 
What better way to fund this dream, than working together to create a win-win-win partnership between the clubs, the festival, and you! 
For the first time ever, you have the opportunity to buy a product from multiple art groups on campus, all in one place!
Your donation will not only help fund the Art Awakening Festival, but will also help fund the specific group you're buying from. Your donation will go beyond the date of the festival, as it will improve the overall quality of art groups on campus way after the festival is over. Which is the very dream of Art Awakening.
So please, support Art Awakening, support the arts here at Binghamton University, and support the art that is blooming around.

story:
· qué · cómo · cuándo · dónde ·

Mi Nombre es Juan Manuel Ramírez Ramírez. Soy artista plástico y me dedico a dibujar desde antes de graduarme como artista de la Universidad Nacional de Colombia. Mi trabajo lo dedico a explorar todas las posibilidades técnicas y conceptuales del dibujo. Esto me ha llevado a realizar exposiciones de mi obra personal, ilustraciones para libros infantiles y científicos e ilustraciones para las vitrinas del Museo del Oro de Bogotá, Armenia, Santa Marta y Cartagena.

Desde el 2007 hasta el presente he estado haciendo un estudio en dibujos de las obras que se exhiben en los museos de Bogotá así como de la arquitectura de estos espacios: el Museo Nacional, la Casa Museo Quinta de Bolivar, el Museo del Oro y la Manzana Cultural del Banco de la República.


Dibujo del Pez Alado de la colección del Museo De Oro


Esto llevó a que en 2010 ganara una convocatoria sobre intervenciones artísticas en la Casa Museo Quinta de Bolivar y en el 2014 las directivas del Museo del Oro me invitasen a exponer todo este trabajo en la primera exposición individual de un artista que se ha realizado en la historia del museo. Esta exposición estuvo durante cuatro meses en una de las salas con el nombre de "Un Artista Dibuja en el Museo", y en el mismo año fue llevada a exponerse en la Casa Museo Quinta de Bolivar durante cinco meses, de septiembre de 2014 a febrero de 2015.


 

"Un Artista Dibuja en el Museo"  80 dibujos expuestos en la sala El Exploratorio del Museo del Oro de Bogotá


Ahora, con la ayuda de usted, quiero ampliar esta colección de más de 100 obras a lápiz, carbón y grafito de los museos de Bogotá, con dibujos realizados durante dos meses en Museos de Madrid, París y Barcelona.
Durante los meses de abril, mayo y junio mi objetivo es dibujar diariamente en las colecciones permanentes de diferentes museos en estas tres ciudades:

MADRID
  • En el MUSEO REINA SOFÍA, dibujaré durante 5 días obras que ya escogí por medio de la pagina web.
  • En el MUSEO DEL PRADO también dibujaré durante 5 días obras de Diego Velázquez y haré estudios de la exposición temporal que tengan en el momento de mi paso por este museo.
  • En el MUSEO THYSSEN-BORNEMISZA dibujaré durante otros cinco días seguidos obras de artistas del siglo XX.
PARÍS
  • En el MUSEO DEL LOUVRE dibujaré únicamente la emblemática escultura la Victoria de Samotracia durante 10 días. 
  • Alternaré con dibujos de arte del siglo XX en el CENTRO POMPIDOU. 
BARCELONA
  • En Barcelona dibujaré en el MUSEO PICASSO, recorreré la FUNDACIÓN ANTONI TÀPIES, el MUSEO DE ARTE DE BARCELONA y el MUSEO NACIONAL DE ARTE DE CATALUÑA durante más de 15 días.
Para llevar a cabo este proyecto necesito reunir en los próximos 25 días USD 6,500 para financiar el tíquet de ida y regreso a Europa, los gastos de alojamiento, alimentación y transporte de ciudad a ciudad.

"Un Artista Dibuja en el Museo".  80 dibujos expuestos en la sala El Exploratorio del Museo del Oro de Bogotá.

Su contribución es muy importante para mí porque me ayudará a continuar con este proyecto cuyo objetivo es alimentar la cultura visual de las personas que visitan los museos, y por medio de mi obra ayudarles a entender los motivos que tuvieron los artistas al crear sus obras y el por qué están en aquellos museos tan importantes del mundo.

Cada persona que colabore económicamente con el proyecto recibirá a cambio y en agradecimiento desde una postal, un afiche, uno o dos dibujos originales dependiendo de la suma con la que contribuya cada persona. En la sección de recompensas podrá ver lo que recibirá a cambio*.

Todos los fondos que recaude en este proyecto se destinarán al viaje y a la hechura de las postales y afiches que haré al regresar a mi país.

Montaje de la exposición "Un Artista Dibuja en el Museo" en la que se muestra los dibujos que hice en los museos de Bogotá junto con los textos que escribo en mi blog en donde explico el proceso de elaboración de cada dibujo. 
Museo del Oro, Bogotá.

Como dije mas arriba, este proyecto, que ahora es una colección de mas de cien obras en dibujo, ha tenido gran acogida en los museos de Bogotá, por el premio que gané en 2010 y por las dos exposiciones que se realizaron en 2014 en dos de los museos mas importantes de Bogotá.

El desafío que tengo es el compromiso con mi obra al dedicarme exclusivamente a realizar a diario al menos cuatro dibujos de la calidad que caracteriza mi obra y que ya he mostrado en redes sociales y aún mas importante en las exposiciones que se han llevado a cabo en Bogotá. 


*Se hará el envío si usted se encuentra en Estados Unidos, Sur América o Europa Occidental. Desafortunadamente, no cuento con servicio de envío a países ubicados en otras zonas.
