story:
Allow me to introduce Wham Bam Slam:

Darren Edwards, Whitney Shurtleff, Janae Godfrey, Lauren Jo Sypniewski, and Ron Coulson have been chosen to represent Southern Utah at the National Poetry Slam 2015 with the help of their awesome coach, Erika Larsen!

From hosting local open mics for ALL creative writing, to running successful poetry slam events all throughout Southern Utah, each of us are active in doing what we can to continue building and growing our local scene.

However, in order to attend nationals, we need YOUR help!

Here's the breakdown:

Nationals, while fantastic and filled with opportunities to learn and grow, isn't cheap. Below you will see a breakdown of the costs*.

Registration - $500 (This covers all team members and our coach)

Room & Board for 6 (5 team members and 1 Coach) - $1600 for 5 days/nights

Gas money for 6 (5 team members and 1 Coach) - $400 round trip/parking fees

*Total amount does not represent the overall amount needed to be raised

Your generosity is greatly appreciated, every little bit helps! We want to assure you that we are NOT just sitting back and relying on the kindness of others, each of us has been working hard for this opportunity and will continue to do what we can to earn our way!

Why is this so important?

Nationals isn't just about the competition! It is also about the various workshops and side events that will be taking place which will not only help us strengthen our craft, but allow us to make wonderful new connections! These are experiences and knowledge that we get to bring back and share with our scene, which is one of THE most important aspects about doing all this!

Additional ways you can help:

If you can't help out financially, there are other ways to show your love and support! Be sure to use Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word! We are continually humbled by the amount of generosity and support that people have shown us throughout the years, and we love each and every single one of you!

We would also love to see you at Storm the Mic on Tuesdays, as well as at our Poetry Slams on the first Friday of every month, located at Jazzy's Rock and Roll Grill. Search for Storm the Mic on Facebook and add yourself to the group to keep updated with all the events we have going on!
story_txt: Allow me to introduce Wham Bam Slam:Darren Edwards, Whitney Shurtleff, Janae Godfrey, Lauren Jo Sypniewski, and Ron Coulson have been chosen to represent Southern Utah at the National Poetry Slam 2015 with the help of their awesome coach, Erika Larsen!From hosting local open mics for ALL creative writing, to running successful poetry slam events all throughout Southern Utah, each of us are active in doing what we can to continue building and growing our local scene.However, in order to attend nationals, we need YOUR help!Here's the breakdown:Nationals, while fantastic and filled with opportunities to learn and grow, isn't cheap. Below you will see a breakdown of the costs*.Registration - $500 (This covers all team members and our coach)Room & Board for 6 (5 team members and 1 Coach) - $1600 for 5 days/nightsGas money for 6 (5 team members and 1 Coach) - $400 round trip/parking fees*Total amount does not represent the overall amount needed to be raisedYour generosity is greatly appreciated, every little bit helps! We want to assure you that we are NOT just sitting back and relying on the kindness of others, each of us has been working hard for this opportunity and will continue to do what we can to earn our way!Why is this so important?Nationals isn't just about the competition! It is also about the various workshops and side events that will be taking place which will not only help us strengthen our craft, but allow us to make wonderful new connections! These are experiences and knowledge that we get to bring back and share with our scene, which is one of THE most important aspects about doing all this!Additional ways you can help:If you can't help out financially, there are other ways to show your love and support! Be sure to use Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word! We are continually humbled by the amount of generosity and support that people have shown us throughout the years, and we love each and every single one of you!We would also love to see you at Storm the Mic on Tuesdays, as well as at our Poetry Slams on the first Friday of every month, located at Jazzy's Rock and Roll Grill. Search for Storm the Mic on Facebook and add yourself to the group to keep updated with all the events we have going on!

story:
FRAMEWERK presents


BASS
Belfast Artists’ Sonic Showcase

The exhibition aims to raise people’s awareness of sound as a creative art form and to increase public engagement of such. Thus, the exhibition is comprised of a month long series of activities. These include singular and collaborative sound exhibitions, performances, workshops and presentations.  

 Due to the specificity of the medium, the ongoing Arts funding cuts and local culture in terms of exhibition attendance, we have decided to use the crowd funding platform 'Indiegogo' to support both the Gallery and each Artist during this time. For this purpose, the Artists have created a series of unique and innovative rewards for funding patrons.

Here is a run down of each Artist and the work they will be submitting throughout the month, with your help and generous donations.

Rui Chaves

Primarily an Artist and Researcher, Chaves' work is an on-going interdisciplinary sound based artistic practice with site-specific interventions, video art, mixed-media installation and community art projects.

Chaves has presented his work in Canada, Brazil and Europe.


'I Walk In The Sand Towards The Ocean.' 

Chaves will also show an original piece of his audio-visual work, the title of which clearly delineates the core action in the piece.

Forming part of an audiovisual interplay in which the visual composition and microphone position emphasises not only the sonic effect of walking in sand, but also a spatial and sonic transition. 

The body moving through a landscape elicits a process that translates critical issues in field recording: human agency, presence and place-mediation strategies.

www.ruichaves.com


Barry Cullen

Barry Joseph Cullen (born 1977) is a Belfast based  Audio and Video Artist who has worked, performed and researched in Europe, North and South America.

His practice includes delivering DIY electronics, audio tech and motion graphics workshops, interactive AV installation works, DJing, VJing and creative technical support.

'Analogue Granular'

Cullen will set up a prawn cracker with piezo/contact microphone, clamped and attached to 9v dirty amplifier. 

The audience will be supplied with soy sauce, pipette dropper and spare crackers then encouraged to drop soy sauce on said prawn cracker.

A mono cassette tape player will play a handmade looped tape recording of the amped up foodstuff in action

The objects will be exhibited along with some black and white Lino Print images and text, the same images Cullen will make available for funding patrons.

https://barryjosephcullen.wordpress.com/


Christian Donaghey 

Christian is a 21 year old musician and sonic artist, currently based in Derry. He is best known for his current and ongoing project Autumns, which explores various musical avenues including; Post-punk, Nowave and Industrial music. Christian's involvement with the legendary Downwards label since he was 19, demonstrates his keen ear for noise and sonic exploration, through the use of effects pedals, guitars, drum machines and various materials. 

'Solace' 

Solace is the creation of a piece of improvised music consisting of an array of effects pedals, feedback loops, distorted vocals and Industrial rhythms. The feeling and movement of the music is inspired by Donaghey's consistent health disturbances and obsession with existentialism. 

This will be Christian's second  solo sonic performance. Expect a live spectacle made up of crowd interactions and spontaneous actions. 

https://www.facebook.com/Autumns.Band 



The Host

Based between London and Northern Ireland, Barry Lynn has been issuing forward thinking electronic music though labels such as Planet Mu, Hotflush and Cosmic Bridge for over a decade.

Under the guise of The Host, he has combined his natural musicianship with hazed hypnagogic melodies and tranced-out 21st century psychedelia.

Touch Sensitive Presents The Host (live) 

As a pre-cursor to the release of the Esalen Lectures LP, Touch Sensitive presents The Host live as part of BASS. 

Inspired by mind-expanding ‘happenings’, as opposed to linear gig set-ups, and the NorCal psychedelic retreat referenced in the Esalen Lectures, the evening will include a live guitar and hardware set from The Host alongside complimentary visuals and records selected by Touch Sensitive DJs in a fully immersive sensory experience.

Using sweeping synthesizer patterns and subtle field recordings, The Host creates dramatic arcs. Spiralling guitar squalls meet blissed-out, motionless womb lullabies and digitally-enhanced nocturnes to tell a weird story of induction, hypnosis and psychic disturbance. 

https://www.facebook.com/events/472034336280139/



Bernadette Comac

Comac's work entails the use of new internet technologies in multimedia works and live performance. She is interested in harnessing the use of new mobile technologies, not only to make her work more accessible, but to merge the digital and real world through artistic practice.

 As a digital composer and sonic artist she wishes to marry contemporary music and visual practices with the latest in interactive technologies.

Bernadette will be showing three separate works at FRAMEWERK.

The Virtual Performer

This is a standalone holographic work inspired by the 'Virtual Assistants' introduced at airports some years ago. 

The work consists of a video recording of the singer Sarmen Almond performing a score written by Comac and projected onto holographic screen material, attached to a cut out figure.

The vocal piece itself is preoccupied with current ideas in world affairs. Comac was influenced by the ' Occupy' movement and its concerns with global issues.

 Sarmen Almond, the performer, has an extended range of vocal sounds. Comac explored the use of these in expressing the real frustrations and generalised inertia in the face of real or perceived political inequalities. 

Apart from the vocal work, there is a short spoken section which addresses the need for acceptance of post trauma in the context of the 'Troubles'.

STUX IV series for ibeacons

STUX IV is a series of sonic works which make use of Apple’s indoor positioning technology, iBeacon, to bring an augmented reality experience to your mobile phone. 

Small devices called ‘Estimotes’ will be attached to a wall within the gallery. These devices act as bluetooth beacons which send push notifications to your mobile phone and prompt you to open an app to play the an original sound work by Comac.

In order for the the piece to work the audience are to download the app ‘Locly’ from the Apple store.

STUX V series for Augmented Reality

STUV V is a series of works invoking elements of Augmented Reality (AR). AR is used to bridge the real world and the digital. Google glass became well known for using such software. 

Comac has set out to incorporate the use of AR in creating a new platform for her work.

Audiences are to download an app called ‘Aurasma’ which works on both IOS and Android devices. Headphones are recommended.

In this series, Comac has created framed works which are part score representations of the sonic pieces. When the images are scanned using mobiles devices, multimedia works are presented on screen. These framed pieces will be made available to funding patrons.

http://soundcloud.com/bcomac


Edward Butler

Butler is a Sonic and Visual Artist who has exhibited both in Europe and America. He was selected as Northern Irish music magazine, The Thin Air's, musical and creative talents for 2014-2015. 

Improvisation

Butler will enact a juxtaposition of pop music using weird sounds and performance.

Butler will perform an hour of completely original material, all improvised on the day with nothing pre planned. 

He and the other musicians will join in on piano, a sculptural junkyard percussion kit, voice sampling electronics and some other noise makers. The event will be filmed and the audio recorded professionally.

http://edwardfbutler.com 


Saul Rayson

 Saul Rayson is a composer, improviser and percussionist who has worked across many musical styles.

 In recent years Rayson has been experimenting and extending his sound with computer environments, Supercollider and Pure Data.

 He also builds various hardware hacks and instruments for sound manipulation, composition and improvisation. 

With this particular piece, the use of older and simpler technologies has been utilised, partly for their sonic misconduct and partly as a comment on the world's continual updating of technology and pristine digital recording.

'Augmented Resonating Snare Drum'

Rayson will modify a snare drum with resonant bars, which are suspended through the snare skin. 

A micro speaker is attached to the snare and a contact mic is attached to the opposite side, the microphone is attached to a small amp.

Various items are also available to be added to the snare drum, which interfere with the harmonic resonance of the drum. An old four track tape machine will feed the speaker with a selection pre recorded material, which the audience can mix.

Saul will also have an improvised performance, with the addition of different snare excitation and feedback loops.

www.saulrayson.wordpress.com


John Macormac

John is an artist currently undertaking a Master of Fine Art course at the Belfast School of Art. His current practice involves rule driven wall drawing, improvised drum performance and the manipulation of recorded video and sound.

His work explores pattern through mathematics, geometry, structure and environment. Process is key; time, action, choice and human agency are carefully considered. Work seeks to develop a connection between processes of the natural world and those of artistic creation, and to deconstruct the heroic expressive act of the artist. He achieves this through adherence to quasi scientific, systematic methods.

Semi-structured improvisation exploring order and chaos

A rule driven wall drawing has been carried out on the gallery wall. The complex, mesh like circular form is the result of building up many layers. John and Ben Behzadafshar will respond to the drawing and the gallery environment through a semi-structured improvisation piece performed on drums and guitar with multiple effects pedals. 

This performance, and other planned performances over the course of BASS will be documented on video which will be projected in the gallery dark space and be available to listen to through headphones. 

www.johnmacormacart.wordpress.com

James Robert Moore

James Robert Moore is a visual artist and musician, who since 2008 has been recording and releasing music under the name of 'Black Mountain Transmitter'. 

Moore creates instrumental soundscapes influenced by a diet of weird horror fiction, VHS era Video Nasty soundtracks, Radiophonic Workshop sonic trickery and the abject electronics of early Industrial music pioneers such as Throbbing Gristle and SPK.

Black Mountain Transmitter’s 'Black Goat of the Woods' (2009) has been released, and sold out, on three different record labels including Auris Apothecary (USA) and Aurora Borealis (UK).  Along with 'Playing With Dead Things' (2012) it forms the first two parts of a yet to be completed 'Trilogy of Terror'.

Black Mountain Transmitter rarely performs live but has made appearances at three Outer Church events curated by the Wire magazine’s Joseph Stannard and the Unearthing Forgotten Horrors festival in Newcastle Upon Tyne.

He has also released music under his own name as well as the aliases of Cloudland Ballroom and Sapir Whorf.  

His visual artwork has been featured on cassette releases by the Forced Nostalgia label and Ekoplekz’s 'Four Track Mind' double LP released on Planet Mu.

'A Short History Of Decay - Part 1'

Moore will produce a limited edition (25 copies) of a 30 minute audio cassette recording, accompanied and packaged with a Xerox printed zine and silkscreened print on newsprint. 

One copy of the cassette will be available to listen to in the gallery during the run of the exhibition, on a provided cassette Walkman and earphones. Displayed along with the zine and print.

The production of both the sound and visual components will utilise outdated and lo-fi production methods in a celebration of high noise to signal ratio and degraded information.

Black Mountain Transmitter will be performing as part of the exhibition.

www.lysergicearwax.com



Pablo Sanz

Pablo Sanz is a Spanish Sound Artist currently based in Belfast. His activities are engaged with the act of listening and the exploration of aesthetic and spatial aspects of sonic perception through site-specific projects, installations, live performances, radio pieces and publications.

He works primarily with environmental sound as raw material, using extended listening technologies, architectural space and surround sound to create immersive aural experiences. Thresholds of perception and the interrelations between hearing, matter, time and space are essential in his practice.
Sanz's work has been presented internationally, in a variety of contexts and to critical acclaim.

m·e·s·h  

Sanz will be showing an installation based on his project ‘m·e·s·h’, an ongoing series of pieces for headphones started in 2012. 
Each of the pieces is based on field recordings from a single geographical location, including a wide variety of environments in different countries. Multiple listening points installed throughout the gallery space will feature a selection from the series, including new work presented for the first time in this exhibition at FRAMEWERK.

http://pablosanz.info/

Die Hexen

Die Hexen, born in Northern Ireland 1979, is a self taught Performance and Sonic Artist, Musician and Film Composer. 

She works both sonically and visually through performance, visuals, dance, costume and installation. Creating original, visually arresting and thought provoking art.

'Lunar Terminator'

'Lunar Terminator' is an original audio visual soundfield installation.

The Lunar Terminator is the division between the illuminated and dark parts of the Earth's Moon. It is the lunar equivalent of the division between night and day on Earth.

This piece will be an audio visual metaphor to represent the moment between life and death; set to an all encompassing scale to evoke different questions of meaning and origin of life and death in the Universe.

Die Hexen will showcase a self edited, moving image filmed and co-directed by Photographer Helen Warner. This will consist of a joint performance by Die Hexen & Ruth Bate (Artist).

Die Hexen's accompanying musical composition will consist of manipulated original NASA recordings of the moon. These celestial sounds will be programmed to hang on the perimeter of unnerving drums and electronic sounds.

www.die-hexen.com

Steven Henry

 Steven is a Musician and Programmer based in Belfast. He is a member of the drone pop ensemble Documenta and performs with the group Sea Pinks. 

Steven's solo composition work utilises custom built hardware and software to explore musical perception and visualisation. 

'Cycle'

Composition for an octophonic speaker system.

Cycle' is an exploration of musical instrumentation and space, designed for octophonic speaker system. It builds on eight musical themes chosen to highlight the spatial effect.

Four-part, algorithmically generated, synthesised melodies cycle around the eight speaker array forming a rotating sound field, as sequenced studio and field recordings are projected within. 

Listeners are free to move around the piece which has been designed to emphasise certain musical elements based on their relative position.

www.kingsteven.com

Li-Li and Hadi Bastani
'Recollection/ Dissolution'

Hadi and Li-Li will be presenting a multi-media work: painting / sound installation, that explores the relationship between ‘recorded’ and ‘remembered.’ 

The idea shaped out of a sketched portrait that they produced in October 2014. The work is a remake of that sketch in the context of its original production time through painting and sound. 

'Remembrance is always accompanied by disruptive noises; senses coming from the times that are not necessarily related to a specific memory,' they say. Their memory of that sketch was an amalgamation of different layers of images and sounds. That's why they have used certain techniques to fabricate that fragmented, layered memory in a multi-media work.


Alice Burns

Burns' practice currently explores strategies of public engagement and connections between people and site.  
She explores these relationships through print, installation, video and sound,. Instigated in collaboration with those she encounters.

'At 22'

'At 22' is a two-part installation consisting of an embossed print and a mechanical Music Box. The composition of the musical work is transcribed directly from the embossing.  

This is a retelling of a non-verbalised past trauma in which layers are added to the memory. The memory remains private, yet is made public.

The musical experience will be unique for each individual as they select which excerpts of the embossing to play.

www.aliceburns.co.uk


Aghori

Aghori are a two piece experimental and meditative drone act.

 They have recently released their first demo and played at the Arhus Supernoise Festival in Denmark. 

Incantations, invocations and heavy riffs with a droning undercurrent.

'Meditative Drone Performance'

Audience members are encouraged to sleep during a live performance of meditative drones, electro acoustic sounds and chanting. 

 Mephitic intonations of the Aghori Sadhu, sonorous cacophony, coughing, bleeding teeth, inert riffs and the animus of Kali.

www.aghori.bandcamp.com

Stephen Todd

Todd has previously collaborated on and performed in site specific theatre pieces with Spudgun and Skinnybone, both for Belfast Belfast. 

When left to his own devices, Todd creates ambient, melodic soundscapes, accompanied by theatrical or ambivalent spoken word pieces and song. He is a model employee.

'Man in Shed'

Todd will present an audio-visual projection and performance called 'Man In Shed'
A bespoke piece, originally devised as an isolated incident, to be played and performed inside and outside a small garden shed.

Spoken word and a sonic landscape are projected from multiple audio sources combined with projections and performance, they seek to convey one man’s waning sense of self-worth and inability to take comfort in a 'normal' settled life.

 It is a contemplation of the apparent futility of the male of the species, and his ongoing struggle to find a purpose.

www.isolatedincidents.co.uk

Helena Hamilton

Hamilton, born in Northern Ireland 1986, is an Artist who works both visually and sonically through a variety of media. 

These include sound, live drawing, installation, performance, and interactive digital.

Hamilton has exhibited throughout Europe and America.

'The Butterflies In My Brain'

'The Butterflies In My Brain’ transforms an overhead projector into a site specific, performative sound device. 

 All sounds originate live from within and around the machine. 

Selection, manipulation and duration of sounds are made via interaction through live drawing.

This repetitive, considered, visual interaction stimulates sonic variations throughout the duration of the performance.

www.helenahamilton.com


FRAMEWERK is a Picture Framing and Art Gallery located at 10 Upper Newtownards Road, near the Holywood Arches in Belfast. 

Exhibition curated by Dawn Richardson and Hannah Gibson.

www.framewerkbelfast.com

There will also be Photographer, May 'Patsy' Chan in attendance to coincide with the Belfast Fringe Photo Festival.

 'Lunar Terminator'
'Lunar Terminator' is an original audio visual soundfield installation.
The Lunar Terminator is the division between the illuminated and dark parts of the Earth's Moon. It is the lunar equivalent of the division between night and day on Earth.
This piece will be an audio visual metaphor to represent the moment between life and death; set to an all encompassing scale to evoke different questions of meaning and origin of life and death in the Universe.
Die Hexen will showcase a self edited, moving image filmed and co-directed by Photographer Helen Warner. This will consist of a joint performance by Die Hexen & Ruth Bate (Artist).
Die Hexen's accompanying musical composition will consist of manipulated original NASA recordings of the moon. These celestial sounds will be programmed to hang on the perimeter of unnerving drums and electronic sounds.
www.die-hexen.com

Steven Henry

 Steven is a Musician and Programmer based in Belfast. He is a member of the drone pop ensemble Documenta and performs with the group Sea Pinks. 
Steven's solo composition work utilises custom built hardware and software to explore musical perception and visualisation. 

'Cycle'

Composition for an octophonic speaker system.
Cycle' is an exploration of musical instrumentation and space, designed for octophonic speaker system. It builds on eight musical themes chosen to highlight the spatial effect. 
Four-part, algorithmically generated, synthesised melodies cycle around the eight speaker array forming a rotating sound field, as sequenced studio and field recordings are projected within. 
Listeners are free to move around the piece which has been designed to emphasise certain musical elements based on their relative position.
www.kingsteven.com



Li-Li and Hadi Bastani


'Recollection/ Dissolution'Hadi and Li-Li will be presenting a multi-media work: painting / sound installation, that explores the relationship between ‘recorded’ and ‘remembered.’ The idea shaped out of a sketched portrait that they produced in October 2014. The work is a remake of that sketch in the context of its original production time through painting and sound. 'Remembrance is always accompanied by disruptive noises; senses coming from the times that are not necessarily related to a specific memory,' they say. Their memory of that sketch was an amalgamation of different layers of images and sounds. That's why they have used certain techniques to fabricate that fragmented, layered memory in a multi-media work.



Alice Burns
Burns' practice currently explores strategies of public engagement and connections between people and site.  

She explores these relationships through print, installation, video and sound,. Instigated in collaboration with those she encounters.

 'At 22'
'At 22' is a two-part installation consisting of an embossed print and a mechanical Music Box. The composition of the musical work is transcribed directly from the embossing.  
This is a retelling of a non-verbalised past trauma in which layers are added to the memory. The memory remains private, yet is made public.
The musical experience will be unique for each individual as they select which excerpts of the embossing to play.
www.aliceburns.co.uk



Aghori
Aghori are a two piece experimental and meditative drone act.
 They have recently released their first demo and played at the Arhus Supernoise Festival in Denmark. 
Incantations, invocations and heavy riffs with a droning undercurrent.
'Meditative Drone Performance'
Audience members are encouraged to sleep during a live performance of meditative drones, electro acoustic sounds and chanting. 
 Mephitic intonations of the Aghori Sadhu, sonorous cacophony, coughing, bleeding teeth, inert riffs and the animus of Kali.
www.aghori.bandcamp.com


Stephen Todd
Todd has previously collaborated on and performed in site specific theatre pieces with Spudgun and Skinnybone, both for Belfast Belfast. 
When left to his own devices, Todd creates ambient, melodic soundscapes, accompanied by theatrical or ambivalent spoken word pieces and song. He is a model employee.


'Man in Shed'
Todd will present an audio-visual projection and performance called 'Man In Shed'

A bespoke piece, originally devised as an isolated incident, to be played and performed inside and outside a small garden shed.
Spoken word and a sonic landscape are projected from multiple audio sources combined with projections and performance, they seek to convey one man’s waning sense of self-worth and inability to take comfort in a 'normal' settled life.  It is a contemplation of the apparent futility of the male of the species, and his ongoing struggle to find a purpose.
www.isolatedincidents.co.uk


Helena Hamilton
Hamilton, born in Northern Ireland 1986, is an Artist who works both visually and sonically through a variety of media. 
These include sound, live drawing, installation, performance, and interactive digital.
Hamilton has exhibited throughout Europe and America.
'The Butterflies In My Brain'
 'The Butterflies In My Brain’ transforms an overhead projector into a site specific, performative sound device. 
 All sounds originate live from within and around the machine. 
Selection, manipulation and duration of sounds are made via interaction through live drawing.
This repetitive, considered, visual interaction stimulates sonic variations throughout the duration of the performance.
www.helenahamilton.com



FRAMEWERK is a Picture Framing and Art Gallery located at 10 Upper Newtownards Road, near the Holywood Arches in Belfast. 

Exhibition curated by Dawn Richardson and Hannah Gibson.




www.framewerkbelfast.com
There will also be Photographer, May 'Patsy' Chan in attendance to coincide with the Belfast Fringe Photo Festival.

story:
FLOWER HOUSE

Our Indiegogo campaign has ended, 
but we're continuing our fundraising here. 




To read more about the fundraiser we held this spring:

I'm Lisa Waud and I'm the creator of Flower House. In October 2015, along with the help from florists friends both local and from across the country, I will fill the interior walls and ceilings of a 16-room abandoned house with American-grown fresh flowers and living plants. 

Imagine it now: You walk across the crumbling threshold of a house that has been vacant for over a decade, signs of former lives gathered in the windowsills and trapped in the fencing. It overlooks six busy lanes of I-75 and the whooshing of cars on its one-way highway service drive street. The second you step inside, the city sounds are muted. Every surface is lush with color and life. A floral carpet, a wall of foliage, a ceiling dripping with vines. This disarray and decay was once a home and will blossom again.

Inspired by a long-time fascination with the installations of Christo and Jeanne-Claude, and moved by images of a 2012 Dior Show, I purchased two houses on the Hamtramck city auction in October 2014 to launch the project.

After the floral art installation, our project partners, Reclaim Detroit, will responsibly deconstruct the houses, diverting as much as 75% of the materials in the building from the landfill.

When the structures are gone, we will convert the plot of land into Flower House Farm, a functional, beautiful flower farm for my floral design business, Pot & Box.

I’ve been in business as Pot & Box for over 8 years, with one studio in Ann Arbor and one in Hamtramck. We offer floral design for special events and weddings, as well as horticultural decor and container garden services for residences and businesses across Southeast Michigan.

WHY?

Why fill an abandoned house with flowers? 

I remember the first time I saw images of Christo and Jeanne-Claude’s wrapped Pont Neuf bridge in Paris. When i didn’t think “Why?” but instead, “How?”, I knew something was stirring in me. 

I wouldn’t know until years later, when I poured over images of the 2012 Dior show installation, exactly what I was going to do. 

There was an image from that show that I couldn’t shake; it was an image of a gorgeous girl, in a gorgeous gown, with a look on her face that couldn’t be described. I wanted to be there, in those rooms, to know what it felt like, what it smelled like, what it sounded like. I knew I had to create my own house of flowers and invite as many people as possible to experience it with me.

As I began talking about my idea, it was surprisingly easy to get florists on board my vision for the installation. But as the project evolved, I realized that Flower House is a three-part story. It’s about the flowers, the houses, and the farm.

THE FLOWERS

The Flower House October installation will be an unprecedented one. We will experience something that has never been done before—for one weekend, the walls, ceilings, floors, and fixtures will be bursting with luscious blooms and textural foliage harvested from American farms coast to coast, and featuring our own Great Lakes state. There is a real and strong momentum gaining for consciousness in growing, sourcing, and buying flowers grown in our own soil. Much like the Slow Food movement, the Slow Flowers Movement is changing the way people think about where their cut flowers come from in America. To listen my interview about Flower House's commitment to using all American-grown flowers, visit the slowflowers.com link here. 

The house will be open to the public from Friday, October 16th through Sunday, October 18th. This weekend's installation will be a once-in-a-lifetime chance to experience a brief moment of breathtaking beauty in a house that was once abandoned, soon to be torn down, then replaced with a living, growing flower farm. 

When the visitors are gone and the flowers have wilted, the materials will be the first to make up the composting system at the future flower farm. While it may seem wasteful to have used them for a brief, artful weekend, the flowers will have been a part of a story being recounted, told, and written. Just like the materials in the structures, the flowers  will live on as something new and beautiful. 

THE HOUSE

As the houses are situated, they are in a unique place. They are not only on a busy service drive along a busy highway, but they are also on the edge of a busy, dense city within a city. Dequindre Street, I-75, Hamtramck, Detroit. What a strangely perfect setting for our Flower House. 

The sustainable deconstruction of the two adjacent houses I bought on foreclosure auction will take place after the October installation. We’ve partnered with the deconstruction experts at Reclaim Detroit to responsibly bring down the houses and make way for the future flower farm for Pot & Box. The goal is to dismantle the structures and divert as much 75% of the reusable materials out of the landfill. The hope that this deconstruction and land repurposing will inspire others to see abandoned structures as platforms for art and business, and to use them in an environmentally responsible way. 

THE FARM

After the floral exhibition and the deconstruction of both structures, the formerly neglected land will be cultivated into a flower farm. The new farm will offer locally grown fresh flowers for weddings and events and host floral design classes in a unique urban setting. Flower House Farm hopes to inspire others in Detroit to utilize our abundant land for creative and productive projects, and to create a space that the community can be proud of where there once was danger and blight. 

FUNDRAISING

When I was first thinking about this project, I assumed that any fundraising would be for the actual flowers for the installation. But through incredibly generous floral donations from local wholesalers at Nordlie and Mayesh and from the California Cut Flower Commission, the focus of the fundraising has shifted. Please join us to give this house one last hurrah before Reclaim Detroit brings the houses down, with as many materials as possible gathered for reuse in the community, and to support this local Detroit business as it helps to create job opportunities for local people facing barriers to employment and to create positive social and environmental outcomes out of the urban waste stream commonly called "blight".

PERKS

For your generous donations, we'd love to outfit you with Flower House swag and incredible experiences--an evening at Lisa's studio with the Flower House team, and dinner out in Detroit with the Flower House florists, photographer, and filmmakers.  

Shown above: Perfume inspired by the installation flowers blended by our friend Monique at Alchemy, a botanical Flower House screenprint by our friend Marcy Davy at All Things Grow, American-sewn tote bags printed by our friends at VG Kids. 

Be sure you check out all the donor perks in the column to the right. 

AMBITION

We know this is a wonderfully absurd project. Who takes the time and energy to fix up a decomposing house only to fill it with flowers for a weekend before deconstructing it and farming the land? I’ll tell you who. Let’s meet the team:

Lisa Waud, Pot & Box

Liz Andre-Stotz, Parsonage Events

Jody Costello, J. Costello Designs

Holly Rutt, Sweet Pea Floral Design

Susan Mcleary, Passionflower

Heather Saunders, Heather Saunders Photography

Na & Rob Frenette, Hello Future Films

Lia Colapietro, Lia Colapietro Floral Design

Kelli Galloway, Hops Petunia

Martha Deflorio, Made Floral

Jennifer Haf & Larissa Flynn, Bloom Floral Design

Jamie Platte, Pontius Flower Shop

Katherine Yates, Pot & Box

Janet Martineau, Floral Verde

Francoise Weeks, Francoise Weeks European Floral Design

Anne Kilcullen, Blade NYC

Denise Fasanello, Denise Fasanello Flowers

Isha Foss, Isha Foss Events

With a fierce team like this, we are poised to tackle any challenges that will arise. And they will! But I'll tell you from experience, wedding florists can handle *anything* that comes our way. And at least for me, I secretly like a challenge. Who doesn't want to play MacGuyver under pressure and come out on top? 

MORE THAN MONEY

Although our fundraising goals are high and mighty, there are other ways to help make Flower House happen that are just as important as donating. 

Seeing that my initial motivation for this installation was to experience what it feels like to stand in a house lush with flowers, you can help us SPREAD THE WORD. We want people across the country--and the world--to visit the installation in October. Tell everyone you know about this crazy thing happening in Detroit! You can use the share buttons right here on this Indiegogo campaign site. 

We will also need VOLUNTEERS. There will be a lot to take care of leading up to and during the fall event. Sign up for the Flower House newsletter to stay in touch: www.tinyletter.com/flowerhouse

If you are interested in joining our killer line up of participating FLORISTS, please visit our website for a link to apply to design a room in Flower House:  www.theflower.house/contact

story:
Kaixo, Maite Toledo naiz,  sortzailea, olerkaria.  eta proiektu honen zuzendari artistikoa.


IDEA (start up)

Preveo abrir  dos líneas de negocio: 1. Art gallery 2. Fashion.  He creado mi propia marca: Maite Toledo. Comenzaré comercializando a través de una página web. Así mismo, tendré una red de distribuidores (en establecimientos de prestigio) de los productos a nivel local, con la expectativa de que se expanda a nivel internacional.

Los productos básicos del art gallery  en principio serán mis obras de arte y literarias, y  en un futuro quizás comercialice obras y servicios de otros artistas.  No voy a seguir tendencias, mis creaciones van a ser atemporales.

En la sección de recompensas de esta campaña pueden apreciar una muestra del arte que estoy realizando actualmente: dos obra gráficas, dos note-books y un libro de poesía. Pueden hacerse poseedores de alguno de ellos mediante la aportación indicada en cada artículo. Se lo enviaré al domicilio indicado.

En cuando a los complementos de moda,  a finales de marzo y principios de abril podrán gozar y si gustan adquirir los primeros artículos de moda que he diseñado y voy a sacar al mercado bajo la marca Maite Toledo. No voy a seguir tendencias, mis creaciones van a ser temporales. 

Me encanta lo estoy que estoy haciendo ahora, y estoy segura de  que esta primavera-verano vosotras y vosotros gozareis y disfrutareis con la estética de mis creaciones.

Itzuli testua / traducir este texto / Traslate this text:

https://www.google.es/?gws_rd=ssl#newwindow=1&q=google+translator&spell=

Eskerrik asko / Gracias / Merci /Thank you


MISSION / MISIOA / MISIÓN 

(EN)

Our mission of this project is to offer high quality cultural products and services related to art and fashion. Our vision is focused on an audience that gets to know the offer through information and communications technologies (ICT) and, who apart from in the internet, they enjoy culture and the art in the destination itself. 

(EU)

Gure misioa artearekin eta modarekin lotura duten kalitate handiko produktu eta zerbitzu kulturalak eskaintzea da. Gure bisioa informazioaren eta komunikazioaren teknologiak (IKT) erabilita eskaintza ezagutzen duen publikoari zuzenduta dago eta kultura eta paisaia internetez gain helmugan bertan disfrutatzen duenarentzako.

(ES)

Nuestra misión es ofrecer productos y servicios culturales de alta calidad relacionados con el arte y la moda. Nuestra visión está orientada hacia un público que conoce la oferta a través de las nuevas tecnologías de la información y la comunicación (NTIC) y que además de en Internet disfruta de la cultura y del arte en el propio destino.


BALOREAK / VALORES / VALUES

Ekitatea /Equidad / Equity: La filosofía de este proyecto es <nik irabazi zuk irabazi / yo gano, tu ganas / I win, you win.

Bikaintasuna / Excelencia / Excellence: Yo y mi equipo de colaboradores buscamos la excelencia en todos los procesos creativos de los productos y servicios que creamos.

Ingurumena / Medio ambiente / Environment:  Tratamos de causar ​​el menor impacto posible en el medio ambiente.

Kultura / Cultura / Culture: Apreciamos la diversidad, el respeto a las personas y a su cultura.

story:
Hello everyone!

We are raising money for an art showcase that will include:

A Visual and live performance art including paintings, photography and poetry

A short video documentary about modern day feminism 

A fierce fashion show by a group of badass women that support positive body imaging.  

The showcase has been cultivated from group discussions about topics such as feminism, social conditioning, and female empowerment, to name a few.

The ultimate goal is to encourage further discussion, rather than shy away from tough topics that could potentially help to put a light on women's struggle for equality- which is essentially a human rights problem.

The super ultimate goal is to change the world so that we no longer have to discuss facts like women not being paid at an equal rate to men or that misogyny is still a very real problem all over the world. 



We need the funding for:

Art gallery rental, marketing supples including posters, postcards, social media advertisements, artists fees, art supplies, visual/audio Equipment...

The Impact

Please know that this project is valuable to the world for (but not limited to) the following reasons: 
•According to the most recent statistics from the U.S. Census, women earn just 77 percent of what men earn for the same amount of work [source: National Committee on Pay Equity
• In 2008, U.N. Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon reported that one in every three women is likely "to be beaten, coerced into sex or otherwise abused in her lifetime" [source: OneWorld]
•Economists have deemed the "feminization of poverty." More than 1.5 billion people in the world live on less than one dollar a day, and the majority of those people are women [source: Lopez-Claros, Zahidi].

The theme of this year's International Women's Day is " Make It Happen". So, we've started our campaign, but will you help us to "Make It Happen"? 

**Other Ways You Can Help:
Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
Visit our social media sites:
http://www.facebook.com/cantwaitproductions 
Twitter: @cantwaittheatre 

Thank you!
Adobuere

story:
Introduction
My name is Lorelle Rau, and Reclaimed | Retold serves as my final thesis project for graduate school. For this project, I am curating a pop-up exhibition that features six assemblage artists who use found objects and/or salvaged materials to create new works of art.

About
I will execute all aspects of the exhibition including curating, coordinating, marketing, installing, selling, planning an opening reception, and of course raising funds. Organizing this project from start to finish will allow me to utilize the knowledge and skills I have gained while pursuing a Master’s at SCAD and from my seven years of experience working in arts administration.

Value of Art
The visual arts are important to me, and I am dedicated to pursuing a career in this field because I believe that viewing fine art energizes and encourages creativity, discussion, and appreciation of life and one’s surroundings. The completion of this project will be an important addition to my professional portfolio, as I will gain the experience I need to open or manage an art organization in the future.

Why Support?
There will be a number of career benefits not only for me but for the artists involved. They will receive a great deal of publicity, and they will have the opportunity to sell their work. Many of them are shipping artwork from out of state at their own cost, and one of my goals is to help pay for it.

Fundraising Goal
My overall fundraising goal is $2,200, which would cover the costs of the gallery rental fee, marketing, insurance, artwork shipping, reception, signage, and other related expenses, like lighting and installation hardware.

I hope you will join me in making this exhibition a success! If you are unable to contribute, please feel free to share my campaign on Facebook and/or pass it on.

Thank you so much for your support!

Lorelle

*your contribution to this campaign is not tax-deductible

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I’m Margaret Blanchfield Sarantis and I am making this video to introduce you to my studio. It’s called Sacramento Art Classes and it’s a beautiful, bright, colorful art studio that I opened a year ago. I’ve been teaching art for over 14 years. One of my first students was my son, Steven, who is shooting this video. Say hi, Steven.

I’ve never asked for crowd funding before, and I’ve never made a video either. But I have taught a lot of art. My students are preschoolers, grade school kids, teens, and adults; just about anyone from age 4 through age 100. I love what I do, and my students tell me I’m good at it. If you’d like to see more of what I do, you can visit my web site at www.sacramentoartclasses.com.

I decided to try crowd funding because I’ve chosen a career that I love, but it’s not necessarily the most lucrative career choice on the planet – at least not so far – and I need some help making ends meet so that I can continue to keep the Sacramento Art Classes studio open to the public.

What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for $14,000 to cover the cost of renting my studio space for one year. I’m not asking for the money so that I can just sit back and paint daisies all day. I’ll still be working hard to pay for the rest of the expenses from my own pocket – art supplies, internet access, phone bill, electric bill, daily massages and hot chocolate…..uhhhh, just kidding about those last ones.

Seriously, with your funding, I can concentrate on teaching the best classes possible and find amazing teachers to teach things that I don’t specialize in. At Sacramento Art Classes, we offer watercolor, acrylic, oil and ink painting, drawing, art journaling, jewelry making, book binding, ornament making, flower arranging, card making and craft classes of all kinds for kids and adults.

Donation Levels:
For $1 you get to put a smile on my face.

For $5 you get a big “thank you” on my Facebook page and acknowledgement of your donation.

For $20 you get a personalized thank you note written on one of my greeting cards that you can actually frame and display (I'll need your address, please).
For $50 you get an original 4” x 4” (or slightly larger) painting made by ME.

For $125 you can have a 2-hour private lesson in watercolor or acrylic painting or you can sponsor this lesson for someone local who cannot afford it.

For $400 you can take any class I offer for FREE or you can sponsor this class for someone local who cannot afford it.

For $1000 you will receive an original 18” x 24” abstract acrylic painting on canvas. You specify color scheme.

The Impact

When you donate the $14K, this beautiful space will be able to stay open for hundreds of people – for kids who want after school drawing lessons and for retirees who want to sketch or collage in the mornings and for and people to come after work and sip a glass of wine while they paint landscapes.

When I raise the $14k, I can keep this studio alive for the 17 other teachers I’ve recruited to teach here. So really, your donations will not only keep Sacramento Art Classes open for a year, they will allow potentially hundreds of others to share in the magic of this studio space as they create amazing things. And imagine if some of those people sell or gift their creations, your donations could potentially spread the gift of art all across Sacramento, or California, or the US, or the WORLD!! Your donations are going far beyond this studio. Your donations are spreading the joy of creating art.

Risks & Challenges

If, by some chance, I do not raise $14,000, your donations will still be put toward renting the space for Sacramento Art Classes (I'm not going to disappear to Aruba). Be assured that I will be doing my best to put this campaign in front of thousands of donors through Facebook and through my e-newsletter. Know that I will keep working to grow my classes, paint better paintings and recruit wonderful teachers so that I can share the gift of art everywhere I go.

Thank you.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please  get the word out and make some noise about my campaign. Share it on Facebook, Twitter, by email or by word of mouth

You can learn more about the studio and what I do by visiting www.sacramentoartclasses.com

Share this campaign with the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
I have accepted a place to study on the MFA degree course at Goldsmiths university. This is a hugely prestigous opportunity and one that I dearly want to take up. It will enable me to develop my artistic practice much further, and firmly establish my chosen career path.

Having acheived a First Class Honours degree in my Bachelors degree, and been one of the 2014 Bloomberg New Contemporaries artists, being given a place on what is one of the most competitive postgraduate courses is an achievement in itself, and if I am able to take up the opportunity it will be a life-changing event for me. I know I have the ability and enthusiasm to achieve this goal, and this further two years of study will ensure that I can fully express my ideas and experience through my artwork. I feel my journey as an artist is at mid-arc, and I need this additional time in education to consolidate what I learned and discovered during my time at the Cass School of Art, and take my ideas further.

Unfortunately, I don't have the money to be able to pay for my tuition fees for the course, and am looking for sponsors who will support my endeavours. I am looking to raise £6000 for my first year of tuition. In return I will give donors art that I have created, which after I have completed my Masters studies, will be gain considerable value.

With everything that's going on in the world today, all of its problems and suffering, you might well ask why you should donate to help an artist through education? Firstly, because art is how we as humans express feelings about ourselves and our society, art makes statements, it can be a powerful means of conveying difficult and troubling ideas, which is why the ruling elite have often felt threatened by art and artists, and sought to control it. Second, I believe my work is powerful and speaks of things we so often prefer to ignore, so I ask everyone reading this to please donate whatever you can, no matter how small, and take part in helping me to be able to take this next, extremely important step in my artistic development.

story:
The House of PainT needs your help! We built an amazing dance floor last year only to have it destroyed during a winter storm. With your support we can build an even better one this year and store it safely for use in the years to come!

The Festival:

Over five days each September House of PainT throws the biggest urban culture jam in the Nation’s Capital – celebrating and elevating hip hop arts and culture. Attendees of all ages enjoyurban dance battles, DJ and MC performances, graffiti art, photography, slam poetry and film, as well as attending workshops, courses and academic talks.Our programs emphasize youth engagement and community development through the creative power of art, run primarily by volunteers. 

The History:

It all started in 2003 as a two on two competition celebrating the establishment of Ottawa’s first legal graffiti wall. The dance floor was small and it was built by the festival founder and her father, with the sound system borrowed from a friend. Since then the battle has grown to become one of the most consistent crew versus crew competitions in Canada and that small dance floor has grown to become the focal point of the festival.

The Heart Break:

Last year the floor reached its ultimate potential and helped to bring the dance action closer to the audience, with great sight lines, awesome seating, and a wicked stage! The dancers were most impressed with the floor because we took the time and care to think about their needs. This included providing a floor that had the right elements for a Dance Battle: lots of space, just the right amount of spring, and a big piece of linoleum to help them spin! We even invited the audience onto the floor at the end of the night, finishing the day off with a bumpin’ dance party!

After the festival we put the dance floor in storage for the year – the same storage we’ve used since 2003. Unfortunately, a violent Canadian winter storm ripped apart our storage tent and destroyed the best dance floor we’ve ever had.

The Need:

With your support we know that we can recreate and surpass the success of last year – creating a big, beautiful floor and upgrading our storage so we can maintain it for years to come. As the festival continues to grow, we are committed to providing the best overall experience for the performers and spectators. Help us put on an awesome festival by supporting the construction of our dance floor!

The Break Down:

Labour (design and construction): $1040

Lumber Costs: $2354

Additional Costs (paint, hardware, transportation): $360

Safe Storage: $1246

Total:  $5000

story:
…"un orgullo de plata me recorre por el cuerpo". -E. Huerta

Exposición de finalistas, Museo Franz Mayer, sede permanente de la BICM / Exhibition of finalists, Museo Franz Mayer, permanent headquarters of the IPBM

ES / La Bienal Internacional del Cartel en México (BICM) custodia un espacio donde la confluencia de intercambio educativo, cultural y de información en México se consigue desde la red colectiva que promueve a la cultura y educación como hélices del progreso. La BICM es quien ha transformado a otras bienales del mundo, otorgado imagen y presencia de México en el extranjero e iniciado a los jóvenes en la enseñanza del diseño como transformador del entorno. 

EN / The International Poster Biennial in Mexico (IPBM) custodies a space where the confluence of educational, cultural and information exchange in Mexico is obtained from the collective network that promotes culture and education as propellers of progress. The IPBM has transformed other biennials in the world, has awarded image and presence of Mexico abroad and initiated youth in design education as a transforming environment.

ES / La BICM, tras 25 años de ser un custodio de la cultura del diseño, se sitúa en un momento especial: el festejo de su aniversario. El programa de celebración es tan sustancioso que conduce a la BICM a solicitar tu apoyo. La BICM es convincente con las causas en las que cree, una de ellas es la preservación de la memoria en materia física, por lo que el artículo ideal y congruente con la celebración de los 25 años se resume en la edición de un ejemplar conmemorativo. Te invitamos a apoyar a esta asociación civil mexicana a cubrir los fondos de publicación para lograr el tiraje de un libro que será el testigo de un espacio donde se genera el bien invaluable del patrimonio visual.

EN / The IPBM, after 25 years of being a custodian of the culture of design, is at a special moment: the celebration of their anniversary. The celebration program is so substantial that it leads the IPBM to request your support. The IPBM is persuasive to the causes in which it believes, one of which is the preservation of memory in physical matter, so the ideal article consistent with the celebration of 25 years is summarized in the publication of a commemorative issue. We invite you to support this mexican civil society to cover public funds to achieve the printing of a book that will be the witness of a space where the invaluable visual legacy is generated.



SOBRE EL LIBRO CONMEMORATIVO DEL 25 ANIVERSARIO DE LA BICM 

ABOUT COMMEMORATIVE BOOK OF THE 25TH ANNIVERSARY OF THE IPBM

•  Presentaciones al libro de las instituciones convocantes y patrocinadores de la BICM.

Presentations to the book by  conveners institutions and sponsors of the IPBM.

•  Presentaciones al libro de reconocidos personajes en el ámbito cultural.

Presentations to book by recognized people in the cultural field.

• Tanto el registro fotográfico de 70 diseñadores talla internacional, que han colaborado con esta iniciativa, de su  intervención en el proyecto como el banco de imágenes BICM de ese mismo momento. 

Photographic record of 70 internationally renowned designers, who have collaborated with this initiative, of their moments in Mexico and the IPBM image bank of that moment.

• La colección de carteles que celebra el 25 aniversario y textos que acompañan, a la obra visual, escritos por el autor y por gente que manifiesta la experiencia estética provocada por cada cartel.*

Collection of posters celebrating the 25th anniversary and texts accompanying the visual work, written by the author and by people who manifest the aesthetic experience brought by each poster.*

*Esta iniciativa sigue abierta a colaboración. Puede visitar nuestro boletín Extradiseño para obtener mayor detalle.

* This initiative is open to collaboration. You can visit our newsletter Extradiseño for more detail.

• Catálogo de la colección México a través del cartel, la cual es una hermosa y apreciada obra que sigue creciendo hasta el día de hoy. La BICM continúa recibiendo obsequios en forma de cartel de distinguidos diseñadores procedentes de todo el mundo que han participado en diversas ediciones de la BICM.

Catalog of Mexico through poster collection, which is a beautiful and appreciated work that continues growing until this day. The IPBM is still receiving gifts as a sign of distinguished designers from around the world who have participated in various editions of the IPBM.

•  Historia documentada de la BICM. 

Documented history of the IPBM. 


¡Y muchos archivos históricos más de la BICM a través de estos 25 años!

And many others historical documents collected through these 25 years!


Medidas / Dimensions: 16.5 x 23 cm

Paginado / Paging: 256 páginas

Lengua / Language: Español e inglés / Spanish and English

Papel de interiores / Interior Paper: Couche brillante 150 g / Couche bright 150 g

Encuadernación / Binding:  Pasta dura carboné / Hardcover


HISTORIA / HISTORY

ES / La BICM es el lugar más importante de encuentro y colaboración donde diseñadores del mundo entero confluyen en su programa de educación y promoción de cultura en torno al diseño. Este proyecto se ha colocado, no tan sólo en México sino en los cinco continentes, como una de las iniciativas de mayor relevancia en su rubro. A diferencia de otras bienales  del cartel, la BICM se constituyó desde un principio como un programa académico tanto de educación sobre temas del diseño de amplio espectro como de colaboración con las instituciones culturales y de educación superior de México, ambas dedicadas a la formación de diseñadores y difusión de creadores nacionales. En consecuencia, la BICM es un programa que no tan sólo complementa sino que abre nuevos horizontes en el programa del diseño gráfico en México; ésta es la razón debido a la cual en el año de 1988 se invitó a la Universidad Autónoma Metropolitana, la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México, el Instituto Nacional de Bellas Artes y la Secretaría de Relaciones Exteriores de México a través de su Dirección General de Cooperación Educativa y Cultural, como principal convocante, a colaborar con esta iniciativa.

EN /  The IPBM is the most important place of meeting and collaboration where designers from around the world gather in its program of education and promotion of culture on design. This project has taken place, not only in Mexico but in the five continents, as one of the most important initiatives in its field. Unlike other biennials poster, the IPBM was established from the beginning as both: an academic education program design issues and wide-ranging collaboration with cultural institutions and higher education in Mexico, both dedicated to the training of designers and dissemination of national creators. Consequently, the IPBM is a program that not only complements but also opens new horizons in the graphic design program in Mexico; this is the reason because of which in the year 1988 were invited to the Metropolitan Autonomous University, the National Autonomous University of Mexico, the National Institute of Fine Arts and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Mexico through its General Office for Cooperation Education and Culture, as the main convener, to cooperate with this initiative.

Congreso Mundial de Diseño, 6ª BICM, Guadalajara 2000 / World Design Congress, 6th IPBM, Guadalajara 2000.

ES / La prioridad general de la BICM, al igual que hace un cuarto de siglo, es promover la cultura del diseño como parte de la vida diaria. Esta idea es el eje transmisor de propuestas creativas y de interés social que procura la estética contemporánea tanto en las actividades de difusión cultural como publicitarias y de temas político-sociales; mismas que sin lugar a dudas impactan en la formación de gusto estético que constituye la cultura visual de un país, ya que la BICM afirma que el diseño gráfico aplicado a la publicidad, la difusión cultural, la promoción de campañas sociales y educativas genera un vasto espectro de posibilidades para el lenguaje visual percibido por millones de personas. La reflexión sobre cultura y comunicación visual es entonces posible a través de la comprensión de mensajes.

EN / The main priority of the IPBM, in its quarter of a century, is to promote the culture of design as part of daily life. This idea is the principal axis of creative proposals and social interest that aims contemporary aesthetics in the activities of cultural dissemination as advertising and political and social issues; same as undoubtedly impact the formation of aesthetic taste that is the visual culture of a country, as the IPBM says that graphic design applied to advertising, cultural dissemination, promotion of social and educational campaigns generated a vast spectrum of possibilities for the visual language perceived by millions. Reflection on visual culture and communication is now possible through the understanding of messages.


EL LUGAR DE LA BICM EN LA SOCIEDAD / THE PLACE OF BICM IN SOCIETY


ES / El papel que la BICM ha asumido es el de abrir un nuevo espacio en la difusión de la cultura visual universal. A través de estos 25 años ha facilitado la presencia de propuestas creativas provenientes de todo el mundo enriqueciendo el lenguaje visual en tanto que pautas de comparación para fortalecer la originalidad como creadores. 

EN / The role that IPBM has taken is to open a new space in the dissemination of universal visual culture. Through these 25 years it has facilitated the presence of creative proposals from around the world enriching the visual language as compared to strengthen guidelines originality as creators.

Congreso Mundial de Diseño, 10ª BICM, Xalapa 2008 / World Design Congress, 10th IPBM, Xalapa 2008.

ES / El diseño gráfico contemporáneo no ha sido todavía entendido en plenitud como una de las herramientas más indispensables para el desarrollo sociocultural, de las artes, de la vida social, política y productiva en general. Por otro lado, el cartel continúa siendo una pieza indispensable en el desarrollo del oficio del diseñador, lo que obliga a adquirir conocimientos complejos de composición, códigos de color y tipográficos, iconografías relacionadas con los temas tratados, conocimiento de la construcción y arquitectura de la letra además de la necesidad de comunicar una idea de manera instantánea y precisa.

EN /  Contemporary graphic design is not yet fully understood as one of the most indispensable tools for socio-cultural development, arts, social, political and productive life in general. On the other hand, the poster remains an indispensable element in the development of the trade designer, forcing them acquire complex knowledge of composition, color codes and typographical, iconography related topics, knowledge of construction and architecture letter and the need to communicate an idea instantly and accurately.


¿POR QUÉ AYUDAR A LA BICM? / WHY HELP BICM?


ES / Porque la BICM, aunque orientada particularmente al diseño, estimula las representaciones mentales y las artes visuales que promueven la producción de bienes estéticos.

Es necesario dejar un testigo de la aportación y consecuencias que acciones para la cultura del diseño, por ejemplo apreciarlo como herramienta conceptual para el desarrollo e innovación, otorgan tanto imagen y presencia de México en el extranjero como una plataforma, donde jóvenes talento del diseño mexicano desarrollan con fuerza y seguridad la transformación de realidades y la creación de innovación.

EN / Because IPBM, thought particularly oriented design, it stimulates mental representations and visual arts that promote the production of goods.

You must leave a witness of the contribution and consequences of action to design culture, for example appreciate it as a conceptual tool for development and innovation, providing both image and presence of Mexico abroad as a platform where young talents of mexican design develop strength and confidence that transform realities and create innovation.

Congreso Mundial de Diseño, 5ª BICM, Xalapa 1998 / World Design Congress, 5th IPBM, 1998 Xalapa

ES / La BICM es notablemente operativa: este año de aniversario ha revolucionado su concepto en nombre del compromiso y adaptación para generar productos como el encuentro cultural interdisciplinario Ciudad Diseño, la exitosa convocatoria de carteles sobre el Patrimonio de la Ciudad de México titulada Testimonio de lo que fuimos, somos y seremos y el aumento de sedes BICM: ahora también serán expuestos los bienalistas seleccionados en Museo AROCENA-Coahuila y en el Instituto Cultural de Aguascalientes. Los resultados no cesan, la BICM ha implementado modos de diseminar el ímpetu de la colaboración, tal como lo es el relanzamiento de su boletín digital Extradiseño.

EN / The IPBM is notably operational: this anniversary year has revolutionized its concept in the name of compromise and adaptation to generate products such as cultural encounter interdisciplinary design center, the successful convocation of posters on the World Heritage City of Mexico entitled Testimony of what we were, ee are and we will be and the increase of headquartes IPBM: now also be exposed participants  selected in AROCENA-Museum in Coahuila México and in the Cultural Institute of Aguascalientes. The results do not stop, the IPBM has implemented ways to spread the momentum of the partnership, sucha as the relaunch of its digital newsletter Extradiseño.

ES / La BICM continúa gestionando proyectos: todavía debe cumplir con su programa de celebración de aniversario, el cual se constituye por la convocatoria de cartel en conmemoración a una obra de Kafka, exposiciones de cartel sobre sus 25 años, el medio ambiente y desarrollo, la conformación de su Consejo  Honorario y la realización de eventos como un concierto de gala para la asociación. En este tenor una edición conmemorativa, donde se legitime la historia de los beneficios tangibles provocados por la BICM, se convierte en un elemento necesario de síntesis histórica.

EN / IPBM continues managing projects, it must still fulfill its anniversary celebration program, which is constituted by the call for commemorate a work of Kafka, poster exhibitions with topics such as 25th anniversary IPBM, the environment and development, the formation of its Honorary International Council and performing events such as a gala concert for the association. In this sense a commemorative edition, where the history of the tangible benefits caused by IPBM, becomes a necessary element of historical synthesis.


Apoya a esta asociación mexicana a cubrir los fondos de publicación para lograr el tiraje de un libro que será el testigo de un espacio donde se genera el bien invaluable del patrimonio visual.

Supports this mexican civil society to cover public funds to achieve the printing of a book that will be the witness of a space where the invaluable visual legacy is generated. 


COMPROMISO Y VALORES BICM / COMMITMENT AND VALUES OF IPBM


ES / LA BICM enfatiza que la suma de los límites individuales es la vía por la que se alcanza esa adhesión incondicional llamada solidaridad.

EN / The IPBM emphasizes that the sum of the individual limits is the way by which the unconditional support solidarity call is reached.

Congreso Mundial de Diseño, 4ª BICM, Aguascalientes 1996 / Museo Franz Mayer / World Design Congress, 4th IPBM, Aguascalientes 1996 / Franz Mayer Museum

ES / Gracias a ti la BICM ha conseguido ser con otros en comunidad, dado que sin tu colaboración incondicional sería inasequible tanto el acervo constituido con más de 40,000 carteles como el Congreso Mundial de Diseño. Las 13 ediciones de la BICM son la prueba de la potencia que alcanzan la fraternidad y colaboración trabajando en conjunto, pues esta asociación regida por los valores de la educación y la cultura está convencida que emplear el mecanismo de la solidaridad propicia el desarrollo social, económico y humano. La BICM está persuadida que la promoción del bienestar social, mediante el fomento de la cultura como senda del progreso intelectual del individuo y social, es factible sólo si somos capaces de mantener vivo el fulgor de la creación comunal y profusa.

EN / Thanks to you the IPBM has get to be with others in community, because without your unconditional collaboration it would be unavailable both: the acquis constituted with more than 40,000 posters and the World Design Congress. The 13 editions of the IPBM are proof of the power of the fraternity and collaboration working together, because this association governed by the values ​​of education and culture is convinced that the mechanism of solidarity generates social, economic and human development. The IPBM is convinced that the promotion of social welfare, through the promotion of culture as a path of intellectual progress of the individual and social, it is feasible only if we are able to keep alive the glare of communal and profuse creation.

ES / Es imperante la necesidad de hacer difusión de los espacios donde artistas y creadores nutren el legado cultural del arte y la educación visual. En consecuencia, la BICM te invita a descubrir el significado que el diseño adquiere cuando es provisto con un enfoque del porvenir y a seguir moviendo actitudes fraternales para preservar, a través de la edición de este proyecto, uno de los patrimonios culturales en artes visuales más importantes a nivel mundial. 25 aniversario / BICM de plata  es un espacio abierto que te brinda la oportunidad de continuar siendo nuestro compañero solidario en este proyecto colaborativo que nos mueve a favor de la cultura del diseño. La BICM te garantiza que tu donativo conservará firmes los nichos donde es posible mantener latente el deseo de libertad interpretado como el espíritu de solidaridad en búsqueda del auténtico conocimiento.

EN / It is imperative the need to disseminate the spaces where artists and creators nourish the cultural legacy of art and visual education. Consequently, the IPBM invites you to discover the meaning that the design takes when it is provided with a focus of the future and to continue moving fraternal attitudes, through the publication of this project, one of the cultural heritages most important visual arts worldwide. 25th anniversary / silver IPBM is an open space that offers you the opportunity to continue being our supportive partner in this collaborative project that moves us in favor of the culture of design. The IPBM guarantees you that your donation will keep strong niches where you can maintain a latent desire for freedom interpreted as the spirit of partnership in pursuit of true knowledge.

Gracias por ayudar a la BICM a permanecer firme la convicción de la fraternidad y el apoyo.

Thank you for helping the BICM to maintain firm the conviction of brotherhood and support.


RECOMPENSAS / REWARDS

ES / ¿Por qué usamos colores en los nombres de las recompensas? “La razón es que la vista, mejor que los otros sentidos, nos da a conocer los objetos, y nos descubre entre ellos gran número de diferencias” decía Aristóteles. En la BICM consideramos que la nutrida gama de colores, aunque cada uno distinguible, se funde y conjunta para crear un panorama armónico del mismo modo que cada individuo, con sus límites que lo diferencian,  une sus horizontes para generar una red que trabaja en conjunto por una sociedad permeada por los más altos valores. 

EN / Why we use colors in the names of the rewards? "The reason is that the view better than the other senses, reveals the objects, and we discover including many differences," said Aristotle. In the IPBM, we believe that the abundant range of colors, although each distinguishable, is melted and combined to create a harmonious landscape just as each individual, with limits that differentiate it, unites its horizons to create a network that works together permeated by the highest values society.

BICM de plata: 25 años avivando los tonos para perdurar la memoria.

IPBM silver: 25 years stoking tones to endure memory.
