VOCES EN LIBERTAD 

ES / Esta colección conmemorativa, fue convocada por la BICM en el marco de la celebración del bicentenario y centenario de la independencia y la revolución mexicana. Con la participación de diseñadores de todas partes del mundo, "Voces en libertad" plasma en sus obras la visión de cada autor sobre la libertad. Ha sido expuesta en más de 20 países alrededor del mundo y está próxima a inaugurarse en diversas sedes más. La colección está constituida por  111 carteles de 120 x 90 cm, impresos en offset y numerados. Para conocer la colección completa visita la galería Voces en libertad.

VOICES IN FREEDOM

EN / This commemorative collection, was convened by the IPBM as part of the bicentennial and centennial of Independence and the Mexican Revolution. With the participation of designers from all over the world, "Voices released" reflected in his works, the vision of each author's freedom. It has been exhibited in more than 20 countries around the world and is about to open in various locations more. The collection is made up of 111 posters of 120 x 90 cm, printed on offset and numbered. For the full collection visit the gallery Voices in freedom


AMÉRICA HOY, 500 AÑOS DESPUÉS

Se convocó a diseñadores de diversas nacionalidades, con motivo del quinto centenario de la llegada de Cristóbal Colón a América, a elaborar una profunda reflexión sobre este tema desde diferentes culturas y puntos de vista de lo que hoy significa América para el resto del mundo. La colección está constituida por 44 carteles de 120 x 90 cm, impresos en serigrafía y offset.  Para conocer esta colección visita la galería América Hoy.

AMERICA TODAY, 500 YEARS LATER

EN / It was convened to designers of various nationalities, to mark the fifth centenary of the arrival of Christopher Columbus to America, to develop a deeper reflection on this subject from different cultures and views of what today means America to the world. The collection is made up of 44 posters of 120 x 90 cm, printed in silkscreen and offset. For this collection visit the gallery America Today


ENVÍOS Y COSTOS / SHIPPING FEES

ES / El envío a cualquier parte del mundo corre por nuestra cuenta.

EN /Shipping to anywhere in the world is on us.


¿RIESGOS DE APOYAR ECONÓMICAMENTE ESTA CAMPAÑA? / WHICH ARE THE RISKS TO SUPPORT ECONOMICALLY THIS CAMPAIGN?

ES / ¡Ups! Desafortunadamente hay uno: no alcanzar la meta total y con ello que no podamos finalizar el proyecto en el tiempo establecido. Sin embargo, NO TE PREOCUPES, pues la BICM se compromete a entregar todas las recompensas convenidas, con la única petición que esperes un poco de tiempo mayor al planeado para recibir tu libro, pues la asociación tendrá que procurar otros medios de fondear el proyecto. ¡Gracias por confiar en la BICM! 

EN / Oops! Unfortunately there is one risk: do not reach the overall goal and therefore we can not finish the project in time established. However, YOU DO NOT WORRY, because the IPBM  is committed to delivering all agreed rewards, with the only request that you wait a little more time for your book, because the association will have to seek other means to fund the project. Thank you for trusting the IPBM!


¿NO PUEDES APOYAR ESTA CAMPAÑA ECONÓMICANTE? / CAN´T YOU SUPPORT THE CAMPAIGN WITH MONEY?


ES / ¡No importa! Puedes colaborar de muchas otras formas, por ejemplo, ayudando a la BICM a divulgar esta iniciativa. Difunde y circula la información de este esfuerzo en tus redes sociales y con tus amigos para generar eco.  

EN / It does not matter! You can help in many other ways, such as helping the IPBM to divulge this initiative. Diffuses and circulates the information of this effort on your social networks with friends and it will generate echo.

La BICM te agradece el mantener encendida la llama de la fraternidad.

The IPBM thank you to keep the flame of brotherhood.

--

¿Tienes alguna duda respecto a esta camapaña? comunícate con nosotros:

Do you have any questions about this campaign? contact us:
posterbiennialmexico@gmail.com
story_txt:
…"un orgullo de plata me recorre por el cuerpo". -E. HuertaExposición de finalistas, Museo Franz Mayer, sede permanente de la BICM / Exhibition of finalists, Museo Franz Mayer, permanent headquarters of the IPBM
ES / La Bienal
Internacional del Cartel en México (BICM) custodia un espacio donde la
confluencia de intercambio educativo, cultural y de información en México se
consigue desde la red colectiva que promueve a la cultura y educación como
hélices del progreso. La BICM es
quien ha transformado a otras bienales del mundo, otorgado imagen y presencia
de México en el extranjero e iniciado a los jóvenes en la enseñanza del diseño
como transformador del entorno. 
EN / The International Poster Biennial in Mexico (IPBM)
custodies a space where the confluence of educational, cultural and information
exchange in Mexico is obtained from the collective network that promotes
culture and education as propellers of progress. The IPBM has transformed other biennials in the world, has awarded
image and presence of Mexico abroad and initiated youth in design education as
a transforming environment.

ES / La BICM,
tras 25 años de ser un custodio de la cultura del diseño, se sitúa en un momento
especial: el festejo de su aniversario. El programa de celebración es tan
sustancioso que conduce a la BICM a
solicitar tu apoyo. La BICM es
convincente con las causas en las que cree, una de ellas es la preservación de
la memoria en materia física, por lo que el artículo ideal y congruente con la
celebración de los 25 años se resume en la edición de un ejemplar
conmemorativo. Te invitamos a apoyar a esta asociación civil mexicana a cubrir los fondos de publicación
para lograr el tiraje de un libro que será el testigo de un espacio donde se
genera el bien invaluable del patrimonio visual.

EN / The IPBM, after 25
years of being a custodian of the culture of design, is at a special moment:
the celebration of their anniversary. The celebration program is so substantial
that it leads the IPBM to request
your support. The IPBM is persuasive
to the causes in which it believes, one of which is the preservation of memory
in physical matter, so the ideal article consistent with the celebration of 25
years is summarized in the publication of a commemorative issue. We invite you
to support this mexican civil society to cover public funds to achieve the
printing of a book that will be the witness of a space where the invaluable visual legacy is
generated.







SOBRE EL LIBRO CONMEMORATIVO DEL 25 ANIVERSARIO DE LA BICM 
ABOUT COMMEMORATIVE BOOK OF THE 25TH ANNIVERSARY OF THE IPBM


•  Presentaciones al libro de las
instituciones convocantes y patrocinadores de la BICM.
Presentations to the book by  conveners institutions and sponsors of the IPBM.
•  Presentaciones al libro de reconocidos
personajes en el ámbito cultural. 
Presentations to book by recognized people in the cultural field.
• Tanto el registro fotográfico de 70
diseñadores talla internacional, que han colaborado con esta iniciativa, de
su  intervención en el proyecto como el
banco de imágenes BICM de ese mismo momento. 

Photographic record of 70 internationally renowned designers, who have collaborated with this initiative, of their moments in Mexico and the IPBM image bank of that moment.
• La colección de carteles que celebra el 25 aniversario y textos que acompañan, a la obra visual, escritos por el autor y por gente que manifiesta la experiencia estética provocada por cada cartel.*
Collection of posters celebrating the 25th anniversary and texts accompanying the visual work, written by the author and by people who manifest the aesthetic experience brought by each poster.*

*Esta
iniciativa sigue abierta a colaboración. Puede visitar nuestro boletín
Extradiseño para obtener mayor detalle.
* This initiative is open to collaboration. You can visit our newsletter Extradiseño for more detail.
• Catálogo de la colección México a
través del cartel, la cual es una hermosa y apreciada obra que sigue creciendo
hasta el día de hoy. La BICM continúa recibiendo obsequios en forma de cartel
de distinguidos diseñadores procedentes de todo el mundo que han participado en
diversas ediciones de la BICM. 
Catalog of Mexico through poster collection, which is a beautiful and appreciated work that continues growing until this day. The IPBM is still receiving gifts as a sign of distinguished designers from around the world who have participated in various editions of the IPBM.
•  Historia
documentada de la BICM. 
Documented history of the IPBM. 


¡Y muchos archivos históricos más de la BICM a través de estos 25 años!
And many others historical documents collected through these 25 years!

Medidas / Dimensions: 16.5 x 23 cm
Paginado / Paging: 256 páginas
Lengua / Language: Español e inglés / Spanish and English
Papel de interiores / Interior Paper: Couche brillante 150 g / Couche bright 150 g
Encuadernación / Binding:  Pasta dura carboné / Hardcover
HISTORIA / HISTORY


ES / La BICM
es el lugar más importante de encuentro y colaboración donde diseñadores del
mundo entero confluyen en su programa de educación y promoción de cultura en
torno al diseño. Este proyecto se ha colocado, no tan sólo en México sino en
los cinco continentes, como una de las iniciativas de mayor relevancia en su
rubro. A diferencia de otras bienales  del
cartel, la BICM se constituyó desde
un principio como un programa académico tanto de educación sobre temas del
diseño de amplio espectro como de colaboración con las instituciones culturales
y de educación superior de México, ambas dedicadas a la formación de
diseñadores y difusión de creadores nacionales. En consecuencia, la BICM es un programa que no tan sólo
complementa sino que abre nuevos horizontes en el programa del diseño gráfico
en México; ésta es la razón debido a la cual en el año de 1988 se invitó a la
Universidad Autónoma Metropolitana, la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México,
el Instituto Nacional de Bellas Artes y la Secretaría de Relaciones Exteriores
de México a través de su Dirección General de Cooperación Educativa y Cultural,
como principal convocante, a colaborar con esta iniciativa.
EN / 
The IPBM is the most important place of
meeting and collaboration where designers from around the world gather in its
program of education and promotion of culture on design. This project has taken
place, not only in Mexico but in the five continents, as one of the most
important initiatives in its field. Unlike other biennials poster, the IPBM
was established from the beginning as both: an academic education program
design issues and wide-ranging collaboration with cultural institutions and
higher education in Mexico, both dedicated to the training of designers and
dissemination of national creators. Consequently, the IPBM is a
program that not only complements but also opens new horizons in the graphic
design program in Mexico; this is the reason because of which in the year 1988
were invited to the Metropolitan Autonomous University, the National Autonomous
University of Mexico, the National Institute of Fine Arts and the Ministry of
Foreign Affairs of Mexico through its General Office for Cooperation Education
and Culture, as the main convener, to cooperate with this initiative.

Congreso Mundial de Diseño, 6ª BICM, Guadalajara 2000 / World Design Congress, 6th IPBM, Guadalajara 2000.
ES / La prioridad general de la BICM, al igual que hace un cuarto de siglo, es promover la cultura
del diseño como parte de la vida diaria. Esta idea es el eje transmisor de
propuestas creativas y de interés social que procura la estética contemporánea
tanto en las actividades de difusión cultural como publicitarias y de temas
político-sociales; mismas que sin lugar a dudas impactan en la formación de
gusto estético que constituye la cultura visual de un país, ya que la BICM afirma que el diseño gráfico
aplicado a la publicidad, la difusión cultural, la promoción de campañas
sociales y educativas genera un vasto espectro de posibilidades para el
lenguaje visual percibido por millones de personas. La reflexión sobre cultura
y comunicación visual es entonces posible a través de la comprensión de
mensajes.

EN / The main priority of the IPBM, in its quarter of
a century, is to promote the culture of design as part of daily life. This idea
is the principal axis of creative proposals and social interest that aims
contemporary aesthetics in the activities of cultural dissemination as
advertising and political and social issues; same as undoubtedly impact the
formation of aesthetic taste that is the visual culture of a country, as
the IPBM says that graphic design applied to advertising, cultural
dissemination, promotion of social and educational campaigns generated a vast
spectrum of possibilities for the visual language perceived by millions.
Reflection on visual culture and communication is now possible through the
understanding of messages.





EL LUGAR DE LA BICM EN LA SOCIEDAD / THE PLACE OF BICM IN SOCIETY

ES / El papel que la BICM ha asumido es el de abrir un nuevo espacio en la difusión de
la cultura visual universal. A través de estos 25 años ha facilitado la
presencia de propuestas creativas provenientes de todo el mundo enriqueciendo
el lenguaje visual en tanto que pautas de comparación para fortalecer la
originalidad como creadores. 
EN / The role
that IPBM has taken is to open a new space in the dissemination of
universal visual culture. Through these 25 years it has facilitated the
presence of creative proposals from around the world enriching the visual
language as compared to strengthen guidelines originality as creators.


Congreso Mundial de Diseño, 10ª BICM, Xalapa 2008 / World Design Congress, 10th IPBM, Xalapa 2008.
ES / El diseño
gráfico contemporáneo no ha sido todavía entendido en plenitud como una de las
herramientas más indispensables para el desarrollo sociocultural, de las artes,
de la vida social, política y productiva en general. Por otro lado, el cartel continúa siendo una pieza
indispensable en el desarrollo del oficio del diseñador, lo que obliga a adquirir
conocimientos complejos de composición, códigos de color y tipográficos,
iconografías relacionadas con los temas tratados, conocimiento de la
construcción y arquitectura de la letra además de la necesidad de comunicar una
idea de manera instantánea y precisa.
EN / 
Contemporary graphic design is
not yet fully understood as one of the most indispensable tools for socio-cultural
development, arts, social, political and productive life in general. On the
other hand, the poster remains an indispensable element in the development of
the trade designer, forcing them acquire complex knowledge of composition,
color codes and typographical, iconography related topics, knowledge of
construction and architecture letter and the need to communicate an idea
instantly and accurately.

¿POR QUÉ AYUDAR A LA BICM? / WHY HELP BICM?

ES / Porque la BICM, aunque
orientada particularmente al diseño, estimula las representaciones mentales y
las artes visuales que promueven la producción de bienes estéticos.
Es necesario dejar un testigo de la aportación y
consecuencias que acciones para la cultura del diseño, por ejemplo apreciarlo
como herramienta conceptual para el desarrollo e innovación, otorgan tanto
imagen y presencia de México en el extranjero como una plataforma, donde
jóvenes talento del diseño mexicano desarrollan con fuerza y seguridad la
transformación de realidades y la creación de innovación.

EN / Because IPBM,
thought particularly oriented design, it stimulates mental representations and
visual arts that promote the production of goods.
You must leave
a witness of the contribution and consequences of action to design culture, for
example appreciate it as a conceptual tool for development and innovation,
providing both image and presence of Mexico abroad as a platform where young
talents of mexican design develop strength and confidence that transform
realities and create innovation.


Congreso Mundial de Diseño, 5ª BICM, Xalapa 1998 / World Design Congress, 5th IPBM, 1998 Xalapa
ES / La BICM es
notablemente operativa: este año de aniversario ha revolucionado su concepto en
nombre del compromiso y adaptación para generar productos como el encuentro
cultural interdisciplinario Ciudad Diseño, la exitosa convocatoria de carteles sobre el Patrimonio de la Ciudad de
México titulada Testimonio de lo que
fuimos, somos y seremos y el aumento de sedes BICM: ahora también serán expuestos los bienalistas seleccionados en Museo AROCENA-Coahuila y en el Instituto Cultural de Aguascalientes. Los resultados no cesan, la BICM ha implementado modos de diseminar el ímpetu de la
colaboración, tal como lo es el relanzamiento de su boletín digital Extradiseño. 
EN / The IPBM is
notably operational: this anniversary year has revolutionized its concept in
the name of compromise and adaptation to generate products such as cultural
encounter interdisciplinary design center, the successful convocation of
posters on the World Heritage City of Mexico entitled Testimony of what we were,
ee are and we will be and the increase of headquartes IPBM: now
also be exposed participants  selected in
AROCENA-Museum in Coahuila México and in the Cultural Institute of
Aguascalientes. The results do not stop, the IPBM has implemented
ways to spread the momentum of the partnership, sucha as the relaunch of its
digital newsletter Extradiseño.
ES / La BICM
continúa gestionando proyectos: todavía debe cumplir con su programa de
celebración de aniversario, el cual se constituye por la convocatoria de cartel en
conmemoración a una obra de Kafka, exposiciones de cartel sobre sus 25 años, el
medio ambiente y desarrollo, la conformación de su Consejo  Honorario y la realización de eventos como un
concierto de gala para la asociación. En este tenor una edición conmemorativa,
donde se legitime la historia de los beneficios tangibles provocados por la BICM, se convierte en un elemento
necesario de síntesis histórica.
EN / IPBM continues
managing projects, it must still fulfill its anniversary celebration program,
which is constituted by the call for commemorate a work of Kafka, poster
exhibitions with topics such as 25th anniversary IPBM, the environment and development, the formation of its
Honorary International Council and performing events such as a gala concert for
the association. In this sense a commemorative edition, where the history of
the tangible benefits caused by IPBM, becomes a necessary element of historical synthesis.

Apoya a esta
asociación mexicana a cubrir los fondos de publicación para lograr el tiraje de
un libro que será el testigo de un espacio donde se genera el bien invaluable
del patrimonio visual.


Supports
this mexican civil society to cover public funds to achieve the printing of a
book that will be the witness of a space where the invaluable visual legacy is
generated. 

COMPROMISO Y VALORES BICM / COMMITMENT AND VALUES OF IPBM

ES / LA BICM enfatiza que la
suma de los límites individuales es la vía por la que se alcanza esa adhesión
incondicional llamada solidaridad.
EN / The IPBM
emphasizes that the sum of the individual limits is the way by which the
unconditional support solidarity call is reached.

Congreso Mundial de Diseño, 4ª BICM, Aguascalientes 1996 / Museo Franz Mayer / World Design Congress, 4th IPBM, Aguascalientes 1996 / Franz Mayer Museum
ES / Gracias a
ti la BICM ha conseguido ser con otros en comunidad, dado que sin
tu colaboración incondicional sería inasequible tanto el acervo constituido con
más de 40,000 carteles como el Congreso Mundial de Diseño. Las 13 ediciones de
la BICM son la prueba de la potencia
que alcanzan la fraternidad y colaboración trabajando en conjunto, pues esta
asociación regida por los valores de la educación y la cultura está convencida
que emplear el mecanismo de la solidaridad propicia el desarrollo social,
económico y humano. La BICM está
persuadida que la promoción del bienestar social, mediante el fomento de la
cultura como senda del progreso intelectual del individuo y social, es factible
sólo si somos capaces de mantener vivo el fulgor de la creación comunal y
profusa.
EN / Thanks
to you the IPBM has get to be with others in
community, because without your unconditional collaboration it would be
unavailable both: the acquis constituted with more than 40,000 posters and the
World Design Congress. The 13 editions of the IPBM are proof of the
power of the fraternity and collaboration working together, because this
association governed by the values ​​of education and culture is convinced that
the mechanism of solidarity generates social, economic and human development.
The IPBM is convinced that the promotion of social welfare, through
the promotion of culture as a path of intellectual progress of the individual
and social, it is feasible only if we are able to keep alive the glare of
communal and profuse creation.
ES / Es imperante la necesidad de hacer difusión de
los espacios donde artistas y creadores nutren el legado cultural del arte y la
educación visual. En consecuencia, la BICM
te invita a descubrir el significado que el diseño adquiere cuando es provisto con un enfoque del porvenir y a seguir moviendo actitudes
fraternales para preservar, a través de la edición de este proyecto, uno de los
patrimonios culturales en artes visuales más importantes a nivel mundial. 25
aniversario / BICM de plata  es
un espacio abierto que te brinda la oportunidad de continuar siendo nuestro
compañero solidario en este proyecto colaborativo que nos mueve a favor de la
cultura del diseño. La BICM te garantiza que tu donativo conservará firmes los nichos donde es posible
mantener latente el deseo de libertad interpretado como el espíritu de
solidaridad en búsqueda del auténtico conocimiento.
EN / It is
imperative the need to disseminate the spaces where artists and creators
nourish the cultural legacy of art and visual education. Consequently,
the IPBM invites you to discover the meaning that the design takes
when it is provided with a focus of the future and to continue moving fraternal
attitudes, through the publication of this project, one of the cultural
heritages most important visual arts worldwide. 25th anniversary /
silver IPBM is an open space that offers you the opportunity to continue
being our supportive partner in this collaborative project that moves us in
favor of the culture of design. The IPBM guarantees you that your
donation will keep strong niches where you can maintain a latent desire for
freedom interpreted as the spirit of partnership in pursuit of true knowledge.

Gracias por ayudar a la BICM a permanecer firme la convicción de la fraternidad y el apoyo.


Thank you for helping the BICM to maintain firm
the conviction of brotherhood and support.


RECOMPENSAS / REWARDS


ES / ¿Por qué usamos colores en los nombres de las recompensas? “La razón es que la vista, mejor que los otros sentidos, nos da a conocer los objetos, y nos descubre entre ellos gran número de diferencias” decía Aristóteles. En la BICM consideramos que la nutrida gama de colores, aunque cada uno distinguible, se funde y conjunta para crear un panorama armónico del mismo modo que cada individuo, con sus límites que lo diferencian,  une sus horizontes para generar una red que trabaja en conjunto por una sociedad permeada por los más altos valores. 
EN / Why we
use colors in the names of the rewards? "The reason is that the view
better than the other senses, reveals the objects, and we discover including
many differences," said Aristotle. In the IPBM, we believe that the
abundant range of colors, although each distinguishable, is melted and combined
to create a harmonious landscape just as each individual, with limits that
differentiate it, unites its horizons to create a network that works together
permeated by the highest values society.
BICM de plata: 25 años avivando los tonos para perdurar la memoria.
IPBM silver: 25 years stoking tones to endure memory.








ES / Con esta aportación tu nombre aparecerá en una sección especial de nuestro sitio web dedicada a reconocer el gran apoyo recibido por quienes contribuyeron a la realización de nuestro proyecto. This recognition will be replicated in our social networks, and will appear in the acknowledgments and special dedications the book commemorating the 25th anniversary of the IPBM. You will also receive a diploma in electronic form acknowledging all your support and solidarity.

Este reconocimiento será replicado en nuestras redes sociales y aparecerá en los agradecimientos y dedicatorias especiales del libro conmemorativo del 25 aniversario de la BICM. También recibirás un diploma impreso reconociendo todo tu apoyo y solidaridad.

VOCES EN LIBERTAD 
ES / Esta colección conmemorativa, fue convocada por la BICM en el marco de la celebración del bicentenario y centenario de la independencia y la revolución mexicana. Con la participación de diseñadores de todas partes del mundo, "Voces en libertad" plasma en sus obras la visión de cada autor sobre la libertad. Ha sido expuesta en más de 20 países alrededor del mundo y está próxima a inaugurarse en diversas sedes más. La colección está constituida por  111 carteles de 120 x 90 cm, impresos en offset y numerados. Para conocer la colección completa visita la galería Voces en libertad.

VOICES IN FREEDOM
EN / This commemorative collection, was convened by the IPBM as part of the bicentennial and centennial of Independence and the Mexican Revolution. With the participation of designers from all over the world, "Voices released" reflected in his works, the vision of each author's freedom. It has been exhibited in more than 20 countries around the world and is about to open in various locations more. The collection is made up of 111 posters of 120 x 90 cm, printed on offset and numbered. For the full collection visit the gallery Voices in freedom

AMÉRICA HOY, 500 AÑOS DESPUÉS
Se convocó a diseñadores de diversas nacionalidades, con motivo del quinto centenario de la llegada de Cristóbal Colón a América, a elaborar una profunda reflexión sobre este tema desde diferentes culturas y puntos de vista de lo que hoy significa América para el resto del mundo. La colección está constituida por 44 carteles de 120 x 90 cm, impresos en serigrafía y offset.  Para conocer esta colección visita la galería América Hoy.

AMERICA TODAY, 500 YEARS LATER
EN / It was convened to designers of various nationalities, to mark the fifth centenary of the arrival of Christopher Columbus to America, to develop a deeper reflection on this subject from different cultures and views of what today means America to the world. The collection is made up of 44 posters of 120 x 90 cm, printed in silkscreen and offset. For this collection visit the gallery America Today

ES / El envío a cualquier parte del mundo corre por nuestra cuenta.
EN /Shipping to anywhere in the world is on us.

Unfortunately there is one risk: do not reach the overall goal and therefore we
can not finish the project in time established. However, YOU DO NOT WORRY, because the IPBM  is committed to delivering all agreed
rewards, with the only request that you wait a little more time for your book,
because the association will have to seek other means to fund the project.
Thank you for trusting the IPBM!




¿NO PUEDES APOYAR ESTA CAMPAÑA ECONÓMICANTE? / CAN´T YOU SUPPORT THE CAMPAIGN WITH MONEY?


ES / ¡No importa! Puedes colaborar de muchas otras formas, por ejemplo, ayudando a la BICM a divulgar esta iniciativa. Difunde y circula la información de este esfuerzo en tus redes sociales y con tus amigos para generar eco.  

EN / It does
not matter! You can help in many other ways, such as helping the IPBM to divulge this initiative.
Diffuses and circulates the information of this effort on your social networks
with friends and it will generate echo.
La BICM te agradece el mantener encendida la llama de la fraternidad.
The IPBM thank you to keep the flame of brotherhood.

story:
My name is Valeriy and I am a passionate photographer. I love showing the true beauty of talented and creative girls. WIth the help of IndieGoGo me and my team are looking to create an erotic calendar for 2016, which will be made in national Russian style.

There will be 7 models in this particular project and 13 beautiful photos - one for each month plus cover. In the “Gallery” you can see couple of sketches - they represent the style and the idea of the project I am making. We will be publishing videos and reports of the whole process if our project will get the funding.

The money we are asking for will go for payments for models work, retouching images, printing calendars and shipping them all over the world to you guys! :)



5$ (12 photos):

12 photos

12 Widescreen Desktop Wallpapers

12 amazing photos of our models in high resolution


10$ (Digital calendar premium):

Bonus photo + Widescreen Desktop Wallpapers +Digital calendar

12 (+1 premium!) photos of our models in high resolution

  • Digital calendar  (SWF)


25$ (Backstage plus):


Backstage video + Widescreen Desktop Wallpapers +Digital calendar)+ 1 premium photo

12 (+1 premium!) photos of our models in high resolution

  • Backstage video of how it’s done.

100$ (Standart print 25x25):

Standard Calendar Physical Print 25x25(amount adds in tax & shipping) + Backstage video + Widescreen Desktop Wallpapers +Digital calendar + 1 premium photo

Standard Calendar Physical Print 25x25

  • 12 (+1 premium!) photos of our models in high resolution

  • Digital calendar with 13 photos

  • Backstage video of how it’s done


500$ (Premium print 50x50):

Calendar Physical Print 50x50(amount adds in tax & shipping) + Backstage + Widescreen Desktop Wallpapers + Digital calendar + 1 premium photo

Premium Calendar Physical Print 50x50

  • 12 (+1 premium!) photos of our models in high resolution

  • Digital calendar with 13 photos

  • Backstage video of how it’s done

story:
Short Summary

They say "laughter is the best medicine", and for servicemen and women healing naturally when you can laugh with others and at yourself.

Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) is an anxiety disorder that may develop after exposure to a terrifying event or ordeal in which severe physical harm occurred or was threatened. Traumatic events that may trigger PTSD, especially those who have experience military combat.
When medications and traditional therapy isn't enough, bring in the comedy act of Adam Richmond to promote healing.

What We Need & What You Get

Through We already have access to the base and a theatre available.  All we need is the production money to hire cameras, sound, lighting, and people needed to capture the show and get it through post-production.  We have perks for all the donors and if we don't reach our desired goal, the money will still be put towards the production with the 10% going to the Military Veteran Project.

The Impact

The idea is for this show to be the first in a series of comedy specials.  We'll start with this one in Southern California, then eventually take the show on the road to a variety of bases around the world.  Once it's produced we'll have a product to take to cable companies and studios to play on their networks.  Not only will it be an entertaining show, but it will also help spread more information and love for our armed forces while raising money for charity.

The first charity we have chosen is http://www.militaryveteranproject.org...

The Military Veteran Project is a volunteer-driven charity committed to the treatment of Post Traumatic Stress Disorder, Traumatic Brain Injury and suicide prevention for PRE & POST 9/11 Veterans. 
What a great thing to support and the impact will be felt long after our show.

Risks & Challenges

It's not easy getting all this done but we've done it before.  Some of the things we run into producing shows for the troops is that we never know what kind of training mission may come up on any given day.  So even the best laid plans may be tripped up if all of a sudden a brigade has new orders to follow which don't include coming to a comedy show.  But at the end of the day, we'll plan this right to make sure the theatre is packed with these men and women on show day (and cross our fingers that nothing major happens before that will take them away).
Of course, it's always hard to raise money, but we feel this is mutually beneficial for everyone involved.  We produce something great, make the troops laugh, and raise money for a great cause.  For us, that seems like a trifecta of goodness.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give money, then maybe you know others who can.  If you could help spread the word about this through social media, emails or just word of mouth that's all we can ask for.  Spreading the positive is all we want to do.

story:
Origins

In July of 2013 curator Jason Miller launched the first of what would become a seventeen part exhibition series, which would consist of sixteen solo shows held at Gasoline Gallery in Memphis' Historic Broad Avenue Arts District and spanning from  over four months until its finale show held on November 22, 2013.

One year later Miller orchestrated a group exhibition that expanded beyond the sixteen original artists into forty-four in an exhibition titled Circuitous Succession: Epilogue, and featured fifty-seven artworks all within the Scottish Rite Cathedral of Memphis. The linking of unique artworks with the perplexing presence of historically charged spaces was a constant throughout the two year series of experimental shows in two parts of Memphis.

Ultimately, thousands of visitors attended the series, with over 350 attending the opening reception of the group exhibition alone to view the artworks in juxtaposition with the four stories of the Scottish Rite.

The next logical step was to make the series into an institution through the formation of an art gallery in the same spirit as the original mission that inspired the overall series.

Mission

  • Bring Quality Art Programing and Events to Memphis, TN
  • Be free and open to the public and maintain regular hours of opperation
  • Have new exhibitions monthly, opening the last Friday of every month
  • Bring international and regional artists to Memphis
  • Expose other communities to Memphis artists in addition the artists represented by the Gallery
  • Have a program within the framework in place to serve the local Memphis homeless communities
  • Partner with local non-profits to help enhance the community

Programing

This is where your contributions go:

  • Bringing in visiting artists to give lectures open to the public
  • Bringing represented artists to international art fairs
  • Enhancing exhibitions that are free and open to the public
  • Professional advanced and mid-career artists and formally trained artists are represented by the Gallery
  • Experimental curatorial opportunity in one gallery for emerging curators
  • Alternative contemporary art calls extended to the public
  • Gallery represents a minimum of two emerging artists at any one given time
  • Wandering Artist Program is dedicated to representing displaced and homeless artists

Opperations

Below are the vitals that are required for monthly operation:

  • Property Expenses
  • Utilities
  • Shipping of Artworks
  • Gallery Staff
  • Public Relations Content / Community Outreach Materials
  • Advertising
  • Hardware and Exhibition Materials
  • Didactic Panels
  • Expenses of Hosting and Bringing In Artists

Art Always Benefits The Public, but When the Public Gives Back it Helps Sustainability and Diversifies Revenue in Addition to Art Sales Quotas

When you contribute an amount no matter how small....You become a partner!

Benefits of partners include:

  • invitations to a private appreciation celebration open only to donors
  • donors of 50.00 and more receive an original signed print by your choice of any of the artists represented by Circuitous Succession Gallery (once your request is made, the gallery will initiate fulling your your request with the artist and shipping your print free of cost to you the moment it is signed and presented by the artist)
  • donors of 300.00 or more are entitled to have their business of chosen logo listed on the gallery website's sponsor's area and included in select PR materials
  • donors of 1000.00 or more become deity status and have opportunities for private studio visits and more
  • donors of 5000.00 or more are entitled to a visit by their artist of choice anywhere in the 48 lower states (transportation paid in full by the Gallery)
  • donors of 10,000.00 or more are entitled to a commission by any one of the gallery's represented artists at no extra fee
  • donors of more than 1/3 the fiscal goal of 50,000.00 are entitled to custom requests and commissions collaborated on by any two of the Gallery's represented artists

Other Ways You Can Help

We are always looking for bright aspiring interns and volunteers:

  • Presently enrolled BFA / BA / MFA / MA or doctoral candidates are invited to submit a letter of interest via the contact page at circuitoussuccession.com
  • Volunteers may submit letters of interest also at circuitoussuccession.com

Experimental curatorial opportunity in one gallery for emerging curators
Alternative contemporary art calls extended to the public
Gallery represents a minimum of two emerging artists at any one given time
Wandering Artist Program is dedicated to representing displaced and homeless artists    Opperations Below are the vitals that are required for monthly operation:  Property Expenses Utilities Shipping of Artworks
Gallery Staff
Public Relations Content / Community Outreach Materials
Advertising
Hardware and Exhibition Materials
Didactic Panels
Expenses of Hosting and Bringing In Artists    Art Always Benefits The Public, but When the Public Gives Back it Helps Sustainability and Diversifies Revenue in Addition to Art Sales Quotas  When you contribute an amount no matter how small....You become a partner!
Benefits of partners include:  invitations to a private appreciation celebration open only to donors donors of 50.00 and more receive an original signed print by your choice of any of the artists represented by Circuitous Succession Gallery (once your request is made, the gallery will initiate fulling your your request with the artist and shipping your print free of cost to you the moment it is signed and presented by the artist)
donors of 300.00 or more are entitled to have their business of chosen logo listed on the gallery website's sponsor's area and included in select PR materials
donors of 1000.00 or more become deity status and have opportunities for private studio visits and more
donors of 5000.00 or more are entitled to a visit by their artist of choice anywhere in the 48 lower states (transportation paid in full by the Gallery)
donors of 10,000.00 or more are entitled to a commission by any one of the gallery's represented artists at no extra fee
donors of more than 1/3 the fiscal goal of 50,000.00 are entitled to custom requests and commissions collaborated on by any two of the Gallery's represented artists    Other Ways You Can Help We are always looking for bright aspiring interns and volunteers:  Presently enrolled BFA / BA / MFA / MA or doctoral candidates are invited to submit a letter of interest via the contact page at circuitoussuccession.com Volunteers may submit letters of interest also at circuitoussuccession.com

story:
BOSQUE COMESTIBLE DE "LAS SABINAS"

                                  
Nuestros Bosques Comestibles ,  tienen como objetivo reforestar espacios especialmente degradados o incendiados, revitalizar despoblados, crear auto-empleo, fomentar la Permacultura (Significa Agricultura Permanente. Leer Más). y toda una Red de Alojamientos, Formación y Producciones Artesanales...


Ahora puedes ayudarnos y financiar algún elemento de éste primer Proyecto de Bosque de Alimentos en la provincia de Cádiz (Andalucía- España).  

Dará trabajo y cobijo a  dos familias (en principio) que alcanzarán elevados niveles de Autosuficiencia Alimentaria, Energética y Financiera.

 El "BOSQUE COMESTIBLE DE LAS SABINAS" funcionará como vivero para propagar parte de las plantas que nos servirán en futuros proyectos de Bosques Comestibles.



 Después de muchos años de aprendizaje nos hemos decidido a crear una Red con la que poner a disposición de todos, los conocimientos necesarios para caminar hacia la autosuficiencia mediante el trabajo colectivo y la cooperación. 

EJEMPLOS DE OTROS ESPACIOS DENTRO DE BOSQUES COMESTIBLES

         

 

Franjas de infiltración con Bancales Profundos EDP y Bosque Comestible de "Santa Margarita".Diseños de Diego Luis López para Sastreria Vegetal.

NUESTROS BLOGS
 Si quieres conocer más sobre nuestros proyectos, te invitamos a visitar los blogs en los que hemos estado trabajando y que de alguna manera complementen la información que vamos publicando:  EL BLOG CON FICHAS DE PLANTAS AROMÁTICAS Y MEDICINALES,  RECETAS DE COCINA EN PERMACULTURA,  REMEDIOS NATURALES, ESPECIES QUE EMPLEAMOS, etc....
 Todo éste trabajo lo Coordinamos desde la oficina de La Casa del Pozo que es además la Casa-Taller en la que procesamos los distintos productos que obtenemos de los huertos y de la RED IBÉRICA DE BOSQUES COMESTIBLES Y SEMILLAS LIBRES en éste nuevo espacio.

Por qué te necesitamos y  Qué obtienes a cambio

  • En ésta ocasión el terreno es cedido por el Amigo Cristóbal y no es necesario comprarlo por lo que el coste estimado de la preparación, plantación, obras necesarias y su correcto mantenimiento hasta que el Bosque sea autónomo se eleva a un mínimo de 28207 €uros  en los que se incluye además la construcción de un Baño seco, Horno Universal y dos Alojamientos Domo para acoger a Voluntarios y asistentes a Cursos, además de colaboradores y benefactores como tú, que deseen venir a vernos. También hemos incluido un vehículo y remolque ya que los necesitaremos para poder transportar personas, plantas y materiales, cosechas, llevar a cabo rutas por los alrededores, etc... Dado el aislamiento y malas comunicaciones del lugar, muchas veces hemos de recoger a nuestros amigos y visitantes en alguna de las poblaciones cercanas.

                                  


  • Al colaborar con nosotros, te haces también "propietaria" ya que obtienes acceso gratuito a cualquier Bosque de ésta Red y descuentos para los Talleres, Alojamientos y Compra de productos. Financiando una Planta Medicinal, un Arbusto, Caja-Nido o Árbol recibirás un documento que hace las veces de "recibo" y que te indica la descripción y posicionamiento GPS del elemento financiado. Presentando dicho documento podrás acceder libremente a visitar cualquier Bosque Comestible de esta Red.
  • Ayudas igualmente a la preservación de variedades de semillas. Antiguas, locales y libres. Nuestro Banco de Semillas Libres tendrá su instalación principal en éste primer Bosque Comestible y, desde allí se organizarán periódicamente encuentros y contactos para el intercambio de semillas y otras colaboraciones que puedan surgir y cuyo fin sea la preservación de la diversidad genética de las semillas y su libre acceso.

El objetivo primero de esta iniciativa es el de Regenerar Espacios para la Biodiversidad que ofrezcan oportunidades de empleo (a dos familias en éste caso). La Forestación Lógica de cada espacio y la creación de condiciones para la Auto Gestión, serán siempre el destino principal y primero de los fondos recaudados.


Queremos que formes parte!!! y para eso hemos puesto en marcha un Blog de este "BOSQUE COMESTIBLE DE LAS SABINAS"en el que podrás seguir todo el proceso desde el Proyecto que hemos elaborado hasta la plantación, mantenimiento y transformación, Talleres y Cursos programados, etc...


El impacto

Estamos librando una batalla silenciosa contra la desertificación del entorno Mediterráneo y, nuestra apuesta es PLANTAR. 

Millones de personas desempleadas a las que se les va la vida sintiéndose infravalorada, Tristes ante la falta de oportunidades y con miedo a perder aquello que tienen. Contra esta situación , nuestra apuesta también es PLANTAR.

Luchar contra el empobrecimiento de nuestras tierras y sus habitantes mediante la creación de una Red Ibérica de Bosques Comestibles, Bosques Creadores que  proporcionen cobijo, trabajo y sustento a aquellas familias responsables de su gestión.

Una Red que sirva además para fijar población en entornos rurales.

  

Una Red de Alojamientos  bioconstruidos, diseñados por la Arquitecta Carolina Gardiol (Fundadora del Estudio ARQUITECTURA KOMESTIBLE)  espacios sencillos y acogedores en los que nuestros visitantes se sientan como en casa y puedan participar de nuestra vida cotidiana, y/o de los talleres programados, ya que en cada Bosque Comestible llevamos a cabo los trabajos de manera colectiva como forma de aprendizaje práctico y convivencial. Esta formación se certifica por Escuelas de Permacultura mediante documento acreditativo de las horas de formación.

 Nuestro sueño es crear toda una Red de Bosques de Alimentos que nos permita recorrer nuestra geografía tener siempre cerca uno de los Bosques de la Red.

En este Bosque de Alimentos convivirán más de 2000 plantas de 75 especies diferentes.Proporcionarán madera, frutos, miel, alimento para las Lombrices, semillas y nuevas plantas. Los criterios para la selección y ubicación de las plantas lo vamos explicando en el Blog del Proyecto.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

 Que no puedas colaborar como financiador no significa que no puedas ayudarnos. Tanto si te animas a formar parte de nuestro colectivo como si no, puedes difundir esta campaña por correo, en redes sociales y pedir a tus amigos y familiares que hagan lo mismo.

Hemos creado un Grupo de Teaming en el que puedes colaborar con tan sólo 1€/Mes para sostener este proyecto.

Visita nuestros Blogs, hazte seguidor/a y comparte, eso nos ayuda mucho.

 Muchas Gracias y un Saludo.

Diego Luis López y Carolina Gardiol

story:
Our Story

My name is Todd Pletcher and I am a studio potter in Goshen, IN.  It has been an exciting last few years for us, and we are thrilled to be in the final stages of our wood kiln project.

I moved to Indiana in August of 2012 with my partner, Anna, and set up a studio at our new home.  While I make a variety of work out of the studio space, wood-firing has always been my favorite firing technique, because of the uniqueness of the finished pots and the community experience that goes along with the firing process. 

Years before we considering living in Indiana, we had been returning to the area to visit my family and participate in wood-firings with my friends.  It was during these visits we began to dream about leaving our small apartment in Chicago and the jobs that allowed us to live but not save, and form a plan about what we wanted from our lives.  Wood-firing with has acted as a catalyst for growth in my relationship with Anna, as well as the greater ceramics community here in northern Indiana.  We dreamed about eventually having our own wood kiln. Now we are excited to make that dream a reality.
 

The Campaign

Building a kiln is a major project, and first on our list was settling on a design.  As mentioned above, we have been very fortunate to be a part of the wood-firing community in Michiana.  Most of the kilns in our area are traditional anagama-style kilns.  These are the kilns that hooked me on wood-firing and while they remain one of my favorite designs, we wanted to bring something new to the area.

After much debate, we settled on a train design.  While smaller than most other kilns, the train will allow for faster and more frequent firings.  It is our hope that this increase in firing speed and turn-around will encourage more experimenting and testing of clay bodies, slips and glazes, as well as new wadding and loading techniques. 

While I have assisted in the building of a few kilns over the years, this is by far the most ambitious project I have attempted.  As such, I thought it best to ask for some professional assistance.  We are very pleased to have expert kiln builder, Ted Neal,  joining us to lead our project.  I have had the privilege of firing with Ted and we couldn't be happier to have him scheduled to build the train. The final product will look something like this.


What We Need

We have been carefully planning and budgeting for this project over the years and we are very close to starting our build.  

The kiln shed went up and the pad was poured in the beginning of June.  While things are taking shape fast, we are still in need of a few final items to stay on track (although Anna will miss her private dance party pad..!).

While we have tried to assemble most of our materials, we are still in need of some critical items.  Your support will help us purchase the remaining firebrick, steel bracing, pyrometer, and building equipment.

What You Get

Well, pottery of course!  All of these perks will come from our first few firings and we are excited to share this new work with you.

The Duder - $25 contribution


The Tulip Cup - $40 contribution


The Mug - $60 Contribution


The Plate - $75 contribution


The Pitcher - $125 contribution


The Serving Bowl - $250 contribution

story:
The Subtle Image : A Dream Come True

The venue is set.

The artists are ready. 

The only piece that's missing... 

...is you.

Hi, my name is Audra Lambert, and I am the curator of The Subtle Image art exhibition.

This exhibit, slated to open on Nov. 6 at Dejavu Gallery, will introduce bright artistic talent to an expanded audience. I'm so excited to be realizing this exhibit, selecting, arranging and curating these works at this central Midtown gallery space.

We want you to join us in realizing the dream of 13 artists and 1 curator in creating The Subtle Image at Dejavu Gallery.

Dejavu Gallery is committed to being a center for artistic talent in New York City. And now, we need your support to ensure that we are able to cover costs to produce the show and to cover costs for the site. Help us realize our dream and support all of our efforts to shine for the City (and the world) to see!

Be an Art Patron!

How You Support Us & Where We're Headed:

We've worked so hard to make this exhibit a success, but to supplement our efforts we need your support to finance the following costs for the exhibit:

  • Production costs: Materials and Labor needed to ensure the exhibit's success, such as:  Gallery materials and equipment, Coordinating artworks, Signage, and Managing Sales.
  • Marketing costs: To get the word out about this incredible exhibit, including: Indiegogo collateral, postcards for exhibit, online advertising
  • Install, Upkeep & De-Install: We want to ensure that these tasks are performed in a timely, professional manner, pulling on skilled labor to handle each aspect of the Exhibit's lifespan.
  • Programming: We want to offer guests of the exhibit new ways of considering art in the gallery, with a curator-led tour and prospective talks with artists and interdisciplinary experts in art, fashion and design. 
  • Space rental: A centrally located Manhattan gallery, we need assistance to cover the costs of renting out the site for The Subtle Image.

Join us as we work to:

- Exhibit this carefully crafted art in an easily accessible space

- Create a previously missing dialogue between artists and visitors 

- Reflect on the legacy of the space as a site for ground-breaking new artworks


Steer Us Toward Great Things..

...as we grow!

In order for the exhibit to reach it's full potential, we are headed to an actual fundraising goal of $15,000. That amount will produce the full scope of the show--ensuring that exhibit is on view for long enough to attract a diverse new audience, through the second week of December.  Reaching the listed goal of $8500 will take us through Thanksgiving, but help us extend through to mid-December by contributing to a total of $15,000 and increase exposure for these dedicated artists!



ABOUT THE ARTISTS

All of our artists are talented and dedicated to creating innovative new artworks. 

Artists participating in The Subtle Image include:

Holly Anne Buck (Collagism) Holly-Anne is an Aussie based in London who focuses on enervating collage art created from found objects. 


Vicky Barranguet Vicky is an internationally exhibited and renowned Uruguayan painter whose works demonstrate a flair for organizing form and space. 


Thomas John Carlson Thomas John is an established American artist, curator and instructor whose paintings span the surreal and the figurative.


Erin Fritts Erin is an artist, instructor and metallurgist from Long Island whose meditative and healing artworks originate in the subconscious and are guided by a carefully trained artistic eye. 


Grigory Gurevich Grigory is truly a Renaissance man--artist, inventor, mime and instructor. Originally from Russia, now based in New Jersey, he has worked across many mediums and has been creating artworks that speak to the sublime for over 35 years. 


Andrew Kaminski Andrew is a multimedia artist from New York whose works capture subtle detail in their full splendor. His works emphasize mindful movement and light manipulation across space. 


Jerry Khan Jerry is a New-York born artist based in Jersey City who is noted for his flat, surrealist depictions merged with symbolic allegory. This combination makes his works recognizable and refreshingly unique. 


Ida Ivanka Kubler Ida is a Bulgarian artist and fashion designer based in New York City whose works incorporate natural materials to inspire new contemplations on the human condition. 


Marjan Moghaddam Marjan is a humanist artist and master animator who paints with digital tools. Her work recalls fragmentation in detailed splendor. She is originally from Iran and lives and works in Brooklyn.


Bruno Nadalin Bruno is an artist based in Jersey City whose works vacillate between painterly and linear. Proficient across mediums from print-making to drawing, Bruno's pieces are saturated in emotion and often subversive in nature.


Midori Okuyama  Midori is an emerging Japanese artist based in Brooklyn whose detailed works convey a the supernatural and a heightened sense of spirituality. 


Sheila Schwid Sheila is an established New York City based artist whose work absorbs alternate means of observing and presents discordant realities.


Valeriy Skypka Valeriy is a master of the human form, an artist originally from the Ukraine whose artwork delights and manifests joy in being. 


ABOUT THE CURATOR

Audra Lambert is an arts writer and independent curator with five years of combined experience in the arts. She has exhibited with EFA Project Space and Hyperplace Harlem, among others. Audra is passionate about making art available to the general public in a meaningful way, bridging past and present identities and ensuring that emerging and mid-career artists exhibit in diverse venues to ever expanding audiences.

We've worked so hard to make this exhibit a success, but to supplement our efforts we need your support to finance the following costs for the exhibit:


Production costs: Materials and Labor needed to ensure the exhibit's success, such as:  Gallery materials and equipment, Coordinating artworks, Signage, and Managing Sales.

Marketing costs: To get the word out about this incredible exhibit, including: Indiegogo collateral, postcards for exhibit, online advertising

Install, Upkeep & De-Install: We want to ensure that these tasks are performed in a timely, professional manner, pulling on skilled labor to handle each aspect of the Exhibit's lifespan.

Programming: We want to offer guests of the exhibit new ways of considering art in the gallery, with a curator-led tour and prospective talks with artists and interdisciplinary experts in art, fashion and design. 

Space rental: A centrally located Manhattan gallery, we need assistance to cover the costs of renting out the site for The Subtle Image.


Join us as we work to:
- Exhibit this carefully crafted art in an easily accessible space
- Create a previously missing dialogue between artists and visitors 
- Reflect on the legacy of the space as a site for ground-breaking new artworks

Steer Us Toward Great Things..
...as we grow!
In order for the exhibit to reach it's full potential, we are headed to an actual fundraising goal of $15,000. That amount will produce the full scope of the show--ensuring that exhibit is on view for long enough to attract a diverse new audience, through the second week of December.  Reaching the listed goal of $8500 will take us through Thanksgiving, but help us extend through to mid-December by contributing to a total of $15,000 and increase exposure for these dedicated artists!






 
ABOUT THE ARTISTS

All of our artists are talented and dedicated to creating innovative new artworks. 
Artists participating in The Subtle Image include:
Holly Anne Buck (Collagism) Holly-Anne is an Aussie based in London who focuses on enervating collage art created from found objects. 



Vicky Barranguet Vicky is an internationally exhibited and renowned Uruguayan painter whose works demonstrate a flair for organizing form and space. 



Thomas John Carlson Thomas John is an established American artist, curator and instructor whose paintings span the surreal and the figurative.



Erin Fritts Erin is an artist, instructor and metallurgist from Long Island whose meditative and healing artworks originate in the subconscious and are guided by a carefully trained artistic eye. 



Grigory Gurevich Grigory is truly a Renaissance man--artist, inventor, mime and instructor. Originally from Russia, now based in New Jersey, he has worked across many mediums and has been creating artworks that speak to the sublime for over 35 years. 



Andrew Kaminski Andrew is a multimedia artist from New York whose works capture subtle detail in their full splendor. His works emphasize mindful movement and light manipulation across space. 



Jerry Khan Jerry is a New-York born artist based in Jersey City who is noted for his flat, surrealist depictions merged with symbolic allegory. This combination makes his works recognizable and refreshingly unique. 



Ida Ivanka Kubler Ida is a Bulgarian artist and fashion designer based in New York City whose works incorporate natural materials to inspire new contemplations on the human condition. 



Marjan Moghaddam Marjan is a humanist artist and master animator who paints with digital tools. Her work recalls fragmentation in detailed splendor. She is originally from Iran and lives and works in Brooklyn.



Bruno Nadalin Bruno is an artist based in Jersey City whose works vacillate between painterly and linear. Proficient across mediums from print-making to drawing, Bruno's pieces are saturated in emotion and often subversive in nature.



Midori Okuyama  Midori is an emerging Japanese artist based in Brooklyn whose detailed works convey a the supernatural and a heightened sense of spirituality. 



Sheila Schwid Sheila is an established New York City based artist whose work absorbs alternate means of observing and presents discordant realities.



Valeriy Skypka Valeriy is a master of the human form, an artist originally from the Ukraine whose artwork delights and manifests joy in being. 



ABOUT THE CURATOR

Audra Lambert is an arts writer and independent curator with five years of combined experience in the arts. She has exhibited with EFA Project Space and Hyperplace Harlem, among others. Audra is passionate about making art available to the general public in a meaningful way, bridging past and present identities and ensuring that emerging and mid-career artists exhibit in diverse venues to ever expanding audiences.

story:
Have you wondered what happened to figure skating?

That does not mean the great acrobats of skating, but the actual Figure skating: the controlled edges into and out of elements, the smooth stroking, the stable footwork, etc.  It was nice to be able to see a complete jump without having to review the slow motion camera determining how many revolutions were made on the ice versus in the air.

The answer is the disappearance of FIGURES: that part of skating that produced the skating legends.  Figures have been obscured from then UNTIL NOW.

The World Figure Championship & Figure Festival need your support to begin the re-emergence of the art and discipline of Figures.

Choose one or more of the funding levels to help and receive that level’s perk!

To learn more about the events, please visit www.WorldFigureChampionship.com.  

All proceeds of this crowd funding drive will go towards the production of this event. As an example of some of the production costs, the ice fees alone are in excess of $21 thousand.  Production of the Championship & Festival is coordinated by Peak Edge Performance, Inc.  Any surplus of this funding will be used for the production of the 2016 World Figure Championship & Figure Festival.

The World Figure Championship offers an elite level goal for aspiring skaters of Figures in which skaters will now strive to compete.  The Championship will determine the best figures in an innovative unbiased way and will offer audiences a modern perspective of the competition (see championship).  The Championship hopes to inspire participation in lower level Figure competitions that will give skaters an elite Goal to motivate the resurgence of Figures practice and instruction. 

Q & A

1. What would a concert pianist sound like without having mastered scales?  Or what would the line of a ballet dancer look like if she did not do work at the barre?

-  Not very good.

2. What is “Black Ice”?

-  Naturally dark or painted dark surface under the ice.  See for example  Introduction to the Art of Figure Skating

3. What is "unbiased judging"?

- "Unbiased judging" is a method created by the organizers, Peak Edge Performance, where the judging panel only ranks the Figure prints that are skated on the same ice.  The judging panel does not see the Figures as they are skated.  Only after the skaters leave the ice, does the judging panel see the Figure prints.

4. What is Peak Edge Performance?

-Peak Edge Performance is the company coordinating the World Figure Championship & Figure Festival.  The company was started 20 years ago by skating Olympians Karen Courtland Kelly and Patrick Kelly who both desire to witness future great skating.  For more information see peakedgeperformance.com.  Peak Edge Performance will only take a fee for services if the production of 2015 World Figure Championship & Figure Festival is fully funded.

5. What about a 2016 World Figure Championship?

-Any remaining funds from this project will be used in the production of the expected next World Figure Championship which we are in the initial stages of planning and we hope would be in 2016!

story:
The Lost Collection

In the 1970s a young artist, named Lorenzo Ghiglieri created a masterpiece -16 massive paintings that brilliantly portray the Bible narrative in spectacular detail. Lost for over forty years this collection was rediscovered a few years ago. It had been kept in storage and obscurity where it remains to this day in an air conditioned warehouse. The purpose of this fundraiser is to collect enough funds to purchase the collection and place it on permanent public display for all to see. Weather you are a Christian or an art lover this is a worthwhile investment for future generations. Please, we need your help, Please give whatever you can. Every dollar counts. Thank you for your support. If you want to read more, the whole story is printed below.

The Campaign

The current owner of the paintings is willing to sell the whole collection for $400,000.We are starting a fundraising campaign to gather the funds to purchase the collection and put it on public display. We are also starting a non profit organization to oversee the campaign and the exhibition of the paintings.

The History: How it all started

The brain child of Walter William Wiley (1935-1997) in association with Richard E. Lange (1926-1992), author and musician, these colorful paintings (see entire set in Gallery above and on Facebook) portraying the big picture of the Bible story from Genesis to Revelation were originally designed and painted on sixteen  2 foot by 6 foot canvasses by Lorenzo Ghiglieri in the mid-1970s.  They were intended to be put on display and tour the world, presenting the entire plan of salvation in just one hour. 

Sadly, due to over ambitious plans and poor management, the paintings and all associated materials were confiscated in lieu of unpaid debts.  They were placed in storage, collecting dust now for over 40 years.  The trustees have never been able to raise the money needed to recover the paintings.  We believe that it is way over time for the paintings to be put back into the use for which they were intended -- in a museum, available for all to see.

story:
We are inviting you to become a part of the GDFS family, and support our International Poster Exhibition through a small cash donation. 

As GDFS does not receive funding or support, achieving the quality we aspire to is difficult. We're doing this for love, so please show your support, a little help from you can go a long way.


GDFS was founded in 2014 by Beth Wilson and James Gilchrist. The festival promotes the best of international graphic design and visual communication and aims to inspire and educate through active engagement. Networking and socialising play a key role in the festival and we aim to build relationships and networks across the world. This year the festival takes place between the 20th - 25th October in Glasgow, Scotland.

Your contribution will fund:

- Competition prize money: 1st place: £500, 2nd place: £300, 3rd place: £100

(We feel it is important to honour the winners of the poster competition with prize money to support and encourage the future design of posters)

- Hanging system for the posters and exhibition materials

(This year we would like to invest money into hanging systems which can be reused for future exhibitions) 

- Archiving of the artworks after the exhibition

(We receive many poster entries from across the world and believe it is important to archive these properly and securely)

Thank you for your time and we would be honoured to have your name on our A1 poster catalogue. We hope to see you at the opening night to enjoy and celebrate the amazing posters from across the world. 

We would appreciate if you could share this with anyone who would be interested in joining the GDFS family!

story:
THANK YOU!!!

THANK YOU to everyone that donated to our Indiegogo campaign, shared it with a friend, or sent your love our way. We couldn't build this amazing, giant art without you and are so incredibly grateful for all your love & support! ❤️ 

Follow our progress to the playa )'( through our Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/brlighthouse/ and on our Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/brlighthouseservice/

SCHWAG 

Interested in getting some more Lighthouse schwag? Donate to our GoFundMe (http://bit.ly/1S3jmLY) and email us (donations@brlighthouse.org) with your selection and mailing address. We'll hook you up! Check out photos of the schwag here: http://bit.ly/1XuBLsX - scroll to the bottom of the page.

1) Lighthouse Patch - Patch it up! These gorgeous circular black and gold patches feature the Lighthouse's logo in full glory. Handcrafted by Lighthouse crew member Jason Privett. - $20 USD + Shipping ($5 USA, $7 worldwide) 

2) BRLS Logo T-Shirt - Black T-shirt with the BRLS logo screen printed on the front. Available in sizes M-XL. - $35 USD + Shipping ($6 USA, $15 worldwide)

3) BRLS Logo Female Tank Top - Black tank top with the BRLS logo screen printed on the front, women's cut. Available in sizes S-XL. - $35 USD + Shipping ($6 USA, $15 worldwide) 

4) BRLS Logo Zip Hoodie - Black zip hoodie with the BRLS logo. Available in sizes S-XL. - $65 USD + Shipping ($6 USA, $15 worldwide)

5) Limited Edition Print - Own 1 of 10 Prints of Max Poynton's original drawings of the main Lighthouse. Each one will be signed and framed in wood that we will remove from the Lighthouses before the burn. > only 3 left < - $275 USD + Shipping ($15 USA, $30 worldwide) 

6) Fly Above the Playa! - A Bird's Eye View of Burning Man could be YOURS. Fly above the playa in an aerobatic VANS RV4 aircraft. This 2 seat aircraft will fly above the playa allowing you a bird's eye view of the festivities and will then exit the Burning Man Airspace and conduct some aerobatics (if you feel up to it). - $1500 USD 

7) Own a Lighthouse - We will build you an 8ft (or smaller if you like) Lighthouse that you can place in your yard, give to your kids, or maybe even give one to your cats for the most luxurious playhouse ever! The Lighthouse will be based on the design of the actual Lighthouses that will be at Burning Man this year; however, we are happy to customize them to some degree if you wish. Delivery to the San Francisco Bay Area only. If you really want one and live further away, contact info@brlighthouse.org - $3250 USD


Indiegogo Campaign #2 - Let's Fire Up the Black Rock Lighthouse Service!

Help us add FIRE to the Lighthouses, support our follow-up campaign! https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/fire-up-the-black-rock-lighthouse-service


Let's Build 15 Lighthouses in the Black Rock Desert

Help us welcome Burners home and guide them on their way to adventure with one the most iconic and evocative projects that you'll see on the playa this year.

Reaching over 60 feet tall, with some leaning as much as 20 degrees, this crystal-like cluster of lighthouses will be the ultimate destination at Burning Man this summer.  You will be able to climb, slide, shelter and then watch them burn. Inside the lighthouses, in rooms curated by some renowned guest artists, you'll find lots of exciting surprises and mysteries to explore. 

Yes, this is a crazily ambitious project. We have been talking and dreaming about it for years, but now it's happening and we really need you to make our vision become a reality. 

What We Need 

Building an art installation of this scale and complexity out of wood that you can climb all over while it shoots flames is EXPENSIVE. A team of structural engineers, architects, fire safety engineers, carpenters and metal workers have already been hard at work for four months experimenting and building prototypes. 

We are asking you to help us buy:

  • $20,000 worth of wood
  • $6,000 worth of screws, bolts, nuts and fixings
  • $3,000 worth of fabrics
  • $10,000 worth of propane and hardware for all the flame effects
  • $7,000 for lighting (Lighthouses do need lights)
  • $4,000 for kinetic interactive pieces that you get to play with
This just gets us the basics and we have far more ambitious plans if we can raise more money. If you want to see something truly amazing this year, please help us out. 

The lighthouses are being built at American Steel Studios in West Oakland by an all-volunteer team of experienced artists, carpenters, designers, and veteran Burning Man attendees. This project has been in the planning stages for nearly five years. There have been multiple rounds of technical feedback into the design process, and we have established contingency plans around funding and key decision points. 

Amazing Perks

The Health Pack

Some of the Other Perks


Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to make a tax deductible donation please contact info@brlighthouse.org and we can issue a tax receipt. If you can't donate but have some amazing old wood or antique nautical equipment, we are located at American Steel in Oakland, CA and would love to hear from you.

Thank You From Jonny, Max and Liam Neeson

story:
Short Summary

We are studying the history of art, and we know that people who live in Siberia, have little knowledge of contemporary art. We want to people in other countries have learned about the art of Siberia, and we want people from Siberia learned about contemporary art.

What We Need & What You Get

We have created a unique book. Now we must make it a design layout. Design the layout of the book to be printed in a printing house. This book shall be made on paper, rather than in digital form. By design layout - this is a very good book artist. The book itself is a work of art. We want to raise money to publish a unique book and to print five hundred copies in a print shop. Print books we need 12,500 dollars.

The Impact

We have gathered in this book are the stories of contemporary artists of Siberia. They need to let the world know about their work. We want people around the world learned about the art of living in Siberia. We want to know Siberians about what art is today in the world. This book will help us to better know each other.

Risks & Challenges

The risk is that we will not have the finances to make a beautiful design layout. The book on the art should be very beautiful, so that people want to read, watch, that people have not forgotten about it. If the book is not beautiful, it would not be interesting. Beautiful design the layout of the book needs financing.

Other Ways You Can Help

We ask you to support us and to talk about our project on social networks. We welcome any feasible help. We are grateful to all the people who like our idea.
