story:
Let’s Save Scotland’s Only Banksy

On 11 August 2018, restoration work starts at Argyle St Arches in Glasgow, where Scotland’s only recorded Banksy pieces are hidden. There are 3 pieces which were tragically painted over when their location - a nightclub then known as The Arches - was shut down.

It’s a meticulous and timely job with the project estimated to take up until the end of 2018 and the artwork needing a good deal of repairs to allow the artworks to be showcased to fans.

So, we need you and the support of Banksy fans and art lovers across the world to help pledge and donate to allow these pieces to be displayed to the public once again.

You can make a money contribution or donate and in return receive an exclusive gift!

The artwork

The artwork was created at a joint exhibition with artist Jamie Reid in 2001, when Banksy was less well-known. The exhibition, called ‘Peace is Tough’, features (as you can see below) 3 murals including the iconic gun-toting monkey in a tutu.

Here’s how it previously looked:

 

What it looks like now?

 

The Restoration

Because the restoration work is so specialist and detailed, we’ve invited a team of international art restoration experts with 30 years' experience in conserving wall paintings to support the campaign.

This will be a gradual and painstaking process but piece by piece, they'll get the artworks back to their original appearance.

As the artwork will be funded by fans of Banksy, street art, and the arts in Scotland, it’s only right that this will be an interactive experience where the public can speak with the restorers while they work.

 

How can I help?

In simple terms, we need donations and lots of them. We need donations and pledges of financial support which can range anywhere from £5 and upwards to get our project moving.

The really special thing is that for each donation and at whatever donation level, each donor will receive one of the gifts shown to the right. That gift will be yours to have as a keepsake, and the more you donate, the bigger the gift you receive. You can choose your gift to the right of this page.

 

How much to donate?

You can make a money contribution or donate and in return receive aan exclusive gift!

Each donation for a gift starts from as little as £5 working up to £250. Each contribution takes us a step closer to revealing a little bit more of this iconic artwork.

The more donations we get, the more restoration we can complete and the more of the Banksy artwork can be revealed.

Simply choose your gift and donate!

 

Where is it?

Banksy's iconic murals were created at famous nightclub The Arches, on the site now known as Argyle St Arches, located underneath Glasgow Central Station; a prime location for tourists and visitors from across the world.

The doors will be open throughout our project for you to see how the restoration is coming along. The work will take place from Friday-Sunday, to coincide with Platform at Argyle St Arches.

 

The BIG reveal

Each part of the Banksy mural will require at least 8 weeks for the restoration. The restorers will complete a section at a time, starting with the gun-toting monkey in a tutu. By December 2018 it is expected (donations permitting) that we will have revealed all 3 sections.

 

How can I watch the progress?

We’ll be doing live videos to show you what stage we are at and you’ll be able to join our Facebook page to check in with us.

There’ll be regular updates here and on our website, www.banksy.scot, so you can be a part of it every step of the way.

Of course, you can come to Argyle St Arches and see how the restoration is progressing in person!

How else can I get involved?

We’d love to hear from you and what these Banksy artworks mean to you. We’d equally love it if you can share what we are doing to help increase our donation pot.

Here’s how you can help:

  • Donate – this is a biggie for us as it helps get the project off the ground
  • Share a photo with us of the gift you received for donating
  • You can post on our Facebook pages and share our posts on Twitter and Instagram to encourage other likeminded fans to get involved
  • And if you want to keep donating as the project moves along, please do! We have a gift shop online at: www.banksy.scot
  • Come and visit the project, have your picture taken alongside Scotland’s only Banksy pieces!

You can follow us on social media here:

Banksy.Scot

Facebook    Instagram   Twitter 

Argyle Street Arches

Facebook    Instagram   Twitter 

Platform at Argyle Street Arches

Facebook    Instagram  Twitter 

We are incredibly proud of what we have here and what we are about to unveil, so join us and be part of this historical moment.

Together, we’ll reveal and restore Scotland’s only BANKSY
to it’s original glory!

story:
Gathering of the Unlimited Devotion

Participation is Key!

Join your friends on a pair of spinning discs, while LEDs light up the night around you! Our spinners will be fabricated in Metal, Wood and tons of Devotion, and are designed to fit this year's YOUtopia theme 'Vintage Future Playground'.

Unlike the nostalgic 1980s version, these spinners are sized comfortably for adults. The spinners are 3.5’ in diameter, approximately 4’ total height, and can fit two people comfortably on the wooden surface.

In the daytime, these are beautiful painted rotating sculptures, with a spiral pattern on the sitting surface, and bright colors on the highly sculpted stem and base. At night, the spinners have embedded lights beneath the surface, and emanate different light patterns as you spin. Together, these spinning sculptures make a beautiful and surreal visual.

While we have been awarded an Art Grant by the YOUtopia Festival that only provides a portion of funding, and it's a highly engineered project with currently over 100 hours of engineering work and plenty more to go. Metal fabrication costs alone are thousands of dollars, and we need your help. We need to raise $3,600 in order to accomplish this goal, however, if we do, the joys of our project will be experienced by thousands, and you will have helped provide that joy!

After YOUtopia 2018, the pair of these interactive sculptures will venture out into the large revolving world, looking for a home where people can enjoy them daily. Sophi KravItz, our engineering lead has already done this with interactive sculpture, the most recent piece having started with a Large Art Grant from Burning Man, 'Loquacious and Lovely, Mythical Talking Unicorns'. These friendly, magical creatures, had a residency at the Gerald R. Ford Presidential Museum in Grand Rapids Michigan. We pledge to do the same with Gathering of the Unlimited Devotion!

 

Please visit our Project Webpage for more information, and thanks for reading!
https://www.artimmerse.org/gotudevotion/

story:
The Cups (杯) 

How do you express yourself? Through how you act? Through language? 

 

Our short film "The Cups" or "杯" is an experimental art project that explores the relationship between similarity and dissimilarity. We also want to question the comfort of similarity in society through various female characters.

We are a student crew that includes 20 people from Royal Holloway, University of London. We are aiming for a goal of £500. This will help us with transportation, food, clothing design, etc. We will be giving out perks to those who donate certain amounts!

It's alright if you can't donate! Even just getting the word out is already a huge help and would be greatly appreciated.
